Manager Response: Thank for the great comments and for filing out a survey of your stay. We hope to see you again next time you are in town.

Summary: We stayed here for a quick Disneyland trip.  No problems with a late checkin.  Staff was very friendly and went out of their way to help in any way they could.  Shuttle to Disneyland $5/day and leaves twice an hour from both the hotel and disneyland.  The room was a little bit run down, but overall we had a good experience.  We would stay here again.
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to fill out a survey of our hotel and for your kind comments. We have shared these comments to the management staff in an effort to see if we can improve our overall quality of our hotel. Thank you for staying with us as we hope to see you again in the future.

Summary: Very kid friendly place to stay. Shuttle should be free to disneyland. The free breakfast was a great way to start the disneyland day!!! Pool was warm and clean. It cost to park your car in there lot that should be included with the hotel price.
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to fill out a survey and for your comments about your recent stay at our hotel. Its through feedback like this that we can learn and grow as a team to improve our overall product. We will use your experience to refine our operations. We hope to see you again next time you are in town.

Summary: They must be talking about Garden Grove CA Hampton  Inn.  Most pleasant stay ever, anywhere. Close to Disney, shuttle transport,comfortable beds, clean outdoor pool, large eating area for breakfast,lots of food choices, and outstanding staff.
Manager Response: We truly love to hear from our guest the great moments they had and what they loved most about the hotel. Thank you so much for staying with us and we hope to see you again in the future.

Summary: Hotel was nice, very busy location, very convenient.  Staff may be the most helpful of any I have stayed with in a long time.  When you travel you really want a great experience and the staff here went out of their way to exceed my expectations.  Thank you.
Manager Response: Thank you so much for your great comments and we hope to see you again in the future.

Summary: The hotel staff was very friendly and helpful. The room was clean and well maintained.  The bathroom was spacious with ample counter space.  The complementary breakfast was good, but I have stayed as some Hampton Inns with a better breakfast.  I would liked a larger variety of proteins.  The shuttle to Disneyland is very efficient and cost effective.
Manager Response: Thank you for filing out a review of your recent stay here at the Hampton. We always love feedback good or bad on how to improve our overall product. We will pass your comments along to the General Manager and to our kitchen staff to see if we can review our current buffet items. Thank you once again for your feedback and we hope to see you again in the future.

Summary: This hotel is clean & safe with excellent staff and a very comfortable business and family friendly atmosphere. Couldn't be much closer to Disneyland AND the conference center- and it is very reasonably priced!Plus you get Hilton Honors points- all in all a wonderful deal!
Manager Response: Thank you so much for your kind comments about your stay with us!

Summary: Got checked in and went to our room but the housekeeping staff was still finishing. They were very polite and apologetic while we waited. The room was spacious, and had a very smartly designed sleeping quarter for our daughter, equipped with its own dresser, TV with game system, and a cute little beanbag chair!  We made good use of the complimentary wi-fi as well. The included breakfast was excellent-many choices of warm and cold dishes, with ample seating areas.  The staff was attentive and efficient. With the location so convenient, we will be staying at the Hampton Inn again.
Manager Response: Thank you so much for taking the time to share your experience as we love to hear the good comments. Thank you for staying with us

Summary: We loved our stay at this hotel. Our flight arrived at about Noon, so we arrived at the hotel a few hours before check-in and the front desk clerk was very accommodating and let us check in early. The lobby area has recently been renovated and offers a nice, clean airy feel. The room was great, We had the one bedroom suite, which had a balcony that overlooked the pool. The room was well equipped with a fridge, stove, dishwasher, coffee maker, dishes, pots and pans, etc. There were two very comfy dbl beds in the bedroom. The room is quite large, so in my opinion it could have had more furniture there were only two chairs at the table and a small couch, so it if you had six people in the room there definitely would not have been enough seating. We were only three so it wasn't an
Manager Response: Thank you for your fantastic comments and we hope to see you again next time you are in town.

Summary Heading: Hampton Inn does it best for Business
Summary: This hotel was nicely upgraded with excellent friendly staff. The location is great for doing business in the Disney area with excellent access to highways for getting around the region with ease.  Parking is expensive at $12/day but that is expected in the area.
Manager Response: Thank you for your comments regarding your recent stay with us. We take all feedback very seriously. We continue to update and refine our operations so that we can meet and exceed our guest expectations. thank you once again for your comments and we hope to see you again in the future.

Summary Heading: Great service; great place to stay
Summary: I can't say enough about the service at this hotel!  Everyone on staff was so friendly and very helpful.  They took care of everything we asked from booking a tour to arranging for a cab to the airport.  When we ended up spending an extra night (after we had already checked out) due to a delayed flight, they checked us right back in at the same price and upgraded our room to a suite.  The breakfast was great - lots of choices. It was nice coming back after a day at Disneyland to find fresh popcorn and cookies for the taking.  We would definitely stay here again!
Manager Response: Thank you for staying with us and saying such great things. WE thank you for your business and hope t see you again in the future.

Summary: Check in was fast and front desk answered all the questions we had. They gave us a top floor room with a great view of the Disneyland fireworks. Continental breakfast had a great selection, with different specials everyday. Complimentary wifi was a bonus and the work out area and pool were kept clean and tidy. Our room was not a suite but we had a mini fridge and microwave. We had a late night flight, and were given a late check out at no extra charge. I will recommend this hotel to friends and family
Manager Response: THank you so much for taking the time to write about your experience at our hotel and thank you so much for staying with us. We hope to see you again in the future.

Summary: Great accommodations, great staff and the breakfast is one of the best.  I definitely recommend staying here.  Also, the hotel is so close to everything.  We stay there for everything (basketball tournaments, Disneyland, etc...)
Manager Response: Thank you for your kind comments as we look forward to seeing you again in the future.

Summary: This hotel is a zoo. The customer service is not geared toward a business traveler. If I have to come back for a conference I will book earlier and closer. If I were coming for Disney the rates would have to be amazing. The elevators are the biggest nightmare; I used the stairs for my of my visit. The Disney families let their kids use the elevators as a ride. On my last day it took 15 minutes for the elevator to make it to my floor; meanwhile another guest stole my cab. I did not enjoy my stay.
Manager Response: Thank you for your comments regarding your recent stay with us. We take all feedback very seriously. We continue to update and refine our operations so that we can meet and exceed our guest expectations. We will try our best to accommodate all visitors to our property however having a huge convention center and Disney less than a mile away can bring a verity of guest to the hotel. We will pass this on to our operations and see if they can target better practices so that our business travel feel just as welcome as our leisure travel guests. Thank you once again for your comments as we hope to serve you better in the future.

Summary: Very large suite with a full kitchen at a reasonable price. Great location. Walking distance to restaurants. Friendly and helpful staff. I would have given it an "Excellent" except the breakfast was virtually inedible.
Manager Response: Thank you for your kind comments and we hope to see you again in the future. We will forward your comments to our Restaurant and the Hampton Food beverage teams to help bring to light how our guests feel concerning our breakfast items. Thank you once again for your feedback

Summary: We had some small problems.  The company that they use to transport from the hotel to disney had to refund us our money because they never had a working ADA bus when we called.  I would suggest using a different form of transportation.  The front desk was always polite to me but extremely rude to my husband!
Manager Response: Thank you for your comments regarding your recent stay with us. We take all feedback very seriously. We will reach out to our Front Office operations and the shuttle company we use to help alleviate any issues moving forward. We continue to update and refine operations so that we can meet and exceed our guest expectations.

Summary: We stayed here for 3 nights starting on October 7th. The breakfast had a nice variety with 4 waffle makers so you didn't have to wait for others to finish. There was one meat offered daily and always cereal and bread options. I would say it is cafeteria style. The staff were all very kind and helpful, honestly some of the nicest we have seen. There are lots of young kids around so it was loud at times, but expected at a hotel near Disney. My one complaint is that the parking spaces were very small. We drive a compact car and had trouble getting out of the car without hitting another car. We would definitely stay here again.
Manager Response: Thank you for all your kind comments and we hope to see you agin when your back in town

Summary: Things that were good: Check in was fast, room accomodations were comfortable, breakfast had good variety, staff very friendly  Things less than good: Air conditioner was very noisy, pool was not available
Manager Response: Thank you for your comments regarding your recent stay with us. We take all feedback very seriously. We continue to update and refine our accommodations so that we can meet and exceed our guest expectations.

Summary: This is the most friendly, accommodating, clean, convenient hotel we have ever stayed at! We love the ALL WHITE bedding which is washed at every stay...I have never seen such friendly staff in my life! Everyone greets you, talks to you, asks if you can get anything! During the breakfast we had every person working ask if they could get us anything, carry our coffee, wipe anything, etc. It is very large and roomy in the breakfast area and set up perfectly! After breakfast an attendant handed out little boxes of mints to everyone! They really go the extra mile, and we cannot say enough how amazing our visit was!!! Our cousins frequent Disneyland all the time and ONLY stay at this hotel...now we too, will only stay HERE! My daughter has cancer and her hospital is about 30 min away,
Manager Response: Thank you! It was the best having you stay with us. thank you once again for the kind comments and we hope to see you again next time you are in town.  MIke at Hampton

Summary: First I want to thank Scott & Michael for making our Disneyland trip so relaxing and stress free. This hotel is very friendly, and accommodating. They put the customer in customer service. If you are going to Disneyland, you should stay at this hotel.
Manager Response: Thank you for your kind feed back and hope to see you again in the future.

Summary Heading: Nice rooms and lobby. Bad breakfast. Expensive parking.
Summary: The hotel rooms are comfortable and quiet. The lobby is very nice. Glad to have a fridge. The staff was nice and helpful. The to-go breakfasts were really handy, though they don't have them on the weekends and you would have to ask for them other days.  The biggest disappointment was the breakfast. The eggs were absolutely terrible. The daily specials were just okay. Wish they would've had more fruit. The juices weren't very good, either.   Parking is very expensive, even when they offer it cheaper.
Manager Response: Thank you for all your applied feed back as we will use it to always refine our operations in an all out effort to improve our overall product. Thank you once again for staying with us and expressing your concerns during your stay.

Summary: I love this hotel. The staff always goes above and beyond. I stay here at least 6-7 times a year for business and pleasure. Anytime I have to be in the Orange County area, I always try to stay here. On my most-recent visit, I had the privilege of being the guest-of-the-day, which included a free room upgrade and free parking. I love this hotel and all of its staff. Ask for Anna for any special accommodations!
Manager Response: Thank you so much and congrats on gues tof the day! we hope to see you again in the future and always thank you for staying with us and the kind compliments

Summary: Arrived Tues 10/1/13. Immediately taken care of by Scott. Checked in, no hassle, no problems - fast & easy! :) once we arrived in to our room (room #100), our toilet was broken - no water in tank, didn't flush, flush-handle seemed to work but without water in the tank, it wouldn't flush. Called front desk to request maintenance come out - gentleman (maintenance) did come out immediately; he found an issue with the valve - he fixed it instantly; from start to finish, this took about 10-15minutes, pretty good! :) Our room was clean and kept up every day. The breakfast meal was always hot/ready for us: scrambled eggs or omelettes when we stayed - sausage - variety of breads: croissants, danishes, muffins, bagels, sliced bread, hot/ready made oatmeal, ready to make waffles, fresh
Manager Response: Thank you so much for your awesome review about our hotel. We truly love to hear back from our guest and know they were well taken care of. we have shared your comments with the whole staff and hope to see you again in the future.

Summary: They had Disney coloring pages and crayons at the front counter for the kids. They also had a very large space for breakfast in the lobby that looked like a modern restaurant space. The rooms were top notch like all Hampton Inn's that we've been to. The have a guest shop and the prices were very reasonable. It only took 5 min to drive to the Disneyland parking structure from this location. It was a very pleasant stay and we would go back again!
Manager Response: Thank for the awesome comments as we look forward to seeing you again in the future!

Summary: We thought this hotel was great.The hotel staff was professional, accommodating and very nice.The hotel was clean and beds where very comfortable.If we where to be picky,we would suggest a better selection for breakfast,like maybe an omelet bar and/or vegetation options.We are annual pass holders and visit Disneyland 4 or 5 times a year and have stayed at a-lot of the hotels in the area and would rank this hotel in our top 3(excluding Disney properties) because of the price,staff,cleanliness and breakfast.We would definitely stay here again.
Manager Response: Thank you for staying with us and for all your hreat comments, we hope to see you again when your back in town!

Summary: We had an excellent stay at the Hampton Inn in Garden Grove, CA. This place is prepared to have children stay. The pool is fantastic, the baby pool is fantastic and the breakfasts are exactly what your family needs to start the day off right! I would highly recommend!
Manager Response: Thank you so much for your awesome comments and for staying with us we hope to see you again in the future!

Summary: Friendly personnel. They greeted us every time we passed the front desk. Room was great, very comfortable and quite. Very nice hot breakfast.  Waffles, pre-made omelets, sliced sausages, yogurt, fruit, cereal, etc.  Price was excellent.  On-line AAA discount really helped the pocket book.  Would come back again.
Manager Response: THank you for your kind remarks we always appreciate the good feedback

Summary: I booked this hotel last minute, and when I walked through the lobby I saw several families.  I thought I wasn't going to get any sleep.  I ask the young male front desk employee if he could put me somewhere quite. He looked and switched my room number. He helped me locate the printer to print out my boarding pass.  After printing my boarding pass, I headed up to the room. The room was clean, in great shape, and very comfortable.  I didn't hear a sound the whole night. The black out curtains did a great job.  There is several restaurants very close to the hotel for easy eating. It is also like 20mins from the Long Beach airport which makes it a very easy commute.  I would stay there again if I was in the area.
Manager Response: Thank you for your comments regarding your recent stay with us. We are truly grateful to have hotel team members that enjoy being of service to our hotel guests and make you feel comfortable while staying with us. We know that you have many choices for hotel accommodations when staying in the Garden Grove area and we appreciate you giving us the opportunity to host your accommodations.

Summary: Hampton inn at disneyland is very close to disneyland,in walking distance. There are various restaurants surrounding the hotel.The hotel itself is very clean and everyone is very helpful and friendly.
Manager Response: Thank you for your comments regarding your recent stay with us. We are truly grateful to have hotel team members that enjoy being of service to our hotel guests and make you feel comfortable while staying with us. We know that you have many choices for hotel accommodations when staying in the Garden Grove area and we appreciate you giving us the opportunity to host your accommodations.

Summary: The hotel was wonderful!  The lobby was colorful and modern.  All of the staff was friendly and went out of their way to make sure all the guests were happy and enjoying their stay.  The room I stayed in was very clean and there were no problems whatsoever.  It was very convenient to get to Disneyland from the hotel and the staff was very knowledgable about the public transportation and park info.
Manager Response: Thank you for your comments regarding your recent stay with us. We are truly grateful to have hotel team members that enjoy being of service to our hotel guests and make you feel comfortable while staying with us. We know that you have many choices for hotel accommodations when staying in the Garden Grove area and we appreciate you giving us the opportunity to host your accommodations.

Summary Heading: Great Stay wlhile on Vacation in Disneyland
Summary: Our family of 4 stayed here for 3 nights while visiting Anaheim and Disneyland.  We were welcomed by their front desk person, Hugo.  He was very professional and informative and provided us with an early check-in.  We booked a room with 2 Queen beds with a kitchen suite.  The room was the size of 2 rooms and very spacious, 2 TVs, sofa, eating area and a full kitchen.  It also had a balcony so we could watch the Disneyland fireworks each night with our kids from there.  The pool was clean and we really liked the fact that they had a kids pool for our young kids.  The breakfast was very impressive and had a variety of choices from waffles, eggs, bread, cereal to name just a few.  The breakfast area and lobby have been nicely renovated with a new look.  They also had guest laundry
Manager Response: Thank you for your comments regarding your recent stay with us. We are truly grateful to have hotel team members that enjoy being of service to our hotel guests and make you feel comfortable while staying with us. We know that you have many choices for hotel accommodations when staying in the Garden Grove area and we appreciate you giving us the opportunity to host your accommodations.

Summary Heading: Great hotel in a convenient location
Summary: Great hotel in a convenient location. The waffle at breakfast was tasty. The staff greeted us and quickly checked us the wifi was great and was included in the price. They do charge for parking which is unusual at a Hampton Inn.  What was chintzy was they charged $5.00 a person for a 5 minute ride to Disneyland. The Candy Cane hotel offers complimentary transportation. If you are going to the parks ask about transportation when you book the room. There are many choices similar to the Hampton Inn that are either within walking distance or provide free transportation.

Summary: Stayed here three times and each time have thoroughly enjoyed it.   Lovely clean rooms, nice buffet style breakfast, great wi-fi but most of all great staff.  Lovely restaurant opposite (Bucca di Beppos) which is convenient for eating in the evening.
Manager Response: Thank you for your comments regarding your recent stay with us. We are truly grateful to have hotel team members that enjoy being of service to our hotel guests and make you feel comfortable while staying with us. We know that you have many choices for hotel accommodations when staying in the Garden Grove area and we appreciate you giving us the opportunity to host your accommodations

Summary: Great for business traveler working at the Anaheim Convention Center who can't afford the hotels a little closer.  Free WIFi was fast and easy to access.  Complimentary breakfast is no frills but free so well worth it!
Manager Response: Thank you for your comments regarding your recent stay with us. We are very appreciative of the feed back because it's through these comments that we can learn and grow as a team to improve our overall product.  We hope to see you in again next time you are in town.

Summary Heading: Best Place to Stay in the Area
Summary: I got food poisoning via a nearby restaurant (Ruth Chris) and spent an entire night and day holed up in my room.  The staff brought me Sprite, ice and checked in on my multiple times.  The beds are super comfy, rooms are clean, great location perfect for both business and Disneyland fun.  Never stayed here before, but will never go any place else.
Manager Response: Thank you for your comments regarding your recent stay with us. We are truly grateful to here comments such as this from our guest. We look forward to seeing you again in the future.

Summary: Just recently stayed here for 4 nights.  The hotel was great.  Staff is super friendly and helpful.  The free breakfast was delicious every morning, the staff there was also very friendly.  We purchased the Disney shuttle tickets, super convenient to get to and from the parks.  Also took advantage of the hot tub after long days at the parks.  Room was spacious and comfortable. Bathroom is good size with tub/shower and large sink vanity area.  Would definitely stay here again.
Manager Response: Thank you for your comments regarding your recent stay with us. We are truly grateful to have hotel team members that enjoy being of service to our hotel guests and make you feel comfortable while staying with us. We know that you have many choices for hotel accommodations when staying in the Garden Grove area and we appreciate you giving us the opportunity to host your accommodations.

Summary Heading: Large Suite, Friendly Helpful Staff, Easy Walk to Convention Ctr
Summary: The hotel is located on Harbor Blvd in Anaheim near the convention centre where I am attending an SAP conference.  The rooms have a very generous livingroom/kitchenette area and a wonderful large bedroom.  The kitchenette includes an apartment sized fridge, 2 burner stove and microwave. You could easily make meals here.  The rooms are clean, the beds are comfy, and the basic amenities are all here. The wifi is included in my room, and it is normal speed, not like some places where the wifi is so slow you can barely use it.  The in-room coffee is farily bad, and the first day they had left only decaf -yuck!!  There were no teas left in the room, but perhaps I could request them.   The air conditioning is awesome, almost verging on a bit too cold at times, but I love a cool room
Manager Response: Thank you for your comments regarding your recent stay with us. We are truly grateful to have hotel team members that enjoy being of service to our hotel guests and make you feel comfortable while staying with us. We do have tea as a request for our rooms however if you back in town we will remember to have your room prepared. We know that you have many choices for hotel accommodations when staying in the Garden Grove area and we appreciate you giving us the opportunity to host your accommodations.

Summary Heading: So Many Better Choices Close By
Summary: I was very disappointed with the room, it seemed in desperate need of a facelift. The common areas, specifically the halls were very warm. For the same price the night before I stayed 100 yards away the night before at the Embassy Suites, for the same price and the quality and was 10 times better.   The front desk staff I must say was very nice and polite, but that only goes so far in a property that needs some capital improvement.
Manager Response: Thank you for your comments regarding your recent stay with us. I have brought your comments to the General Manager in hopes to improve our overall product. I know we just finished renovating lobby. After the Lobby the rooms portion would be the next step of our process.  Thank you so much for your feed back as we look forward to serving your better in the future.

Summary: A lot of space for improvement. Ran into some problems as soon as I checked in and going further with my stay I caught a couple of other things that could have been avoided if things were payed a little more attention too. Overall my stay was okay. Great value for what it is.
Manager Response: Thank you for your comments regarding your recent stay with us.We will be addressing all concerns mentioned with the General Manager and the Director of Operations to improve our overall product.  We take all feedback very seriously. We continue to update and refine our accommodates so that we can meet and exceed our guest expectations.

Summary: Friendly staff!  Helped out with some internet issues.  Let us check bags on the first day when rooms were not ready to check in.  Very clean hotel.  Would strongly reccommend this if you're looking for a good value near Disneyland.  Great Breakfast each morning.  Consider getting the bus pass, the walk is a little further than I cared for to Disneyland.
Manager Response: Thank you for your comments regarding your recent stay with us. We are truly grateful to have hotel team members that enjoy being of service to our hotel guests and make you feel comfortable while staying with us. We know that you have many choices for hotel accommodations when staying in the Garden Grove area and we appreciate you giving us the opportunity to host your accommodations.

Summary Heading: Could not ask for anything more
Summary: Hotels near Disneyland can be touch and go - either you fork over a ton of dough for on property comfort, or you roll the dice with the surrounding hotels (which are really motels). I don't know why I didn't consider staying here before, being a Hilton Honors member, and I'm glad I did. It offers the typical quality levels you find at a Hampton Inn - great beds, reliable TV, privacy and a fridge. The light switches are old, but hey, at least they work! The breakfast was fine, with the added "plus" of daily specials offered (I had the blueberry waffles). You pay for parking, but hey, it's Disneyland, where parking is a luxury. It's a long, long walk to the parks, but they offer shuttles, which you pay for. But if you need to be in the area, you could do a lot worse.   But above
Manager Response: Thank you for your comments regarding your recent stay with us. We are truly grateful to have hotel team members that enjoy being of service to our hotel guests and make you feel comfortable while staying with us. We know that you have many choices for hotel accommodations when staying in the Garden Grove area and we appreciate you giving us the opportunity to host your accommodations.

Summary: We recently traveled to California to see Disneyland and California Adventures. We stayed at the Hampton Inn in Garden Grove which is approximately two miles from Disneyland. Hampton Inn was Clean, the employees were very helpful. Breakfast was amazing with waffles, biscuits and gravy, cereal,fruit, eggs, juice. Well worth the stay. I would recommend it to anyone! They even have a shuttle that goes from the hotel to the gates at Disneyland/California adventures. It leaves twice on the hour. Great Service!
Manager Response: We appreciate your feedback. We are very happy to hear our staff was great. We appreciate you choosing to stay at our hotel and hope to see you again when you are in town.

Summary: We had a great weekend at Disneyland for the Half Marathon.  The hotel is close enough to the park to walk home and there are cheap shuttles too.  Hampton always has comfortable rooms and fantastic amenities.  Thanks for a great stay!
Manager Response: We appreciate your feedback. We are very happy to hear our staff was great. We appreciate you choosing to stay at our hotel and hope to see you again in the future.

Summary Heading: Looks great but is just good
Summary: The restaurant in the hotel is very expensive but within a 10 minute walk in any direction are all the usual fast food offenders and other more restaurant (than fast food) or themed places in the outlet mall.  Make sure you book.
Manager Response: We appreciate you taking the time to complete our survey regarding your recent stay with us. On behalf of our entire staff here at the Hampton Inn & Suites, we apologize for the concerns you have about your experience at this hotel. We appreciate the feedback and we will use it to refine our operations in the hope that upon your next visit, we will meet and exceed your expectations.

Summary Heading: Good value and close to Disneyland
Summary: I stayed here with my family for our Disneyland vacation and it was a great hotel overall. The 1 bedroom suite was spacious enough for 3 adults and 2 children. The free breakfast was great and saved time in the morning. The only downside was we had to pay for parking as we rented a vehicle.
Manager Response: We appreciate you taking the time to complete our survey regarding your recent stay with us. On behalf of our entire staff here at the Hampton Inn & Suites, we apologize for the concerns you have about your experience at this hotel. We appreciate the feedback and we will use it to refine our operations in the hope that upon your next visit, we will meet and exceed your expectations.

Summary: Everything is what you would expect with a Hilton property.  No surprises and everything worked well.  Location was within 3 miles of Disneyland and other restaurants and hotels were nearby.  Nice frozen yogurt shop right across the street and Target was only a block away.
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to complete the survey regarding your recent stay with us. We are truly grateful to have hotel team members that enjoy being of service to our hotel guests and make you feel comfortable while staying with us. We know that you have many choices for hotel accommodations when staying in the Garden Grove area and we appreciate you giving us the opportunity to host your accommodations.

Summary: If you are looking for an extremely clean, comfortable, quiet hotel in the Disneyland, Sea World, Annaheim Stadium area, this is the motel for you.  The staff is exceptionally courteous and helpful, the rooms are large and the beds (with fresh duvet cover nightly) are amazingly comfortable.  The complimentary breakfast was very good, although not the best I've EVER had.  We were more than happy with our stay, and would not only highly recommend it to others, but will definitely stay there again ourselves.  You won't be disappointed.

We know that you have many choices for hotel accommodations when staying in the Garden Grove area and we appreciate you giving us the opportunity to host your accommodations.

Summary: We stayed here for 6 nights, we were visiting Disneyland. All renovations are completed. This hotels pool is better then any of the pools with the neighboring hotels. The staff are amazing, the front desk always make sure you are greeting and make sure they help you out. The breakfast saved me and my wife a lot of money. We would eat and go to Disneyland. If I came back to visit I would stay here.
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to complete a review regarding your recent stay with us. We are truly grateful to have hotel team members that enjoy being of service to our hotel guests and make you feel comfortable while staying with us. We know that you have many choices for hotel accommodations when staying in the Garden Grove area and we appreciate you giving us the opportunity to host your accommodations.

Summary: Our family of 4 couldn't have been happier at this location. Our room included a kids room with their own tv and even an bean bag. Summary Heading: Great place to stay for a family vacation!
Summary: We had a great stay at the Hampton Inn.  The staff were friendly and helpful, the rooms were clean and spacious, and the location to Disneyland was convenient. And it was the most reasonably-priced hotel during our two-week trip to California.  The only negative was that the hotel was quite full, making the elevators slow and the breakfast seating crowded.  But we would definitely recommend and stay here again!

The hot breakfast varies day to day with the following eggs, turkey sausge, western omeletes & daily they have yogurt & light yogurt, bananas oranges & apples, delicious make your own waffles, cereal, oj, milk, cranberry juice, toast muffins & danish.  Its a good breakfast especially because its free.

Summary: While the lobby is in the middle of a reno, we still had a good breakfast. The rooms are still a little worn (as are most of the hotel chains in the same are) but VERY GOOD value for the money. The room sound proofing is excellent and their beds are very good as well. We did not hear a peep from any other room, which ofter happens in the newer Hamtpon Inns.Staff was excellent and very helpful. Would stay there again. The little kiddie pool was also perfect for our youngest grandchild. Wish we would have gotten a king suite as that sleeps 6 with a roll-away bed.

Summary Heading: Hotel under renovations wish I had known before we arrived
Summary: Our family of 5 (2 adults and 3 teens) chose to stay here while we visited Disneyland and California Adventure for 3 nights.  The great things about this hotel... -the staff were helpful and always willing to assist in any way they could -we could see the fireworks from Disneyland from our balcony -easy access to Disneyland -easy access to eating locations -our room was large and clean -the beds were very comfortable -there was free wireless internet in the room   My first opinion of this hotel was disappointing at first.  We arrived at 9 pm and walked into the lobby of the hotel to find it all under construction.  The flooring was all dug up, there was construction equipment and it was dusty.  I was about to turn around and walk out, but I thought I would check out the rooms
Manager Response: Thank you for your review.  We appreciate your patience through our renovation.  Several of the amenities you spoke of were temporarily unavailable during the renovation while we are enhancing our offerings.  I do hope that you will visit us again when visiting the Anaheim area.

Summary: I wish I would have been told, at the time I booked my room, that the hotel lobby, dining area, and parking lot were scheduled to be renovated during my stay.  I would have elected to stay at a different hotel.  When I asked about changing to a different location it was made clear by the hotel staff that it would be up to me to make those arrangements.  I did not want to take that much additional time away from my family vacation to sit down and spend ¬Ω a day trying to find a room in a different hotel at the last minute.
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to provide your feedback.  We apologize that you were unaware of scheduled improvements.  We do hope that you will return to see the finished product.

Summary: During our visit over July 4th weekend the hotel lobby was being remodeled.  It was a bit chaotic for entry and exit points.  The limited front desk staff most times was annoying.  The room was clean and location was perfect for our visit to the Disney Theme parks.  I myself did not have the breakfast, but my son was fine with it.

Summary: Room was good and spacious. Buffet was not impressive, staff not friendly or helpful, if I wasn't at Disney all day and only used this place to sleep, I would not stay again. The hotel staff were not rude, but they did not go out of there way to inform or make you feel welcome. No one told us about disney shuttle, no one told us hotel was under renovations, you were walking through a mess all the time, and eating with noise of construction all morning.

I look forward to speaking with you.

Summary: Overall good value.  Hotel was experiencing renovations to lobby while we were there, but was not a bother.  Staff were very helpful and friendly.  Rooms were roomy and adequate and the convenience of a hot breakfast was nice.  Not a high end stay, but definitely an excellent economical choice for a family.

Summary: Hotel was under construction so a real mess.  Also, this hotel gets a lot of tourists for Disneyland so unless you are one of them, I suggest staying somewhere less chaotic.  Breakfast selection is just OK for today's standards.  Waffles, scrambled eggs, breads etc.

Summary Heading: Maybe we caught them on a bad weekend?
Summary: The rooms were fairy clean and the proximity to disneyland and several beaches was great for the money. However, upon arriving and attempting to enter the front lobby we were greeted by a manager who explained they were remodeling and to use a side exit. The bottom floor of the hotel was dusty and stinky- they were grinding or sanding and painting- it was so loud that i could barely tell the person my name to check in. They had not put up any type of plastic to contain the construction dust from customers, but had covered rugs in plastic to protect them. Someone came walking by with a container filled with liqui you would use to spray pesticides and it was leaking on the floor. It was a bit upsetting to have to take two small kids through the dusty mess to get on the elevator
Manager Response: I apologize for the incovenience of our renovation.  We are trying to keep the impact to a minimum, but at times some things are unavoidable.  Please contact me directly at the property as I would like to discuss your experience furthur.  Thank you for the valued feedback.

Summary: My son and I stayed at Hampton Inn June 3-9.   The hotel was doing some renovation in the lobby area.... but the staff could not have been more accommodating.   First of all,  we arrived at the hotel at around 10:30am.... check in wasn't supposed to be until 3pm.... but they were able to check it anyway.... and on top of that even let us eat breakfast!  Everyday we checked with someone at the front desk and they were always very pleasant to help us out regarding ideas for things to do that day.  This is not a five star hotel,  but if certain amenities are not that important to you,  this hotel will suit you well.  The hotel has a pool but we never used it.
Manager Response: Thank you for the kind review of our hotel.  I am glad that you had an enjoyable trip.  Please visit us again to see all of the completed improvements.

Summary: I shopped around Booking.com for a nice hotel close to Disneyland.  This was perfect.  Remodeling of breakfast area was being done but not an issue.  Breakfast was great every morning.  We were one mile from Disneyland and 1/2 mile from Disneyland parking.  I had purchased my Disney tickets at AAA and they included free Disney parking.  Doesn't get any better than that.  Drive to free parking every morning.  Jump on the bus to Disneyland and have a great day.  Come back to the Hampton Inn to a nice clean room with nice soft beds with lots of pillows.  Was a great stay.  Will definitely do it again.
Manager Response: Thank you for the glowing review of our property.  I am glad that you had a wonderful trip.  We look forward to serving you again in the future.

Summary: Nice Hampton Inn - rooms comfortable.  Close to Disneyland and beach areas.  Breakfast area was under renovation but should be nice when completed.  Temporary breakfast area food items needed more attention

Summary Heading: Typical Hampton Inn in remodel. Roomy suites.
Summary: The Hampton Inn Anaheim, Garden Grove is in a good location at the north side of a pooled parking lot of a group of hotels include  Hilton Garden Inn, Embassy Suites, etc. It is not too high, but on the top floor, you can see the disneyland, and the view is good. The king's suites are roomy. the furniture are old fashinged, dark brown color need to be replaced with lighter color furniture to suit guests visiting Disneyland.  The free breakfast is standard american breakfast include scrambled egg and greasy meat, not on my diet. The rest are skimpy. And that constitute all the hot food for the morning. The rest of starchy food include bread for toasting, Warfer, Ccold cereal and juices. It closes by 10 am on sunday and I missed that. But then I didn't really miss the breakfast
Manager Response: Thank you for your valued feedback.  We would love to have you back once our renovation is complete to see our redisgned lobby and common area enhancements.

Summary: Took the Shuttle from LAX & it dropped us right at the front of the Hotel (After it goes round other Hotels, dropping other passenger off).  As mentioned by others, there was some renovations going on in the Lobby area.  You won't see the Front Desk as you Enter, instead it was located inside on the left; away from arriving Guest view.  Instead behind the Wall that separate the Entrance from the Temporary Breakfast room is the Computer / Printer for guest usage.    Remember to do your homework on getting around to the mall etc. before you go.  Don't bother asking the front desk people how to go orangethorpe to shop (Or Even what Bus to take because they don't know & will offer to call a Cab for you instead).  They don't even know the bus fare is already US$2.00 when they said
Manager Response: Thank you for your feedback.  I apologize for the lack of information offered to you.  We will definitely use this as a training opportunity with the staff.

Summary: What you would expect from a Hampton Inn. But a clean, good sized room. no complaints and great for Disney and area attractions.

Summary: Friendly environment. Clean rooms. Very accommodating and close to many restaurants and Disney attractions. There is always someone to greet you and give you advice on what is happening in and around the hotel.

Manager Response: Thank you for your feedback.  I apologize for our dust.  We are now almost complete and we do hope that you will visit us again to see the enhancements

Summary: the staff is very warm and friendly. they are currently renovating which didnt bother me, but they do work late into the night. the breakfast was not up to par but the breakfast staff was good at keeping up on the food. i would stay here again because of the friendly service and the rooms are good sized.
Manager Response: Thank you for the wonderful feedback.  I am glad that you enjoyed your stay.  Please join us again in the future to see all of the enhancements to the property.

Summary Heading: Yes it is a 2 star hotel!
Summary: I stayed in a room designed for disabilities. The shower was dirty and tirreible. Beside that I have no complaints about this hotel. However somehow, this hotel is just not like the other Hampton Inns I stayed in the past. It made be think more about the reasons why Hampton Inn dropped itself to 2 star hotel from 3 star! The staff is wonderful though....
Manager Response: I am sorry to hear of the unfortunate issues that you encountered during your stay.  I would love to talk with you more about your stay.  Please contact me at the hotel.  It is our efffort to always exceed your expectations.

Summary: This was a great place to stay. It was affordable and family friendly. The breakfast was vast with lot of meal choices. The rooms were very clean. And the coffee was offered 24 hours a day. I will stay here again if I am in the area.
Manager Response: Thank you for the kind review.  We loook forward to serving you again in the future.

Summary: It was a great price but I was disappointed as I have stayed in other Hampton Inn's. The AC was too loud and although the lobby was under renovation they had to shut off water. This was a great inconvenience for myself and my mother.
Manager Response: I apologize for the incoveniences during your stay.  Unfortunately during renovations these thing arise.  I would love for you to come visit us again post renovation to see all of the new upgrades we have added.

Summary Heading: No complaints: comfy, clean & very friendly staff!
Summary: Stayed at this place as a part of a family gathering (not associated with a trip to Disneyland!).  Checked in pretty late because of flight issues, and staff was fantastic.  The room itself is quiet and clean, and even though there's construction going on in the lobby, I didn't find it to hinder our experience at all.  I agree with other reviews on the breakfast--for a "free to all guests" spread, I'm very impressed at the variety, continuous refilling and general service. They literally have 2-3 wait staff their in this continental buffet who make sure everything is running smoothly from 6am-10am--and there are A LOT of people who they have to serve, so I was quite impressed.  Food array ranges from fruit, yoghurt, cereal, bagels/toast to hot items such as eggs, bacon, oatmeal
Manager Response: Thank you for your kind feedback.  We look forward to seeing you again in the future.

Summary: The hotel was very comfortable and as far as sleeping - it was a very quiet place.  The location was not in walking distance to disneyland, but with the ART - it made the ride there and back convenient.   I truly would recommmend this hotel to any of my friends or relatives.  We travel alot and I have never stayed at a Hampton Inn and I was  more than impressed
Manager Response: Thank you for the wonderful review. We look forward to serivng you again.

Summary: I stayed at the Hampton  for about 4 nights, I was in town for a conference. I had an excellent stay. The staff were very friendly and helpful specially Hugo. The room was very nice and clean.Execellent breakfast, and  internet service.  Overall, I had a very good experience and I will stay there again.
Manager Response: Thank you for your kind words regardin our staff.  I will definitely share this with Hugo.  We are glad that you had a pleasnat stay with us and we look forward to seeing you again in the future.

Summary Heading: Great Place to Stay While in Anaheim
Summary: Booked this hotel for a quick 4 night stay while on our way to San Diego. Coming from the east coast of Canada we weren't familiar with California so we did some research and found this hotel to have pretty good reviews and it fell in our price range.  To our surprise, it exceeded our expectations on all levels. From the time we walked through the front door and I tasted the fresh fruit water, I was hooked! Upon heading to the front desk we were greeted by friendly smiles and within minutes the people actully made us feel like very "valued" customers. We were asked if we had a room preference and I asked if we could view the firewroks from any of the rooms. They gave us a room on the 7th floor and the view of the fireworks was perfect. The room was large, clean and comfortable
Manager Response: Thank you for your very kind review.  I am happy that you had such an enjoyable stay.  We look forward to seeing you again in the future.

Summary Heading: Sufficient Hotel for our Travel Needs
Summary: We chose this hotel due to price and proximity of Disneyland.  They offer a shuttle to the parks every 30 minutes.  We paid $22 for a family of 4.  The interior is extremely outdated, but they are currently undergoing renovations in thier lobby and main area.  We got a suite, which has a kitchen, pull-out sofa bed and separate room with two double beds.  The beds were very comfortable.  Maid service very good.  The pool area has a 1 foot kiddie pool, in addition to a large pool, and a hot tub.  Complimentary breakfast was nice, but no room to sit and eat the first day (we had to take food back to our room.)  We would stay here again when visiting the Disneyland parks, but not one of my favorite hotels due to ambiance or lack thereof.    Overall, sufficient hotel for our travel
Manager Response: Thank you for your kind review.  I am glad you enjoyed your stay with us.  I do hope you will stay with us again to enjoy our new renovations.  We are definitely adding in the ambiance you were looking for.

Summary: Excellent value hotel within walking distance of convention and variety of restaurants.  Inexpensive hotel van to Disneyland.  Surprising quiet rooms considering the many families staying at hotel.   Free breakfast and refreshments.  Coffee/tea bar all day long was great.   Suites have full kitchen.
Manager Response: Thank you for the great review.  We look forward to serving you again in the future.

Summary Heading: A nice place for families at this pricepoint
Summary: I stayed here for just one night at the end of April, sharing a room with a friend who was visiting for three nights. I had booked the room at the state government rate, which came out to $98 including taxes for a standard double queen. Free-wifi and breakfast; self parking is $12. "Local transportation" was advertised for a fee. On the advice of other travelers, I asked for a Disneyland facing room; my Hilton profile already indicates I prefer high floor rooms away from the elevator.  When we arrived around 3:30, I was surprised to see the hotel was undergoing construction, as I didn't recall seeing that anywhere on their website (but did find a tiny blurb when I checked later). The staff assured us we wouldn't hear any noise after 4:00 p.m. or before 8:30 and I didn't.   Our
Manager Response: Thank you for your very detailed feedback.   I am glad that you enjoyed your stay with us and our renovation dust was not too much of an inconvenience during your stay.  I hope that you will get a chance to come see us again after our renovation is complete.

Summary: Normally, we stay at a hotel much closer to Disneyland, but this time we tried the Hampton Inn.  We enjoyed our stay very much.  The fitness room is being renovated so I didn't get to utilize that, but I did walk around Disneyland for 3 days.    My only complaint has to do with the front desk not knowing exactly when the last shuttle would leave Disneyland.  They said it was an hour after the parks close.  Well, California Adventure closed at 9, but the World of Color show was scheduled for 9:15.  If you go by an hour after the closing, then the last shuttle was at 10.  World of Color lasted until 9:45 and we were RUNNING to make the last shuttle.  After walking around all day at the parks, it was exhausting.  The last shuttle actually left at 10:30, but the front desk did not
Manager Response: Thank you for your kind feedback.  I do aopolgize for the confusion regarding the shuttle times. We will definitely put a better system in place to notify our guest of changing park hours.

Summary Heading: Great value - our favorite hotel in the Disneyland area!
Summary: We have stayed at this Hampton Inn several times - it's now our first choice for our trips to Disneyland.  The proximity to Disneyland is great and the hotel's shuttle is a reliable mode of transportation for those without a car.  The rooms are great - very clean and the beds are incredibly comfortable after a long day in the parks!  My only "complaint" is the cost to park - $12 a day.  But all in all, the value you get is tough to beat.  The complimentary breakfast is also a nice perk!  The hotel staff are incredibly friendly and accommodating!
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to offer us your feedback.  We are glad that you enjoyed your stay with us and we look forward to seeing you again in the future.

Summary: This hotel is centrally located, really nice, has great staff and a good complimentary breakfast.  Good beds, roomy baths, and suites if you want them. We stayed as a family in a suite and it was fun to have a place to gather and visit. The kitchen was well equipped and the fridge was full size.
Manager Response: Thank you for your kind review of our location.  We are glad that you enjoyed your stay with us.  We look forward to seeing you again in the future,

Summary: NIce front staff. Very average Hampton Inn. I have stayed in nicer ones. The breakfast was nice but very crowded about 7 in the morning, just before Disneyland opens. Across from Target so that was nice.
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to rewview our property.  We strive to be above average in our accommodations to our guests.  We are currently undergoing a renovation to our property and we would love to have you back in the future to experience all of the changes.  Your feedback definitely contributes to the upgrades we implement and we love to share them with . We look forward to seeing you in the future.

Summary: Stayed two nights for vacation to Disneyland.  Hotel was clean, quite, and the shuttle service made it convenient.  Complimentary breakfast was excellent and well stocked / staffed even with a very large group of teenagers eating at the same time my family was.  Customer service was friendly and great as well.  Great place to stay at a great value.  The only negative for me was the price differential for the ability to change or cancel reservations.
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to offer us your feedback.  I am glad you enjoyed your stay with us.  We do look forward to hosting you again in the future.

Summary: Stayed at the Hampton Inn when visiting Disneyland.  The hotel is a short walk from Disneyland and Downtown Disney, but also provides a shuttle service to these attractions for a fee.  The hotel and room was clean with a very friendly staff who answered all questions that we had.  The room was large and overlooked the pool\hot tub which were a nice size and also well kept.  A continental breakfast was available with hot and cold items and kept well stocked since it was quite crowded the two days we stayed there.  There is no onsite restaurant, but there are many local restaurants within less than a mile from the hotel.  All in all a great hotel and I would recommend staying here for you visit to Anaheim.
Manager Response: Thank you for your kind review.  I am glad you enjoyed your stay with us.  We hope to see you again in the future.

Summary Heading: All around good, safe family hotel near Disneyland
Summary: The best thing about this hotel is its people. From the welcoming front desk staff to the friendly maintenance staff and thorough housekeeping staff, this hotel feels very clean, warm and inviting. The only negative is the somewhat tired feel of the rooms themselves even with the obvious attempts to improve the decor. While the outside of the hotel and the lobby look newer and modern, the rooms feel like 2-star rooms with their popcorn ceilings, heavy doors to the bathroom, old-fashioned sliding mirror doors and cold lighting throughout. I've stayed in nicer Hamptons in much more remote areas, so I was surprised that such a marquis location near disneyland would feel so old and outdated inside. The location feels a little run down compared to areas closer to DL, but the hotel is
Manager Response: Thank you for providing us with great feeback.  We are constantly looking at ways to improve our property and we rely heavily on your responses to make sure we can provide the best accommodations to you.  We look forward to seeing you again in the future.

Summary: We visited the Hampton Inn and Suites in February/March 2013. The room was quite nice. We opted for a suite with two queen beds and a kitchenette. The linens on the beds were very nice and the beds were comfortable. There were always ample towels left for us. It is about a 15-20 minute walk to Disneyland so we bought a shuttle pass, which was reasonably priced. The free breakfast was always yummy and there was always staff stocking up the items. They also have free breakfast to go, which contained water, fruit, granola bar and a muffin. We would grab one or two to take along to Disney with us. The staff was always happy to help and even arranged for a car to drive us to the hockey game. The only complaint I had was that the sofa bed was the lumpiest thing in the world. We
Manager Response: Thank you for offering great feedback to us.  I am happy that you enjoyed your stay with us.  We look forward to having you stay with us again in the future.

Summary: I've never met a friendlier staff. For one the woman at the front desk was so sweet and helpful. She got us a free upgraded room to accommodate a few friends that came to join us for the wkend at disneyland. She was all smiles and happy to help.we were late check ins..at around 1030p. When we got up the next morning, she was either still there or there again as smiley and helpful as can be with our ticket purchases.  They have one of the nicer complimentary breakfast bars I've seen in a while. If they woulda had bacon and different kind of eggs, we wouldn't have gone anywhere else for breakfast! (Hubby likes eggs a little softer) I was pleasantly surprised by how comfortable the beds were. We slept great. Had no problems with noises from other rooms. If there was a problem, they
Manager Response: I am so excited that we surprised you with our service.  It is our effort to always exceed our guest expecations.  I look forward to seeing you again on your next visit.

Summary: We arrived late March for one week for a spring break vacation.  Efficient and friendly check in.  Able to be accomondated for higher level and view of disney fireworks in evening.  Room was reasonably quiet, just depends on who your neighbours are and how considerate they are.  ie.  coming late at night or waking up early in am, just be as quiet as you can.  The free internet was fast and convenient.  Able to print off boarding passes with lobby computer.  The breakfast was varied in the mornings and gave us an excellent start to the day.  Some hot items and a waffle maker was provided.  Fresh fruit assortment also.  Good coffee to start the day.    There is a $12 per day parking, typical of hotels around disneyland.  The location is a bit too far to walk to for disney, but
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to offer us feedback on our location.  We are glad that you had an enjoyable stay with us and look forward to having you stay with us again in the future.

Summary: I really was looking forward to writing this review because I really want to help others. The first warning is just be because this is a Hampton Inn & Suites does not mean you get a suite. I booked a King with an extra family play area. It was supposed to have a bunk bed as Advertised on the Hilton Website. WARNING bunk beds do NOT exist at this hotel. They haven't for 5 years.   We got over the hump by getting a roll away. But we were still very short space. The kids area was divided by a wall and had cute carpet their own TV and a pottery barn beanie for lounging on the floor. All the linen was awesome! Great pillows and comfortable beds. The air con was freezing and we loved it. There is a tiny counter with the fridge, micro etc. Great considering we are used to suites.
Manager Response: Thank you for your very kind review of our property.  We apologize for the condusion with the amenities of the room you booked.  We are looking into where this information is listed incorrectly.  We look forward to seeing you again in the future.

Summary Heading: Not as nice as other Hamptons
Summary: We stayed at this Hampton Inn for 2 nights while visiting friends and Disney.  We have stayed in many other Hamptons and although this was fine, it wasn't as nice as many.  Our room was a typical double room and they were kind enough to let us have a roll away bed (for $10 per night) so our two boys could have separate beds, even though it was "against fire code".  The breakfast was cereal, very runny oatmeal, make-your-own waffles, breads, and 2 fairly unappealing hot dishes per day (very fake looking eggs, etc).  The pool area had a regular pool and a small hot tub with very dirty looking water.  The exercise room was almost non-existent consisting of an elliptical which was broken and a treadmill that didn't incline.  They offered to let us use the exercise room in their
Manager Response: We appreciate you taking the time to relay your feedback regarding your recent stay with us. On behalf of our entire staff here at the Hampton Inn & Suites, we apologize for the concerns you have about your experience at this hotel. We know that you have many choices for hotel accommodations when staying in the Anaheim\ Garden Grove area and we appreciate you giving us the opportunity to host your accommodations. We also are happy to inform you that the property is about to undergo a full lobby renovation. We hope that your next visit will be an enjoyable surprise. We appreciate the feedback and we will use it to refine our operations in the hope that upon your next visit, we will meet and exceed your expectations.

Summary: We were there for 4 nights.  It was nice to wake up every morning to different hot items in their morning breakfast offerings.  You cannot expect much more from a continental breakfast.  It is convenient to the convention center, a little walk, but doable.  I would recommend taking the shuttle to Disneyland.  There is a slight charge, but is very convenient for both Disney parks and Downtown Disney District.  The staff were especially helpful when we were leaving.  Many of us left the same day around the same time.  There was assistance to hold the elevator door as I tried to maneuver the luggage carrier around people and in and out of the elevator.
Manager Response: Thank you for your comments regarding your recent stay with us.  We are truly grateful to have hotel team members that enjoy being of service to our hotel guests and make you feel comfortable while staying with us.  We know that you have many choices for hotel accommodations when staying in the Anaheim\ Garden Grove area and we appreciate you giving us the opportunity to host your accommodations.   We look forward to your return visit with us and wish you a relaxing Monday.

Summary Heading: A vacation and hotel stay to remember with only good thoughts!
Summary: Not my first time staying at a Hampton Inn & Suites. It was for my companion. He now understands why I choose Hilton Family Hotels and almost sounds like me as I listen to him tell family/friends about our stay at this location. From calling in for the reservation, to our arrival and our stay....friendly, comfort, clean and accomodations were wonderful!
Manager Response: Thank you for your comments regarding your recent stay with us.  We are truly grateful to have hotel team members that enjoy being of service to our hotel guests and make you feel comfortable while staying with us.  We know that you have many choices for hotel accommodations when staying in the Anaheim\ Garden Grove area and we appreciate you giving us the opportunity to host your accommodations.   We look forward to your return visit with us and wish you a relaxing Tuesday.

Summary Heading: Great beds, sheets, WHITE duvet covers! OK kitchen. Nice frig.
Summary: Six nights in a spacious two room suite. Nothing like WHITE duvet covers to make a bed feel clean. Comfy sheets and towels. Queen beds were great! Sofa beds haven't improved in 50 years...still terrible. Generous breakfast. Nearly constant coffee service. I have seen reviews of friendly staff, but these folks were amazing. Every staff member had a nice smile and a greeting. Wonderful proximity to Disney...shuttles to the park and airports  Parking a problem on Sat. night (restaurant in same parking) but rear secure entry and lighting made rear parking doable. No parking charges as said online. Sofa in our suite seemed worn, but sat comfortably. Didn't notice worn out conditions in room or general areas of hotel...well maintained. A/C quite noisy, but effective. Priced a little
Manager Response: Thank you for your comments regarding your recent stay with us.  We are truly grateful to have hotel team members that enjoy being of service to our hotel guests and make you feel comfortable while staying with us.  We regret you had to cut your trip short.  Hopefully, next time you will be able to stay with us longer.  We know that you have many choices for hotel accommodations when staying in the Anaheim\ Garden Grove area and we appreciate you giving us the opportunity to host your accommodations.   We look forward to your return visit with us and wish you a relaxing Tuesday.

Summary Heading: A little worn out but acceptable
Summary: This Hampton Inn is definitely well-used but the staff are friendly and the rooms are clean. The public areas have had a lot of kids running through them (elevator buttons are coming off, hot cocoa packets were gone immediately) and the rooms walls show dents and bangs, but everything works.  This isn't the highest-end Hampton and there are a few quirks. I think the plumber who built the bathroom forgot his level: the soap dish was so skewed that the soap would not stay on it, everything seems a little off kilter (Toon Town-esque). It wasn't enough to really be a problem but it was quite funny.  Breakfast was fine but they didn't have hard-boiled eggs like other Hamptons.  The hotel is adjacent to two other Hilton properties and is convenient to the convention center and to

We look forward to your return visit with us and wish you a relaxing Wednesday.

Summary: My family and I stayed here in family suites for 3 days and got two rooms right next to each other. As soon as we arrived, we were greated and check in was easy. Everyone at this hotel goes above and beyond. Rooms were clean and the beds are SUPER comfy! I love that they have fresh sheets and duvets are washed along with the sheets. Breakfast is awesome for a continental, so many choices. Eggs, sausage, make your own Belgium waffles, oatmeal, fruit, cereal, pastries, bagels, juice, coffee, etc!  I really wish this hotel had a free shuttle. It ended up being more pricey with 5 people than paying to park at Disney.  Otherwise, this is a great place to stay. Really loved it!
Manager Response: Thank you for your comments regarding your recent stay with us. We look forward to your return visit with us and wish you a relaxing Wednesday.

Summary: Let me start by saying this is a amazing property has nothing but best service. I love this hotel because WiFi is included and free breakfast. Always make it nice when your on a budget. The one thing that really made a difference for me was the fact that they had snack lunches for you and your family to take. Which was great if you needed to grab something quick  and head over to the parks.  Another good thing about this location it's not that far of a walk from the park and they do provide shuttle service. Rooms are nice and pretty quite. During my stay the hotel was pretty busy I didn't hear a lot of noise up and down the halls. Front desk at this location are amazing and are always smiling and lending a helping hand.   This location is right next door to the embassy suites

Summary: Great location. 10 minute walk to Convention Center. 20 minute walk to Disneyland. Target is right across the street. The coffee was actually pretty good for being part of a continental breakfast (which is important). The breakfast was good and changed each day. The room was very spacious as well as the bathroom. The pool was decent, but on windy days had lots of debris but I still swam in it, just pushed it to the side.  Not a ton of fancy restaurants nearby but everything is within walking distance or a short cab away. I took a $10 cab to the outlet mall (Orange Outlets) and had a nice dinner there too. LOVE IT AND WILL STAY AGAIN FOR SURE. DECENT PRICE!

Summary Heading: FANTASTIC SERVICE - I recommend this hotel to everyone.
Summary: This is the 2nd time the Santa Barbara Girl's Blazer Basketball Team stayed at this hotel for a basketball tournament since we've been on the team.  The service staff is out of the world.  It's nice to have such great customer service during these times when it is so rare in California.  The breakfast was fantastic each morning with a large variety of foods.  We ate something different each day.  The beds are very comfortable and the rooms are clean and smell good (another problem with hotels these days.) We will definitely be staying with them in the future.

Summary: We stayed one night at the Hampton Inn near Disneyland and found it to be clean, comfortable and convenient to Disneyland. The employees were very nice too. Breakfast and WiFi were included and so was parking. We would definitely recommend this property.

Summary: Located close to Disney, with free breakfast and friendly staff, it is hard to go wrong.  Got checked in with ease, and the desk staff arranged a shuttle to Disney and sold me Disney tickets so we would be ready to go in the morning.   We got a good night sleep in the very comfortable room followed by a nice breakfast which was included.  Hard to find anything to complain about, especially since their price is very competitive.

Summary Heading: Relaxing - Our room was very nice and breakfast was great.
Summary: My daughter and I stayed over night for a dance convention nearby. Our room was nice and the King bed was very comfortable. We had breakfast Sunday morning around 6:30am and everything was well stock and ready to eat. Hotel was clean both inside and outside. And there was no extra parking fee like we had to pay each day at the other hotel where the convention was at. There is an Italian restaurant in the same parking lot as well for you to enjoy. And the pool area is on the south side of the hotel which gets sun all day which is nice. Just down the street from Disneyland as well.

Summary Heading: Close to Disney; Free breakfast; Free WiFi
Summary: Quick overnight stay. There is a shuttle to Disney. Price per night is great for the area. Free breakfast with a large dining room.  We could see the Disney fireworks from our room. Parking lot shared with 2 other hotels and a restaurant, so we had a bit of trouble finding parking, but at least there was no parking fee :)

Summary: I stayed at this property on Tuesday, February 5th and had a great time! We were checked in by Judith who was more than accomodating in providing details of the area and recommendations.  When we got to our room, we were in a hurry to shower after our drive from Vegas so we could head out to Huntington Beach. Unfortunately, the shower's water pressure was very low and some hair washing had to take place in the sink! Since we were in a hurry, we didn't mind. After we were ready to go, we called downstairs to politely ask if we could switch rooms. Judith told us that she would send someone up right away to address the problem. We left the room to go to the elevator and immediately saw the maintenance engineer coming up --it was less than five minutes from when we called!  By the

Summary: I stayed here in early January with my husband as we decided to head over to Disneyland for our one year anniversary and didn't feel like driving back home after the long day but had a great time there. We were checked in by Scott who sounded like he was reading a script the entire time and unfortunately did not sound genuine at all besides the fact that it might have been the longest check in I have ever experienced, we just wanted to go to bed since we were on the road all day. We later came down to ask for some advice on a nice restaurant and he was so rude and came off as if we were wasting his time, we didn't want him to ruin our night so we decided to head down to Morton's which was close enough and extremely nice. When we came back he didn't even great us since he was

Summary: Used this hotel for a recent Disneyland trip.  Had a polite staff.  Breakfasts were well served and attended - nothing ran out.  Had to deal with some immaturity from some of the other guests, but that's normal around resorts.  The hotel was pretty clean and they took good care of us. The convenience to Disneyland was good, only about a mile away.  The main highlight for us was how helpful the front desk was - they were super!

Summary: This hotel was great.  The room was clean, spacious and very comfortable.  We brought our 10 and 5 year old grandchildren to Disneyland to celebrate their birthdays.  We had a room with two queen beds and a kitchen, great for making sandwiches to take into the park each day.  The rooms are very quiet, the staff was very friendly and helpful whenever we needed anything.  I am very picky about the cleanliness of my accommodations and the housekeeping staff did not disappoint us in their efforts to make the rooms very clean and fresh.    The front desk staff would always acknowledge us when we came in no matter the time of day or evening.  We have found a new favorite hotel to stay in when we visit again.

Summary: The positive:  *Close, close, close to Disneyland.  *Free breakfast w/hot and cold choices  *Rooms are decent size & bed is comfortable.  *Front desk was friendly and helpful. The negative:  *It definitely needs some updating.  Bathroom especially (room 111) seemed old and and therefore dirty as well.  *My room was next to the maintenance room - I didn't think it would be an issue as I was in meetings from 8 am-7 pm at night.  But two nights there was drilling, hammering, etc. well after 8 or 9 pm.  *The workout room was spartan, there were no towels, and just a couple pieces of equipment.  It wasn't a horrible experience, but not great either.  For another $20-30 a night more, get a deal at the Hyatt Regency just down the street, or the Marriott just down the street.

Summary Heading: Five star service at three-star prices

And every single employee interaction was a delight, from the efficient and genial front desk staff to the housekeeping and maintenance crew who always had a smile and a friendly hello when we passed in the hallways.  The managers (who are visible and active around the hotel) clearly set the right tone, and it shows.  We'll definitely stay here again.

Summary Heading: So glad we stayed here instead of Disneyland Hotel!
Summary: We stayed here specifically to take our girls to Disneyland for their 1st time and it turned out perfect! We didn't rent a car, but used a car service from LBA to Hampton and then used the hotel shuttle to/from Disneyland.  The shuttle was a great, inexpensive investment and we had no problems.  It was on time & super convenient. We did 3 full days (park open to close) of Disneyland & California Adventure, so we basically just slept, showered, and ate breakfast here.  The beds were comfy and everyone slept well.  A free breakfast for a family of 4 is

Summary: Excellent for the price.  The Hampton Inn's beds are always comfortable- the best beds I have ever stayed in for a hotel.  I like staying at this hotel near Disneyland.  It includes a hot breakfast which has a large selection.  We booked a one bedroom king suite and were able to see the Disneyland Fireworks from our balcony on the nights that we came back early to swim.  Their pool was outside and for November/December the weather was too cold for me, but my husband and kids loved it. The hot tub would have been nice if I wasn't pregnant.  We had a car but it was cheaper for us to take their shuttle.  The shuttle was always on time and reliable. The hotel is close enough for us even with a 2 yr old. It is also a lot less expensive than the Disneyland hotels.  We will for sure

Summary: This hotel gets high marks for good service. I first stayed in a room with a sitting room. The room is set up in a way that made me claustrophobic. The sitting room was an alcove with a day bed, tv, small dresser and a bean bag chair. Good for keeping kids in the same room with you while still allowing privacy. The overall effect of the room was a long narrow hallway to get to the main bed. As is typical with hotel rooms, there are often not enough lights.   This first night, I stayed on the pool side on the third floor. Beware of lower floors in a theme park neighborhood as people returning on buses at late hours never seem to remember everyone else inside is asleep. I woke up and was awake for half an hour or so before everyone was inside and quiet. I feel shuttle and bus

Clean large rooms and comfy beds. The breakfast was great and lots to choose from. The biggest bonus to staying there..the staff!! amazing people. Being greeted each time u came in or went out made u feel welcome and appreciated. The cookies and fruited water in the lobby were extra special touches. The shuttle to disney from front door was excellent and made the stay further from the park no issue at all. I will definately look to stay at more Hampton properties.

The breakfast included every morning was ok, it filled you up. Summary: We have stayed at other Hampton Inns and have enjoyed every one, but Garden Grove Ca is the best yet. When we arrived there was one person in front of us to check in, the girl called for help right away, we were checked in in under 5 min. The room was beautiful, clean and very spacious. We had a private balcony. I am one of those people who is always hot so when I went into the bedroom and discovered a ceiling fan i was in heaven. The wifi went out on the 2nd day but there are computers available 24 hours a day in the lobby, and the wifi was fixed in less than an hour. we have started planning a big family trip for next Dec. and we are staying at the Hampton Inn, Garden Grove!
