Summary: This property is about 1 mile from Disneyland/California Adventures.  It costs $15 to park at Disneyland, but this hotel offers a shuttle at $5 for adults and $2 for a child.  In our case, paying $17 was worth not having to make the drive to Disneyland, find a place to park, etc.  They also sell Park tickets here if you do not already have them.  I've always found Hampton Inns well maintained and this property was no exception.  Upon check-in, they said there was a $12 charge for parking at the property.  However, I was not charged this and I didn't ask why.  The complimentary breakfast was very good - again, what I expect from a Hampton Inn. Summary: I arrived late in the evening at this hotel, only to find they did not have a reservation for me.  The desk clerk was extremely helpful, and finally determined I had accidentally booked the wrong date on the web site.  He switched the reservation, and was even able to get me the same room I had booked - the family suite.  This room was very nice and roomy - even had a microwave and refrigerator.  The breakfast was standard Hampton.  I've used other hotels in the Disney area before and found this one to be close to the park and competitively priced.  All in all a very pleasant stay.

A great way to start the day!  We enjoyed our stay.

Very neat that you can see fireworks from Disneyland from some of the rooms.  The free breakfast is decent and since this is a family friendly hotel there are several waffle irons, which is a big plus.  The only downside to the hotel is that the rooms are beginning to show wear, even though the beds are supremely comfortable. :)  This place is a great value but I am not sure I would stay here again for business now for an economical family trip to Disneyland I would put it near the top of the list.

The reason for 4 and not 5 was the location it was too far to walk to Disney and the ART shuttle is completely ridiculous to take. I would definitely stay here again when I return in 2014!

I managed to find someone on the floor to look at it.  He said either the battery is dead or keep trying to bang it closed until it locks.  That worked ok but it wasn't reassuring if the room service came to clean the room and left without checking if the door locked properly.  The breakfast in the morning was chaotic but that is

Summary: My husband, my one year old daughter, and I came here as a small get away.  What a mistake!! First of all it is the same price as the Embassy Suites which is in the same parking lot as this hotel. Embassy Suites would have been the better choice. The rooms are small and look like they were painted with institution white walls. The comforter was lumpy from being washed too much. The child's pool was dangerous it scraped my daughter's toes so bad her feet looked mangled. I went to front desk to ask for band-aids they didn't apologize at all and only said it had never happened before.  Then at 10 at night I was informed that Expedia had cancelled our reservation. Instead to the front desk looking into it they would not let us back into our room until we paid with a credit card.

Summary: Another Hampton Inn and it was up to snuff. The staff here was exceptionally helpful though as they were very thoughtful and thorough in the information they provided on the local area. We went to cram in three days at Disney and staying so close to the park was a plus. We walked the 1.2 miles to the park each day and it was no problem - even at the end of a really long and hot day. The only thing that kept me from giving a five star review was the fact that one of the shuttles ran right under my room and was rather loud at night. I highly recommend this stop though to make your Disney experience just a little better.

Summary: Stayed at this hotel with my husband and 3 kids (10,8,4) The hotel is very close to disney and is in a carpark with 2 other hotels, good area. The hotel itself is showing signs of wear and tear, but in fairness must have alot of traffice been so close to disney. (lifts, corridors, furniture, restrooms etc.) The suite we had was spacious, just as the website showed.  It had everything we need, but again, if you paid too much attention you could see where a revamp was needed. it was lovely and quiet at night, kids slept great, the balcony was a nice little feature. The free breakfast was ok, not much choice, but was clean and fresh. parking was perfect. would recommend this hotel for convenience to disney and the price, but personnaly wouldn't stay here again.

Summary: If you have children and need a cheap but clean hotel, this is the perfect one. The staff is extremely friendly. This hotel is also very clean, and I'm happy to say that after staying there for four days, I have no complains. We left very happy and impressed. I really didn't know a 2 1/2 could be this way.  I normally stay in 4-5 stars hotels, so I was very hesitant. However, it was a family trip, and our friends booked the hotel. I'm really happy that we did not overpay for other hotel. I would definitely recommend it.

Summary: This hotel was awesome.  We had a one bedroom suite, the rooms were nice and spacious.  Upon arrival a pack'n'play was brought to our room as requested. While my husband and daughter went to California Adventure the first night I stayed with our 1 year old son at the hotel.  I ordered dinner from Buca'De Beppo in the parking lot and on my way out the desk staff gave me a coupon, they even took a high chair from the dining room up to our room while we walked over to pick up our food! Breakfast always had a good variety for the entire family. The rooms were very clean and the beds were very comfortable.The shuttles passes to Disneyland are a great bargain and are very prompt! We looked at staying on Disney property but this was a much better value, gave us room and allowed us to

Summary Heading: Terrific staff; physicial facilities need better upkeep
Summary: Stayed here for two nights with the family to visit Disneyland.  From the second we arrived, the staff did their best to be of service, to be accomodating, to be informative, and to be professional.  They answered all of our questions; they provided great advice on our trip to the Magic Kingdom; they waived a fee that had promised to be waived; they arranged for extra toiletries to be brougt up when requested.  A fantastic team - especially Oscar at the front desk.  That being said, the hotel rooms are showing their age a bit.  The furniture had a good deal of nicks, dings, and scratches.  The hallway walls seem a bit tired as they've clearly taken a beating from luggage cards, roll-along bags, and crazy children.  The shower is going to need a refit sooner rather than later.

Summary: This hotel was good.  The breakfast was really good.  The room was clean and we had a room on 6th floor with a good view of the local car park and other hotels, but still it was pretty good.    The pool did break down a few times.   We had problems with a air cond. that went from hot to cold.   And in the end we got a room change.  The air cond. worked better in the new room.

Summary Heading: Terrific Hotel at a Great Price!
Summary: As resort areas go, this area near Disneyland is crowded with hotels, so the choices can be daunting. However, we usually opt for a Hampton Inn when available and we weren't sorry to have chosen this one. Just a mile from Disneyland, it's spacious and clean and boasts a staff that's friendly and eager to help. Most importantly, the price was right - only $107 per night plus taxes.  The rooms were large and comfortable and up on the 6th floor we actually had a decent view. The bathroom areas were large as well. The beds were excellent! We always enjoy those wonderful, warm white Hampton duvet covers and the extra pillows!   We arrived early and our room wasn't ready, but a staff member volunteered to call us when it was. We didn't have to wait long and were checked in by 1 pm. We

Summary: Here's another hotel I stayed at while on a trip to Disneyland. The location was nice given the fact there was dining and shopping within walking distance. The room we got was clean and simple. Nothing crazy. Overall I would recommend this hotel.

Summary: This is the second time we've stayed at this hotel and we would stay there again. We choose to stay at Hampton Inn's because we know what we'll be getting each time.  Free breakfast, standard rooms and clean linens.  This is the only place that states they change the duvet covers between guests.  I love this as usually, I'm a little grossed out by bedspreads that all the guests have to share!  Not that you need this long, but we stayed 10 nights and did Disney/California Adventure up right!  The shuttle service runs every 1/2 hour and is shared between 3 hotels, all in the same parking lot.  We only had to stand up in the shuttle one time, but they really try to accomodate by having extra shuttles run when needed.  They also run on time and don't make a habit of waiting on

Summary: I was in the Orange/Anaheim area for business and located this property from the website. I didn't realize it was only a few miles from Disney when I booked and was a little worried about the noise when checking in. Judith, the front desk clerk understood my apprehension and did everything she could to get me a room with a refrigerator and king bed away from the noise.   The room was standard Hampton Inn, clean, fairly well kept, with a flat screen TV, desk, and two chairs. One to relax in and one for working. Hampton says they change the bedding between guests in their brochures and at this location the house keeping staff even put a note on the bed stating so. I've never had a dirty bed at any Hampton and this was no exception. My only complaint about the room was that the

Summary: If you are traveling with kids this is the real deal. the hotel has very nice spacious rooms with good bathroom. It¬¥s clean, affordable and it offers you a nice hot breakfast. Disneyland is very near and a lot of restaurants too.

Summary: Our room was clean, modern and just what we ordered.  The free breakfast included eggs and sausage which was nice.  The hotel shuttle charged only a nominal fee and made it easy to get to and from Disneyland with three kids even though it would have been quite a long walk if we had to do that.  Parking was an extra $12 per day, but it wasn't too bad.  They also held $50 on my credit card, which I didn't really love, but it ended up covering the parking and shuttle tickets anyway, so it worked out fine.  The kids loved the pool (which was too cold for my taste), I liked that there was an additiona wading pool for the really little kids, and my husband and I both enjoyed the hot tub!  We'd happily stay here again some other time.  In fact, we tried to extend our stay this trip,

Summary: Came here to stay with a couple of friends because we were going to an event at Disneyland. We have stayed several times before and have had nice experience. The only thing we are always disappointed with is the breakfast. The scrambled eggs are just awful. We try to eat the yogurt or oatmeal but it would be nice to have another fresh made item besides the egg choices. One of my favorite parts is that they play a Disney movie during breakfast. I am a little kid at heart. We try to stay here on our trips but we wish the breakfast would improve.

Summary: This hotel obviously sees a lot of use. There were a few places that was visible. The mattresses on the sofa beds were quite flat. There was some paint chipping off in the hallway and stair well. Overall, though, this was a great hotel. The staff were only too happy to move us to a room with a view when requested ( we wanted to see the Disney July 4th fireworks), and all of the hotels staff, including maintenance and maids, were very friendly and polite. The rooms were clean and the breakfast was good.  Oscar, at the front desk, handled all of our questions and requests like a pro. Overall, for the price you pay, it's a good hotel.

Summary: My daughter and I just spent 10 days at this hotel---what an enjoyable experience! The entire staff was absolutely awesome--from check in until check out! From the front desk staff(Oscar, Hector, Judith to name a few)--nicest people I've come across at a hotel in a very long time.--even at more expensive $$$ hotels!  Airline lost my luggage and they were there to offer complimentary items--(yes I said free--most hotels direct you to their gift shop $$$). The staff mapped out directions to the closest mall and offered advice as to where to buy some clothing to hold me over---they went above and beyond!!!   The breakfast crew---you were all awesome--they put up with a lot of stuff; some guests weren't exactly friendly---yet they kept the smiles on their faces--keep it up!  Free

Summary Heading: I will never stay here again
Summary: I stayed at this hotel for a family vacation and will never do so again.  The rooms themselves and the breakfast were OK.  I suppose if you have a car, it might not be terrible, but the lack of shuttle service and the front desk's unwillingness to help guests ensured that I won't be back.    The hotel is over 1/2 a mile from Disneyland, so it's not really walking distance, but my friend and I had to walk anyway one day after returning for a mid-day nap.  It's a shared shuttle with other hotels, so when they pick up people leaving Disneyland, they ask them which hotel they are staying at and then stop at ONLY those hotels.  We waited from 2 pm until 3:30 pm for a 2:15 shuttle before giving up and walking.  When we asked the front desk - twice - they insisted it came at 2:15.
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to share your comments regarding your experiences at this hotel. I must apologies for the situation you experienced. I know that you have many choices for hotel accommodations when staying in the Anaheim\ Garden Grove area and I appreciate you giving us the opportunity to host your accommodations. Summary: You do get what you pay for here...Customer Service was excellent!!!! smiled, talked to kids~if you have had the breakfast at Embassy Suites this one is NOT the same..the eggs have some cheezy stuff in the middle, my girls efused to eat so we did not go back down any of the morning plus the place to eat breakfast was so small. The room we had had a kitchen which is why I booked there - worked perfect!!! the rooms need updated the bathroom walls are peeling and the floors in kitchen were coming up had to put something in middle of floor so noone tripped.  It is a nice size for a big family and it did its purpose for Disneyland..I probably wont stay there again.

Summary: We stayed at this hotel for a family Disney vacation. I booked a 2 room suite for 6 of us and it was very spacious. My favorite part of this hotel was the free breakfast in the morning. We saved a lot of money by eating there and the kids never got tired of it because they had different selections every day. The staff was friendly and helpful. We had the opportunity to enjoy the pool as well, nothing fancy but the kids enjoyed it. Room was spacious and clean. I had no complaints. Compared to the cost of other hotels in the area this once was a great value.

Summary: I visited Disneyland July 2-6 and stayed in this hotel. Keep in mind this is not a brand new Hampton Inn. A lot of the hotels in Anaheim are old, and have such a high turn around in customers, mostly families with children, due to the location. That will equal some wear and tear in the hotel. That being said, the customer service was very good and we had a good overall experience. Our first room had a stain in the carpet and on the light, and felt dingy. A/C unit not working, neither was phone. I asked to be changed. The second room's phone didn't work, nor did one of the lights, and it had a humid musty smell. I am severe asthmatic and had to ask to be changed again. The woman at the front desk told me she would send housekeeping to inspect the second room before she changed me

Summary Heading: Great Group Stay for Disneyland Trip
Summary: We had 15 rooms here for a youth sports team and their families during a long weekend trip.  Our group had a combination of suites and regular rooms.  The suites worked well with full kitchenettes, flat screens (on the smaller side), and a vanity separate from the rest of the bathroom (very helpful).  Free internet and breakfast are what helped move this property to the top of our list when researching where to stay.   The sales staff managed our reservations, so parking and shuttle costs were part of the package deal.  The normal $12 daily parking rate seems high.  However, the sales staff was great to work with as were all of the staff during our stay. Summary: We spent 7 days at the Hampton and everything was absolutely wonderful! Our room (1 bedroom suite with kitchenette) was always clean & tidy. The staff at the hotel were always cheerful and by the end of the week they even remembered our names - wow. The hotel served a hot buffet breakfast with everything imaginable and started our days off perfectly. There was even a pool and jacuzzi to relax in after the long days out and about. I wish that we could afford to go back every year. Thank you for the wonderful memories.

Summary: We arrived quite late and tired and the place looked dingy to me.  Our last 2 Hampton Inns were brand new.  This one is not new, however, on closer examination, our room was spotless and quite comfortable. Unlike the experience of another reviewer, I want to rave about the customer service.  Our a/c unit went out.  Not only did someone come to fix it promptly, he was knowledgeable, reassuring and quite friendly.  The same with housekeeping and front desk staff.  I loved the hospitality. We came to an Anaheim convention and those hotels were full. This Hampton Inn is primarily for families going to Disneyland, so the breakfast room was a zoo and the noise of crying children woke us up in the mornings. But great customer service papered over any issues I might have had.  I

Summary: Every hotel has its ups and downs, but something that can really make them stand out is customer service. Something that the Hampton Inn prides itself in and is a key point in its advertisements.   So when you have a problem and you politely bring it up with the front desk and they argue with you that you are wrong, do nothing to fix the problem, and at the very least offer no apology- in my book that is TERRIBLE customer service.   The hotel is beyond walking distance to the Disneyland park (which is the only reason families stay at the hotel ). They offer their own shuttle service that is partnered through an outside company. As an annual pass holder to Disney we are only allowed 1 magic morning entry into the park. We had to go online weeks before our trip to select it. We
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to share your comments regarding your experiences at this hotel.  I must apologies for the situation you were placed in because the hotel was not prepared for your particular situation.  After I learned about what had happen to you and your family I did some investigating and found out that Disney had implemented a new program for its Annual Pass holders.  This program took effect late May/ Early June and it did indeed allow for Annual Pass holder to get a Magic Morning.  This program was something that was new and not told to the Good Neighbor Hotels.  We were unaware of this new program and therefore not prepared to accommodate your needs.  Disney provided the hotels with a schedule for Magic Mornings.  The schedule does not make any reference to this new program.  While this explains how this situation could have occurred, it is up to the service providers to do all they can to service the guests in the best ways possible.  Our staff should have asked clarifying questions instead of assuming what your needs were.  Again, I truly apologize for this situation and know that we will make it right for you.  Thank you again, for your comments and thank you for staying with us.

Summary: Staying in this hotel would be a pleasant experience if it weren't for the traffic noise from the parking lot and Harbor Blvd. Loud motorcycles, buses, and commercial garbage trucks were constantly driving by, starting early in the morning and lasting until late at night. Too bad this hotel didn't invest in better windows and soundproofing techniques. I was on the top floor and had to run the AC all night to drown out the traffic noise. Otherwise, the hotel is perfectly adequate. Friendly staff, great free breakfast, clean rooms (love that the duvet is changed for each guest). The world is unfortunately getting noisier, and hotels need to take this into account.

Summary Heading: Spotlessly clean room, comfy king bed, quiet and has a tub, microwave & fridge
Summary: I stayed during my Disney visit and found it much cleaner and newer than the hotels right across from Disney, definately worth the short bus ride. The comp breakfast was excellent. I had a small cheese omelet with salsa, fresh fruit, kielbasa sausage, and mini yogurt  but there was much more to choose from. Would stay again!

Summary Heading: excellent staff and service.  Needs some convieniences
Summary: We stayed 16 other families an entire hockey team due to its easy access to Disney and nearby rinks.  Location is very good. 30 minutes to the beaches, Huntington is one of the best close beaches.  Good choices of restaurants near by but if staying for more than a couple of days you will want a car for some other choices. Day pass for the Disney Shuttle is $4.00 for adults and $1.00 for kids. It leaves every half hour.  The Block outdoor outlet mall is only a 10 min drive to the south east.  This mall is mostly for the 10-24 year old bracket.   Hotel free buffet breakfast is what you expect, some hot some cold.    Time to upgrade this.  Need proper sanitary dispensers for the food not spoons and scoops. The kids cleaning his ear then going into the cereal bowl with the scoop

Summary: I just checked out after staying at this hotel for 3 days. I am a traveling night shift nurse and sleep during the day so quietness is very important to me. I called to the front desk and they had another room on the same floor ready for me within 5 minutes. Summary Heading: Saved money by staying here, without sacrificing anything.
Summary: Stayed at this Hampton while attending a conference at another more expensive, nearby hotel. Very pleasant, helpful staff, clean rooms, and free wireless; those are my key factors in rating  a hotel, and this Hampton did great. I'm sure I saved at least $400 by not staying at the conference hotel, without sacrificing anything. I'll be back.
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to share your comments regarding your recent stay with us. We are truly grateful to have hotel team members that enjoy being of service to our hotel guests and make you feel comfortable while staying with us. We know that you have many choices for hotel accommodations when staying in the Anaheim\ Garden Grove area and we appreciate you giving us the opportunity to host your accommodations.

Summary: My family of five (DW, girls 8, 6, & 3) stayed in a two queen suite for six nights at this hotel. My parents also stayed in this hotel in an adjacent (but not adjoining) room. We were very pleased with our decision to stay here.  It was in a very good location, with excellent family-friendly restaurants nearby, and a Target also very close.  The beds & pillows were very comfortable (even with the three year old sharing with us). There was good sound-proofing between the living area and the bedroom, so that the kids weren't disturbed by the TV when we put them to bed.  There is a fridge, microwave, & stove with plates, glasses & utensils provided, which was handy when we had "leftover" night from all the doggy-bags we had accumulated from the previous nights of eating out.  The

Summary: Hotel was clean and comfortable. The shuttle bus to Disney was good and timely. Breakfast was good. A standout was the friendliness of the front desk staff and those at the breakfast service.They were great.  Breakfast was in line with the price we paid and grade of hotel. The only small hiccup we had is when the room cleaning staff took away some of the soap we brought with us( it was a special moisturizing soap for our son).  They probably thought it was almost used up ( less than half a bar but was something we needed) . But would return. Close to a few places to eat and a large target store. The Microwave in room was useful as was a the Laundry room in each floor in the hotel.
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to share your comments regarding your recent stay with us. We are truly grateful to have hotel team members that enjoy being of service to our hotel guests and make you feel comfortable while staying with us. We know that you have many choices for hotel accommodations when staying in the Anaheim\ Garden Grove area and we appreciate you giving us the opportunity to host your accommodations.

Summary: Great hotel, great staff, great manager ! Everything was perfect.  A short distance from Disneyland (1 mile) and minus the noise. Hotel shuttle leaves from parking lot every half hour and very inexpensive and convenient. Staff very attentive, went out of their way to ensure that we were taken care of. Room was very clean and housekeeping made sure that we had everything we needed. Front desk staff very friendly and helpful, went out of their way to help with smaller details such as directions and recommendations for restaurants etc. Always greeted upom our return with a smile and a "welcome back, how was your day?". Coffee available in the lobby 24 hrs a day and ample breakfast available each morning which was well organised and plentiful. Target close by for groceries, gas

Summary Heading: They Went the Extra Mile for us in service.....
Summary: Stayed in this Hotel for multiple nights the week of Apr 8th  for a combined business & leisure trip with teenage children.  Upon check-in, the desk staff put us in a suite on the North side (toward's Disneyland), 7th floor.  This is a nice place to be, as you can watch the Disneyland Fireworks show outside on your balcony from the 7th floor, which we did, and enjoyed.  One minor issue, the pool water seemed a bit cloudy when I went in for some lap swimming/exercise, but at that time of year (spring break), most pools get A LOT of use by kids. Otherwise, had a good stay.  I have stayed in this hotel now on three occasions over the past several years as our hotel of choice for my family to take the kids to Disneyland; as well as business in this area.  I was a bit disappointed to
Manager Response: Thank you for your comments regarding your recent stay with us.  We are truly grateful to have hotel team members that enjoy being of service to our hotel guests and make you feel comfortable while staying with us.  We know that you have many choices for hotel accommodations when staying in the Anaheim\ Garden Grove area and we appreciate you giving us the opportunity to host your accommodations.  We hope that we have the opportunity to serve you again.

Summary: The staff was wonderful.   The entry and first floor look great.  The computer system was down.  The room was OLD.  Everything had been painted and looked clean, but the couch and chair were visibly old and worn.  The hall and room have a old, musty smell.  The bath and hand towels had some sort of chemical smell.  The odor may have come from the cubby holes the towels were stored in (because I noticed the towels hanging outside the bathroom did not have that odor).  Unbelievably,  there was a $12 charge to park :(.  If you can deal with the odor, its not a bad place to stay
Manager Response: Thank you for your feedback in regards to your stay with us.  We believe in guest satisfaction and trying to deliver the best guest experience possible.  By your comments it is clear that we were not able to deliver that to you.  Know that your comments have been heard and will be used to further enhance this hotel.  We hope that we get another opportunity to exceed your expectations.  Thank you for staying with us.

Summary: I stayed here two nights during my honeymoon in a "firework view room". We never got the chance to watch the fireworks from our room because it was too windy those nights. But I can tell from the angle that the view would not be worth the extra money, unless you did not have the choice to go into the Park at all (ie, you are there for a conference). The beds were very comfortable.   The hotel staff was not "rude" but was not polite by any means. I have stayed at several Hampton locations and have always felt "at home" while there, this one is the opposite. Very dingy everywhere. The elevator was scary, sounded very clunky and was missing the elevator maintenance information. The breakfast was very basic. The only thing I enjoyed was the prepackaged muffins. It is not within
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to post a comment regarding your recent stay with us.   We know that you have many choices for hotel accommodations when staying in the Anaheim\ Garden Grove area and we appreciate you giving us the opportunity to host your accommodations.  We believe that since you have been kind enough to choose us as your home while visiting the area and we are grateful for that honor.  We have 3 main goals for your stay:  1.	Extend exceptional and excellence service; 2.	Provide you with outstanding accommodations; 3.	Exceed each and every one of your expectations.  By your comments it is clear that you did not feel this during your stay.  I would love speak to with you, and discuss your stay at this property.  Again, we hold providing excellent guest service and satisfaction in very high regard.  I would like to make sure that we make this situation right for you.

Summary: Stayed here for 4 nights for a Disneyland trip.  Hotel was okay.  Staff was great.  Found the parking fee of 12$ night a bit cheeky since you still had to pay for the shuttle to the parks.
Manager Response: We appreciate your feedback.  We are very happy to hear our staff was great.  We appreciate you choosing to stay at our hotel and we hope to see you again when your travels bring you back to the Anaheim/Garden Grove area!

Summary Heading: Great hotel - not overrun with families
Summary: We were very pleased with this Hampton Inn and Suites.  We stayed here during spring break 2012.  Our family has stayed at many of the Disneyland-area hotels as we've been coming here for ten years and try a different hotel every time.  This one is a keeper.  While it might be a bit dated (it probably hasn't been redecorated for about 4 years), everything about our stay was excellent from start to finish.  The staff was very friendly and accommodating.  The breakfast was very good - and not overrun with families.  At many of these "breakfast included" hotels the breakfast area is crowded, sticky and messy.  Not at this hotel.  Perhaps because of its smaller size, nothing was crowded or messy.  We never had to wait for an elevator and the pool area was clean and tidy too.  We
Manager Response: Thank you for your comments.  We are delighted to hear our staff was very friendly and that you now found your hotel of choice when visiting the Anaheim area.  We are glad you enjoyed our spacious suites, and that you took advantage of the amenities our suites include, plus our complimentary breakfast.  For these reasons, we find our hotel has great value and the reason it is ranked #3 on TripAdvisor.

Summary Heading: Very Plain With a Hospital Feel
Summary: The problem with this place is that there is absolutely no ambiance whatsoever.  Every light in the room is an ice white energy conserving bulb.  Don't get me wrong, i know that being green is good but i also want to have a little ambiance at the hotel that i am staying at.  When the lights are on i feel like i am at a hospital NOT a hotel.  There are energy conserving bulbs that put off more of a regular light and i hope that the mgmt. makes some switches to these.  It really makes a difference.  Nobody likes to feel like they are in a science lab.  Aside from this, the place is nice.  Clean, comfortable with basically no amenities to speak of.  The staff is very friendly and the rooms are very clean and the beds are above average.  Although this place is definately adequate i
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to share your feedback.  We are excited to let you know that we will be renovating our lobby, breakfast area, fitness center and business center, during the second quarter of this year.  We are very happy to hear that our hotel staff was very friendly and that you found our rooms to be very clean.  We hope to have the opportunity to serve you again, because we'd love for you to get to experience our hotel once it has been renovated.

Summary: Drove over from Arizona for a two day Disney trip.  Arrived 3/14, & left 3/16.  We have been staying at Hampton Inn's for years.  We were blown away by the staff, the room, the shuttle driver, the continental bfast.  The entire experience was great from check in to check out.  Actually, when we booked the room from Arizona at 2:30am the night before we traveled, the person that took our reservation was even great, funny and helpful and answered our many questions.  Kudos to Hector at the front desk on check in and check out - he was friendly and recommended local restaurants when we asked.  We also noticed both mornings that the kitchen staff were very attentive. Whoever the young guy was both mornings, hope your boss sees this bc your dedication to keeping the place clean and
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the to share your feedback.  We are very happy to hear that our staff's service blew you away!  We will make sure to celebrate our Guest Service Rep., Hector and our Breakfast team for their outstanding service!  Thank you for being a loyal Hampton guest.  We look forward to your next visit.

Summary: Standard fare for a Hampton - nice and simple.  Well run, staff was very friendly.  About a 15 minute walk to the convention center - many restaurants nearby.
Manager Response: Thank you for your comments.  We are glad to hear you enjoyed your stay with us.  Thank you for mentioning our proximity to the many restaurants and to the Anaheim Convention center.  We appreciate you choosing to stay at our hotel and we hope to see you again when your travels bring you back to the area!

Summary Heading: Loved this hotel so much that I'm coming back!
Summary: My family recently took a trip to Disneyland, and broke it up into 2 parts.  The first 2 nights, we stayed at the Embassy Suites.  Worst decision ever!  We switched it up and stayed over at the Hampton Inn and I absolutely loved my stay from beginning to end!  We stayed in the 2 queen room with full kitchen.  Upon check in, we were greeted with smiles, complimentary snacks, and our hotel keys.  Our room was perfect! It was just the right size for a family of four.  My 2 year old, had her own bed, of course, while my 7-year old son opted for the fold out couch, giving him his own private living room.  And because there was a full kitchen and a Target close by, were able to stock up on food and not rely on eating out all the time.  The breakfast that they provide is complimentary,
Manager Response: Thank you for your feedback!  We are thrilled to hear you enjoyed your stay with us during your visit the Disney area!  We will make sure to share your feedback with our friendly staff.  Our guests' satisfaction is our #1 goal.  Thank you for mentioning the great value our hotel has.  We are happy to hear you enjoyed one of our spacious suites that include a kitchenette w/cooking utensils and a balcony to enjoy the Resort view.  Thank you for giving us the opportunity to serve you.  We look forward to your visit in April!

Summary Heading: Would stay here for the rest of my life if I could
Summary: Met all my expectations, worth every penny and I couldn't ask for anything else. The best place in the world. Seriously the ultimate satisfying place to go to.
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to share your feedback.  We are delighted to hear you enjoyed your stay with us!  We take pride in our hotel as we strive to exceed all of our guests' expectations.  We look forward to your future visit!

Summary: Traveled for work and fun. We had planned to go to Disney while here but didn't have time because of work. We booked a one room suite which was as big as an apartment! The room included a kitchen and dining table with two chairs, living room with a coffee table, couch and chair. Two TVs one in the LR and one in the Bed room. A walk in closet and a second sliding door closet. Yes - two closets!    While the decor and view were not great - the room was clean and not expensive. I would absolutely book this hotel again. Going to Disney - absolutely a great place to stay.
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to write a review! Thank you for your helpful hints to our reviewers.  We are very happy to hear our hotel meets all your needs and that you have a great stay, every time you visit us.  Thank you for highlighting the great value of our suites!  We thank you for staying with us.  We look forward to your future visit!

Summary: Good location for Disneyland, restaurants, and Target Took advantage of shuttle buses between hotel and Disneyland.  Target store is to easy to walk to and Bucca di Beppo italian restaurant is in the parking lot.  Other restaurant chains are in walking distance.  Gas stations are nearby.   We stayed 4 weekdays in January.  Hotel breakfast not so good.  The breakfast juice dispenser offered orange, apple, and cranberry but they all tasted like horrible colored water.  Better to take the milk cartons or make instant cocoa, or drink coffee or tea.  They had two waffle makers.  Every morning they had scrambled eggs. The meat tray either contained sausage links, bacon, or sausage patty sandwich.  They also offer cereal boxes, bananas, apples, and oranges.  They also have bread,
Manager Response: Your comments are greatly appreciated.  We are glad you were satisfied with the staff's service. We thank you for your concerns regarding our breakfast options.  We will look further into how we can improve our options of juices offered in our breakfast.  Thank you for mentioning on how close many stores, restaurants are and the advantage of our shuttle bus between the hotel and Disneyland.  We are glad to hear your daughter took advantages of our pools and that you all enjoyed our complimentary services, such as the breakfast, free Wi-Fi and our guestrooms which include a microwave and refrigerator.  We find that because of these reasons our hotel has the most value as one of the Top 3 hotels on TripAdvisor. We appreciate you choosing to stay at our hotel and we hope to see you again, when your travels bring you back to the area!

Summary: my partner and i stayed here in oct 2011 we didn't like the room at first but they were brilliant and moved us and we was there for 2 weeks brekfast was lovely staff were freindly helpfull it makes all the difference when we came along way from england so we will be probably looking to book again this year carn't complain at all it was a brilliant stay thankyou !!!
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to share your feedback.  We are delighted to hear you had a brilliant stay with us! I am glad our staff was able to accommodate your needs.  We will make sure to celebrate our staff's great service.  Thank you for staying with us and it is our hope that we will have the pleasure of accommodating you on your future trips to the Garden Grove area!

Summary: A very new hotel with a helpful and courteous staff! Very comfortable beds and small fridge and microwave in the room! The pool was very nice and we spent a couple nights enjoying the hot tub. I would definitely stay here again!
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to write a review.  We are thrilled to hear you had a great experience at our hotel. We take pride in our hotel as we strive to exceed all of our guests' expectations.  We are glad you had some time to enjoy our pools and hot tub and that you took advantage of our in-room amenities.  We thank you for choosing to stay with us and we look forward to your next visit to the Anaheim/Garden Grove area!

Summary Heading: Great family stay for Disney vacation!!
Summary: We loved our experience at the Hampton Inn. I booked it based on the reviews given on this site and wasn't disappointed. Great staff. Clean rooms. Simple but adequate pool area. Ample breakfast. Wonderful shuttle service. They were so accommodating of all our requests. Chocolate chip cookies around 6pm at the front desk. Free toothbrushes when I forgot my kids brushes. The morning manager was always so smiley and happy to greet us every morning. Breakfast staff was very accommodating. Only grievance is that I wish the eggs were better. They seemed to be an instant egg or something. Tasted gritty. Other than that, great! Loved the layout of the family suite. We have 4 kids and with the door closing off the bedroom I was able to put the little one to bed while the others stayed up
Manager Response: Thank you for sharing your kind feedback!  We are delighted to hear you enjoyed staying in our clean, spacious and comfortable suites.  We are glad you took advantage of our pools and that you enjoyed some of our chocolate chip cookies. Thank you for choosing to stay with us.  We strive to exceed all of our guests' expectations!  We hope to have the opportunity to serve you once again on your next visit to the Garden Grove area!

Summary Heading: Great place toay!  Didn't want to leave!
Summary: This was a great place with very nice rooms.   We stayed back in August and forgot to write a review so I'm writing it now.   Very convenient to everything you want to see in the area.  All staff were fairly friendly except one.   Best hotel of the three we stayed at in California!  We love staying at Hampton Inns.   Overall always a good experience.  Wish we could have stayed longer
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to share your feedback.  We are glad you've kept us in mind since August.  We are glad you enjoyed your stay with us. Your feedback assists us improve our future guests' experience.  Please feel free to contact me directly at sandra.zuno@hilton.com, so I can assist you with this concern.  Thank you for giving us the opportunity to serve you.

Summary: We stayed here for 4 day's in Jan6-9. Hotel was great, Jennifer Hernandez & Judith Serrato were awesome employees and gave us lots of advice on where to go and what to do. Defiantly recommend this hotel. Were going back in February and will defiantly use this hotel again.
Manager Response: We are thrilled to hear that Jennifer Hernandez and Judith Serrato offered you great advise on what to do on your 4 days vacation.  We are very fortunate to have them working with us!  We will make sure to celebrate their superb service!  We thank you for taking the time to write us your feedback!  We look forward to having the opportunity to serve you once again!

Summary: Just had a large group stay at the Hampton Inn near Disneyland and found it to be a very welcoming, hospitable and accommodating place.  The free hot-breakfast area was well-equipped even when much of our group descended on it around the same time.  The pool was nice and quiet.  The rooms were comfortable.  They offer a shuttle service to Disneyland that really was worthwhile as it bypassed some pretty complicated and time-consuming parking issues at Disneyland.
Manager Response: We are delighted to hear you and the group enjoyed your stay with us!  We are glad to hear you were able to enjoy our complimentary breakfast, our pools, Disney shuttle service and the comfort and cleanliness of our guestrooms.  Here at Hampton, we strive to exceed all of our guests' expectations!  We look forward to having the opportunity to serve your group on the next visit to the Garden Grove area!

Summary: Your typical disneyland area hotel. Our particular room was very small and not what I was expecting. I thought we would have bunk beds, but we ended up having little black chairs that converted to beds in the ``family room area``. They were a vinly material that would be unsafe for my toddler to sleep on, so he shared the kingsize bed with us. Last time we stayed there we had a full suite which was awesome. Having a fridge & coffee in the room was a bonus! The breakfast was good an egg dish and a either sausage or potatoes plus your usual continental picks. Staff in the breakfast area were quick to replish and very friendly. My only real complaint is they took down their geogeous christmas tree so early! I am glad I got to see it for a day! They have a shuttle that comes every
Manager Response: Your feedback is greatly appreciated.  We are glad you enjoyed our breakfast and Disney shuttle service.  Here at Hampton, we take pride in our hotel as we strive to exceed all of our guests‚Äô expectations.  I'm sorry we failed to exceed yours.  We apologize for the inconvenience of not having the accommodations you expected.  Your feedback assists us improve our future guests' experience.  Please feel free to contact me directly at sandra.zuno@hilton.com, so I can assist you with any further concerns.  Thank you for giving us the opportunity to serve you.

Summary Heading: Above average, good location for Disney
Summary: This hotel has a fair amount of competition, as it is located within a complex of other higher-brand hotels.  Room was clean, friendly staff, within walking distance of several restaurants and Disney.  I had to switch rooms due to strong smell originating from the bathroom.  The bathtub had a non-slick surface applied within 1-2 days of my arrival.  The front desk had no problem in placing me in another room.  As with all Hampton Inns, breakfast and Wi-Fi are included the nightly fee, though parking is $11/day.
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to share your feedback.  We are delighted to hear you enjoyed your stay with us!  Thank you for mentioning the cleanliness of our rooms, how friendly our staff is, the great value of our complimentary breakfast and free Wi-Fi Internet.  We believe that because of these reasons, we have the best value from the Top 3 hotels on TripAdvisor.  We look forward to having the opportunity to serve you once again, when your travels bring you back to the Anaheim/Garden Grove area!

Summary: My boyfriend and I stayed her for our Disneyland getaway and the staff was fantastic, the room was clean, with the fireplace going when we checked in. We were treated as any regular guest would be treated (I'm a Hilton employee) and the breakfast was great. It was easy to find off the freeway and the shuttle driver was very nice and drove safely (something I'm a stickler on). The front desk agent was always smiling and greeting us when we came in. The only complaint was that there weren't any extra pool towels so we had to share, but it was a bit late at night so it wasn't that big of a deal and I didn't say anything. Overall, excellent place. I highly recommend this, especially if you're going to the Orange County E-Zone
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to share your comments!  We are happy to hear you and your boyfriend had a great stay at our hotel.  Thank you for your compliments about the staff members and Disney shuttle drivers.  We will make sure to share your feedback with our team.  We are thrilled to know you have highly recommended our hotel.  We look forward to your next visit.  At Hampton, "we love having you here!".

Summary: We stayed in a Suite Room with two queens from Dec 17 - 22.  We were on the third floor facing Disney.  We were able to see some of the Disney fireworks.  We had two adults and 2 children.  It was nice to have the extra space during our stay.  The room had a nice patio which was nice to feel the sun on our faces.  The kitchen suite facilities are more than adequate for warming up left-overs or feeding the kids a light lunch/dinner and keeping the beer and wine cold.  The suite has a separate living area from the bedroom that had two queen beds.  The bathrooms are clean and spacious.  The sink is located outside the bathroom which allows more people to get ready in the morning.  The free breakfast includes a choice of 2 hot options each day.  During our visit we had tried the
Manager Response: Thank you for your kind comments.  I'll be sure to share your feedback with our staff.  We are really happy to hear that you and your family enjoyed your stay with us.  I am glad we were able to accommodate your requests and that we had your "Woody" doll from Toy Story, waiting on your return to our hotel.  Thank you all the helpful hints to our future guests.  Thank you for mentioning how spacious our suites are, how great our complimentary breakfast and our Disney shuttle are.  We find that these amenities add great value to our hotel.  We appreciate you choosing to stay at our hotel and we hope to see you again when your travels bring you back to the area!

Summary: I've stayed at MANY Hamptons and similar hotels, this one is outstanding.  I stayed here with my family and another family.  We had a one bedroom (2 Queens) suite and an adjoining room with a King bed.  it was like a 3 room apt.  In the room with 2 Queens we had 2 adults and 2 children. In the room with the King we had 2 adults and we had 2 children on the sofabed.  There was lots of room for all 8 of us in this hotel suite.  The kitchen facility was great - made some simple dinners (pasta, KD, grilled cheese).  It was 1 block to Target where we could get some groceries.  Rooms are modern and very clean and comfortable.  The staff is outstanding, super nice, always very accommodating and asking if we need help.  I stay in many "higher end" hotels and receive less service and
Manager Response: Thank you for your feedback!  We are thrilled to hear that we exceeded your expectations.  We will make sure to share your feedback with our staff.  Our guests' satisfaction is our #1 goal.  Thank you for mentioning the great value our hotel has.  We are really glad you enjoyed our spacious suites, fireworks view, our  "On the House" hot breakfast, the shuttle to Disney and fitness center.  Thank you for giving us the opportunity to serve you.  We look forward to your next visit!

Summary Heading: Great spot for families and teams!
Summary: We stay at this hotel several times per year with our childrens' ice hockey teams.  It is within walking distance to Disneyland as well as several good restaurants.  The staff is very helpful and extremely patient with the kids.  The rooms are not huge, but they are updated and always clean.  The breakfast bar, if included in your rate is a pretty good deal.  The pool area is fairly small and loses the sun behind the the tall hotel buildings depending on the time of year, but the kids don't seem to notice.
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to write a review.  We are happy to hear you are one of our loyal guests!  Thank you for your comments about our service, complimentary breakfast, cleanliness and price value.  We find that our hotel has the most value as one of the Top 3 hotels on TripAdvisor.  We thank you for being a loyal Hampton guest and we look forward to your future visit!

Summary: Absolutly beautiful!  The people were very gracious, and accomidating.   Summer 2011 my fam and I stayed here for five nights, on the top floor, with an outside deck, and was able to view the fireworks of disney land every night.  It was Very enjoyable!  When I travel, as most people, I expect to be treated with respect when i pay good money for a place! This place is the place to be if you expect the same treatment as I.  So if your traveling this way, check at this motel first, and book early, if you can:) Very happy with this place we will be back! Thankyou sooo much for a great start to our visit to california!       On a personal note: "If you must stay in Mesquite, NV, DO NOT STAY AT THE VIRGIN RIVER MOTEL AND CASINO!!! THIS PLACE WAS THE ONLY MAJOR DISSAPOINTMENT! PLUS
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to share your feedback.  We are delighted to hear you enjoyed your stay with us!  We take pride in our hotel as we strive to exceed all of our guests' expectations.  We will make sure to celebrate our staff's great service.  :)  Thank you for staying with us and it is our hope that we will have the pleasure of accommodating you on your future trips to the Garden Grove area!

Summary: easy to get to from highway, and me being not from here, it was a breeze to find and get to.Then just to add to this, you have a Target across the road, restaurants a few steps away, what more could you ask for..... but wait. You have Knotts berry farm 5 minutes anway and Disney a short drive. Close to highway for Universal Studios, so it was a pleasure to stay here. Hotel has great suites at great prices, big clean rooms and so friendly staff.I have stayed here twice now and will again when I bring friends over to visit parks. You can't go wrong here, everything you need in one place. The best.
Manager Response: Thank you for your feedback!  We are thrilled to hear you stay with us every time you visit the Disney area!  We will make sure to share your feedback with our "so friendly" staff.  :)  Our guests' satisfaction is our #1 goal.  Thank you for mentioning the great value our hotel has.  Not only do we have spacious suites, our suites also include kitchenettes, balconies and we also offer free "On the House" hot breakfast and free Wi-Fi internet.  Thank you for giving us the opportunity to serve you once again.  We look forward to your next visit!

Summary: Great hotel, good proximity to area attractions.  Hotel is fairly modern, in good condition, all staff was super friendly.  Manager though was the icing on the cake, very outgoing stood by the elevator each morning to greet guests for breakfast, this guy made you feel like you were staying at his home he cared so much.
Manager Response: Thank you for your kind comments.  We are delighted to hear you had a great stay with us!  Our entire staff takes pride in our hotel as we strive to exceed all of our guests' expectations.  Thank you for giving us the opportunity to serve you.  We look forward to your next visit.

Summary Heading: Great base for conference goers & families with children
Summary: I recently stayed at the Hampton Inn for a conference (which was taking place at the Hilton/Convention Center down the street) and my colleague brought her two small children. First off, I must stress how wonderful the staff were at this hotel! Great and friendly people all around! They welcomed us when we returned from the conference, helped us with the children (such as helping us move around furniture to make one large bed or getting our order of food from across the street as the restaurants didn't deliver), they helped with us purchase tickets (for Disneyland)  and make reservations - all with a smile. Amazing staff makes a big difference!  The Hampton Inn is located off a major thoroughfare - Harbor Blvd - although we never heard any traffic. It is about a 10 minute to the
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to write a review!  We are very happy to hear we exceeded your expectations.  We'll make sure to share your comments with our staff.  Thank you for mentioning on how close we are to Disneyland, the different stores, restaurants and the highways.  You also mentioned our complimentary services, such as the breakfast we offer and business center.  We also offer free Wi-Fi and our rooms all include a microwave and refrigerator.  We find that because of these reasons our hotel has the most value as one of the Top 3 hotels on TripAdvisor.  We appreciate you choosing to stay at our hotel and we hope to see you again, when your travels bring you back to the area.

Summary: We recently stayed at this property as a part of our Disney visit and this hotel is comfortable and conveniently situated close to Disney property and also has a bus service to disney at approx $3 per adult for 3 days. Taco Bell and other eateries are close by and even the room has many conveniences like Microwave and Refrigerator. Would surely recommend it as a family property!!
Manager Response: Thank you for your comments.  We are glad to hear that your stay with us was comfortable and convenient.  Thank you for mentioning our in-room amenities, fridge and microwave and the low cost of the Disney shuttle.  You are correct; there are savings on multiple day shuttle passes. We also have plenty of fast food restaurants within walking distance, aside from Taco Bell, there is a Jack in the Box, Subway, Carl's Jr., Dell Taco and plenty of restaurants as well.  We appreciate you choosing to stay at our hotel and we hope to see you again when your travels bring you back to the area!

Summary Heading: Very nice for family trips to Disneyland California, etc
Summary: Better late review than never. Hope to help other families plan out what could be hassle free or a comfortable vacation. We have been here for I think 2x or 3x already. First, I always book through their website and do it earlier so I can save. Second, we always like the family suite (coz my daughter likes the room - kid request). Third, they have the complimentary breakfast. Breakfast is one of the most important thing for me. Need those energy and could get grumpy without it. Fourth, we always use the shuttle that stops in front of the hotel. The price of the bus (per day) is very reasonable and you can go back to the hotel in the early afternoon (hot) and be back to disney in the late afternoon when it is cooler. So I save the parking fee and hassles of parking. So, we just
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to write a review! Thank you for your helpful hints to our reviewers.  We are very happy to hear our hotel meets all your needs and that you have a great stay, every time you visit us.  Thank you for highlighting the great value of the Disney shuttle and our complimentary breakfast every morning!  We thank you for being a loyal Hampton guest and we look forward to your future visit!

Summary: Our team 15 people stay in the hotel, very nice place and great service, we will come back next year, one of the best choice
Manager Response: Thank you for your comments!  We are delighted to hear your team of 15 guests enjoyed your stay with us.  Thank you for giving us the opportunity to serve you. We look forward to seeing you next year!

Summary: This hotel was GREAT!  I am a travel agent and put a college hockey team at this hotel.  The boys were very pleased with the service they received.  The breakfast was great, the rooms were very clean...especially when you pack three 20 year olds and their hockey gear into a room.  It was very conveniently located to many attractions that the team was able to explore on their down time.  The hotel staff was also very generous and gave the team an extended check out time due a late game series.   I book many hotels for sports teams, I can assure you we will be back to this hotel, and if any other teams that I book travel for will be in the area for games, I will be sure to call this hotel first.
Manager Response: We are delighted to hear the hockey team enjoyed their stay with us!  We are glad to hear they were able to enjoy our complimentary breakfast and the comfort and cleanliness of our guestrooms.  Here at Hampton, we strive to exceed all of our guests' expectations.  We look forward to having the opportunity to serve your guests on their next visit to the Garden Grove area!

Summary Heading: My stay at Hampyon Inn Anaheim/Garden Grove
Summary: My stay at this hotel was an excellent and remarkable experience.  I was most impreesed by the warm, friendly and eager to help attitude of each and every staff person that I came in contact with fro the front desk to the housekeeps.  I was also impressed by how neat and well kept the outside and inside common areas were. The room was very neat, clean and fresh.  I have told my friends as well as straingers whom I meet that if and when they visit the Anahiem area, this is my hotel of choice.  The room rate for the hotel is rasonable in my openion and the stay is very rewarding.
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to write a review.  We are thrilled to hear you had an excellent experience at our hotel. Thank you for your comments about our service, cleanliness and price value.  We find that our hotel has the most value as one of the Top 3 hotels on TripAdvisor.  Thank you for choosing to stay at Hampton, we look forward to having the opportunity to serve you on your next visit to the Garden Grove area.

Summary Heading: Stay Away - this hotel has bedbugs!
Summary: This hotel was just ok, until we found bedbugs. The breakfast was an average continental breakfast (cereal, bagels, waffles,) with 2 hot plates which were disgusting. Always a "mixer" egg product with processed cheese, and a processed meat of some sort.  The workout room was too hot, as the a/c wasn't working.  The "tot" pool was filthy, until they emptied it, then it just sat empty.  The kitchenette was lacking basic supplies for an extended stay (no fry pans, no slicing knives, no toaster, no dish soap, no dish towels or sponges) The cleaning staff didn't regularly replace our room supplies (coffee, conditioner, moisturizer)  And even though they have the "replace or reuse" sign for towels, they regularly ignored it, and took our towels even though I had them hung up to reuse.
Manager Response: While it is regrettable that this situation happened to you and your family I want to let you know that the hotel takes this matter very seriously.  Even though the hotel does its part to inspect and check for these types of occurrences, we also use a nationally recognized professional company to treat rooms if the situation calls for it.  If a room needs to be serviced not only is that room serviced but all surrounding rooms are serviced to ensure that the matter is addressed.  We apologize for this unfortunate situation but still want to assure you that the guest experience is our top priority.  Our goal is to provide a positive experience to every guest that stays are our hotel.

Summary Heading: Wonderful Family Stay.But breakfast needs help
Summary: I love love love this hotel. Its has always been clean. Beds are comfy and the staff are wonderful. We celebrated Mickey's Halloween Party and we came home very late afraid we won't have any place to park. But we had no problem at all. The only problem I have with this hotel is Breakfast, the most important meal of the day!! My family and I skipped breakfast 2 out of the 3 days we were there. It just wasn't up to Hilton standards. Now I know not to expect Embassy breakfast but I do expect something better than 2 warm items. The eggs were either dry or too wet, sausage was way over cooked, and this thing that they made with a bagel. Please change the menu or get better cooks. While I was eating my dry fruit, I over heard the family next to me saying " Mom, you said we were
Manager Response: We are delighted to hear you enjoyed your stay with us!  Our guests' satisfaction is our #1 goal.  We thank you for your concerns regarding our breakfast options.  We will look  into how we can improve our breakfast menu.  Thank you for giving us the opportunity to serve you once again.  We look forward to your next visit!

Summary: My daughter and I stayed for 2 nights at the Hampton.  Check-in was efficient.  All desk clerks were helpful answering questions about Disneyland/California Adventure tickets, shuttles, etc.  Although one elevator was out of service, we managed to get our belongings to the third floor.   Pool area was clean, My only gripe was the lack of clean towels and canopies as the Anaheim sun can be brutally hot.  Since the purpose of the visit was to spend two days at the Disney theme parks, our days started early.  The breakfast was fine - eggs, bacon, fruit, waffles -- the usual hotel buffet fare.  Staff quickly cleaned tables and replenished food, which was nice.  I will note that the staff was exceptionally polite and responded immediately to any requests.  The room was fine/clean -
Manager Response: Thank you for your feedback.  We are glad you were satisfied with your stay with us.  We will share your comments with the Front Desk team, Breakfast team and Disney drivers.  We are glad they provided great service to you and your family.  We apologize the elevator was out of service upon your arrival and that there were insufficient pool towels during your visit.  We will utilize your comments to ensure we are maintaining clean towels by the pool.  Thank you for staying with us and it is our hope that we will have the pleasure of accommodating you on your future trips to the Garden Grove area!

Summary Heading: Great room, good breakfast and convenient shuttle!
Summary: We stayed at hampton inn in oct 2011 and our room was very nice and clean! Our room had a fridge, microwave and a flat screen tv. Our bed was super comfortable, It made for a great nights sleep!!! The hotel isnt walking distance from disneyland but they have a shuttle that is cheap and super convenient, it leaves every half hour so you don't feel like your changing your plans for a shuttle (i've done that in the past and its really inconvenient). They have a pretty good breakfast also, its free and has everything you need. I would defiantly stay here again! Dont let the distance from disneyland scare you away (as it would have for me). This hotel is worth it and the shuttle makes up for that anyway.
Manager Response: Thank you for your comments.  We are glad to hear that during your stay with us, you enjoyed our room amenities and that you got a great night‚Äôs sleep.  Thank you for mentioning our complimentary breakfast and our Disney shuttle, we find these amenities have great value.  We appreciate you choosing to stay at our hotel and we hope to see you again when your travels bring you back to the area!

Summary: We we're always greated by the front desk as we left and entered the hotel and they were very friendly at check in. The lobby has fun inviting colors and music playing. The rooms were clean and cozy, we were in a two double bed room and it was just right for two people per bed. My mother in law has a king suite which had a small kitchen, living room and bedroom with walk in closet. Her room was like a small apartment which was great when we all got together for pizza and drinks. The breakfeast had a nice selection not just fruit and juice. The shuttle service to the park was on time, fast and never crowded. This was a great stay for the family and even as a couple my fiance and myself will be returing again.
Manager Response: Thank you for your comments!  We are thrilled to hear that our staff provided you with great service!  We will make sure to share your comments with our team!  Thank you for mentioning how clean, cozy and spacious our standard room and suites are!  We are happy to hear your family enjoyed our complimentary breakfast and the shuttle service to Disneyland!  We will see you and your fianc√© here soon!

Summary: Stayed here 2 nights at the end of our holiday. We were warmly welcomed and checked in with no problems, we had prepaid. The room was clean and comfortable the only drawback was the loud a/c. The breakfast was good, hot and cold choices and plentiful with lots of seating. We even took a bag to go as my son didn't want the breakfast so early when we were leaving. We were greeted each time we came back to the hotel which was nice as quite often you become invisible once you have checked in. We were told we would have to pay for car parking but as we checked out, we were pleased to be told they had waived the charge. This was a nice touch as to us it was 1 of the only negatives about this hotel. Thanks to all the staff for a lovely stay.
Manager Response: Thank you for your feedback!  We are happy to hear you had a lovely stay at our hotel!  We are sorry to hear you experienced a loud A/C.  Your feedback assists us improve our future guests' experience.  We are glad to hear you took advantage of our breakfast "On the Run" bags.  They are great for when our guest's don't have a chance to sit and enjoy our complimentary ‚ÄúOn the House" hot breakfast.  I am delighted to hear our staff made sure to acknowledge you every time you arrived back to the hotel.  We strive to exceed all of our guests' expectations!  We will make sure to share your feedback with our staff.  We look forward to your future visit!

Summary Heading: GREAT Staff and a very clean environment (considering the traffic level)
Summary: This is the Hampton Inn and Suites that services the Disneyland Resort so one would expect that it would have a pretty full utilization.  Despite this, the hotel is immaculate. Very clean and very quite. I would expect to have a lot of noise with families and such but for the whole stay I didn't hear anything outside of our room beyond the Disneyland fireworks.   The staff were great. They made a point to welcome me as a return guest and as a Platinum Hilton Honors Member.  The first morning we came out of the elevator to a very nice young lady standing at the elevators greeting people and pointing them in the direction of shuttles and breakfast.
Manager Response: Thank you for your comments!   Thank you for mentioning our hotel's cleanliness, room quietness and great service you were provided with!  We will make sure to share your feedback with our staff.  We are happy to hear that you had a great stay with us!   We thank you for being a loyal HHonors member!  We look forward to your next visit!

Summary: The room size made it very easy for 5 adults to stay in a room very nicely. The pool and hot tub were great and the kids loved them too. The free breakfast and service was icing on the cake to make this the best hotel we stayed at on our week trip.
Manager Response: We appreciate your feedback!  Thank you for mentioning how much your family enjoyed  the size of our rooms, our pool and hot tub.  We love to hear that your family also enjoyed our complimentary breakfast and that our service was icing on the cake!  We are glad to have exceeded your expectations!  We look forward to your next visit!

Summary: Good solid hotel.  It really helps that they offer a decent breakfast every morning in the lobby.  It saves money and time and my 5 year looks forward to it every morning.  I also like that they do not use the Anaheim Resort Transport system for the shuttle to Disneyland.  You do have to pay a minimal amount for the shuttle service they use but the service is much much better.   The front desk crew all around were very nice and helpful.   They were able to store our luggage the day we were leaving and were very informative about shuttle service to the airport.
Manager Response: We thank you for your kind comments!  Thank you for highlighting the great value of our complimentary breakfast every morning.  Thank you for also highlighting the value of the Disney shuttle, you are correct, the fee is a bit less than for ART.  We are thrilled to hear our Front Desk staff assisted you with all your needs!  We will share your comments with the team!  We hope to have the opportunity to serve you once again in the future!

Summary: I really enjoyed my stay at this hotel,the staff was outstanding when there was a problem.This hotel will always be the place I will book when I come to visit Anaheim,Ca.Very happy customer.Thank you
Manager Response: Thank you for your feedback!  We are very pleased to hear you enjoyed your stay!  We will share your comments with our staff.  We look forward to your next visit!

Summary: Had a 4 night stay here,had stayed in Hamptons before in FLorida and always enjoyed them. Nice big modern hotel,staff very friendly and helpful.Rooms were great,roomy and modern fittings. Breakfast was standard fare for the Hampton chain which was enjoyable and plenty of. Looks like they have hit on a winner with the waffle makers. Plenty going on in the area with easy access to chain restaurants and a large Target just over the road. Would defiantly recommend a stay here. Only gripe which seems to be a California thing is having to pay for parking,have never come across this throughout Florida.
Manager Response: Thank you for your comments!  It is delightful to hear that you were very pleased with our staff's service and that our hotel met all your needs.  "Our #1 goal is your 100% satisfaction!"  Thank you for staying with us.  We hope to see you again on your next visit to the Disneyland Resort area!

Summary Heading: Bed Bugs and they don't care!
Summary: My children were covered with bedbug sores after staying in room 503!  I contacted Hampton 3 times, first being polite, then demanding and still absolutely no response.  Very disapointing, this experience traumatized my kids and tainted our vacation to Disneyland.
Manager Response: I apologize for the delay in responding to this review but TripAdvisor just posted it today, one month after you submitted it.    In a letter that goes out to every guest at check-in after welcoming the guest to the hotel I write,   ‚ÄúYou have been kind enough to choose our home while visiting the area and we are grateful.  We have 3 main goals for your stay:  1.	Extend exceptional and excellence service; 2.	Provide you with outstanding accommodations; 3.	Exceed each and every one of your expectations.  If at any time we do not meet any of the above mentioned goals, I want to hear from you.  Your enjoyment and comfort at this hotel is of the utmost importance to me and our team members.  Please do not hesitate to let us know in any area in which we have not met or exceeded your expectations.    My direct extension from your guest suite is 4-0-1.  In the event I am away from my office, please contact our Front Office Manager, Sandra, by dialing 4-0-3.  We are here to serve you.  Thank you for choosing the Hampton Inn and Suites Disneyland Area-Anaheim/Garden Grove.  It is our honor to host your stay.  Sincerely,  Thomas M. Long, General Manager‚Äù.  I truly mean every word that I state in that letter.  I don‚Äôt know why this is the first of me hearing of this situation or why we don‚Äôt have any record of an incident at all and at this point it does not matter.  As mentioned in the above excerpt for our welcome letter service, accommodation and exceeding guest expectations is what we strive for.  We take every guest incident, issue or inquiry very seriously.  While I did not know about this situation before, I do now know and we will be contacting you. You have given us enough information in this review to find you in the system and contact you.  We will be contacting you shortly to get more details about this event and to see what we can do to resolve this situation for you and your family.  Thank you for your feedback and we will talk to you soon.

Summary Heading: Decent but a little far from Disneyland
Summary: The rooms were clean enough.  The breakfast area was always busy but constantly being stocked.  The hotel is a elite further away from Disneyland than I'd like but was a good value.
Manager Response: Thank you for your review!  Thank you for pointing out that our hotel has a good value.  We find that our hotel has the best value as one of the Top 3 hotels on TripAdvisor.  We hope you visit us again soon!

Summary: stayed several  nights. room was clean, requested odd number side of hotel in order to see the fireworks from our room. floors 6 or seven are best. strange,  no exhaust  fan in the bathroom! breakfast was average, but no bacon, and "powder eggs" were served.   Very quiet atmosphere. we enjoyed the pool (5' deep), sauna, and kiddie pool which is about 1" deep.  ART  transportation station is in front of the embassy suites, and ran pretty much on schedule, every 20 minutes.  very cordial drivers I must say.  The hallway on our floor was hot, guess they're conserving energy. the Hamton is in close walking distance  to restaurants, and seemed safe.
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to write a review!  Thank you for highlighting some of the amenities we offer at our hotel.  We are glad to hear you had a quiet stay.  Thank you for enjoying our pools and taking advantage of the ART transportation to Disney.  We appreciate your feedback; we will share it with our Breakfast and Maintenance team, so that we can improve our guests' experience.  We hope to see you again soon!

Summary Heading: Met expectations - The staff exceeded our expectations!
Summary: Stayed here 4 nights in late August with my husband and children (ages 11, 7 & 5).  We typically stay at Hampton Inns when traveling locally but this was the first staying at a "tourist' destination with this chain. We enjoy Hampton Inns for their complimentary breakfast, delicious coffee and plush bedding. This hotel met our expectations.   Living on the East coast, our natural alarm clocks woke us up by 7AM & breakfast was never crowded at that hour. It was also always hot & fresh. We also enjoyed the option of dining outside. The pool was nice, nothing fancy, just enough to cool you down after a hot day. The room was big enough for us to sleep comfortably (2 queens & a rollaway bed). We weren't in our room much but it was always clean and the mini fridge came in handy.   The
Manager Response: Thank you very much for the kind comments!  We are thrilled to hear that our staff made you feel at "home"!  We'll make sure we share your comments with them and to distinguish Oscar, for exceeding your expectations!  Thank you for pointing out the value of the complimentary breakfast, pool and Disney shuttle.  As one of the top 3 hotels on TripAdvisor, we find that our hotel has the best value.  We thank you for being a loyal guest to the Hampton brand, "we love having you here"!  We hope to see you again soon!

Summary Heading: Very good value, would book again!
Summary: We purposely booked this hotel for a 3 night stay given the great reviews. We were not disappointed. We have stayed at many Hamptons before so knew what to expect. We booked the family room as we have a 9 yr old son so thought this would be the best option. I have to say though that we werent keen on the layout of this room and I asked at reception for an alternative. I was offered a ground floor room with 2 beds, however, we didnt want ground floor. The girl on reception was very good and patient and found another room with a king bed and a rollaway on the same floor and allowed me to have the key to look at it first to ensure if was what I was looking for. The room was clean and actually much nicer in person than the pictures suggest. My advice would be to go early for
Manager Response: We thank you for taking the time to write a review!   Thank you for your helpful hints for our reviewers!  We are glad to hear that our hotel met all your needs and that your family had a great stay!  We look forward to having you stay with us again soon!
