Summary: This Hampton is an excellent hotel at a very reasonable price.  We paid a total of $20 for a 3-day shuttle pass for a family of four.  The breakfast was very good, beds were comfortable, and I would not hesitate to stay there again.
Manager Response: Thank you for your feedback!  We are glad to hear you and your family enjoyed your stay with us!  We look forward to your next visit!

Summary: If you are not looking for fancy and top of the line amenities but are looking for top service and very nice amenities, this is the place for you!  I stayed here with my family for nine nights and couldn't have been happier with my choice.  The rate could not be beat for the size of the room (kitchen suite) and it slept six of us!  In all of the hotels I have stayed at, and some of been quite costly and top of the line, I have never ever received such great service from each and every member of this staff!  They cannot do enough to help you feel at home, to help you with information, to make your stay more comfortable, and to just be there to say good morning!  If I come to this area again, I will be certain to stay here again, and if I don't visit this area again, I will surely
Manager Response: Thank you for your kind comments and for taking the time to write a review.  We will definitely share your comments with the staff.  Here at Hampton, we strive to provide excellent service!  We are glad to hear that you and your family had a great stay with us!   We look forward to having the opportunity to serve you again in the future.

Summary: We really liked this place, wife and two kids, 2 & 5 went to Disney. The service was excellent, they had a shuttle that take us to Disney for 7 dollars daily (all familly). The brakefast is fine, eggs, saussages, waffles, baggles, etc.  It was a very nice experience. Also I recomend the restaurant that is outside the hotel Bucca di Beppo... Excellent!!!
Manager Response: We thank you for your comments.  We are very pleased to hear you had an excellent experience.  We hope you visit us soon again!

Summary Heading: Loved it except for the parking fee.
Summary: For our family of five, we had a 2 queen suite - 2 rooms, kitchen, TV and sofabed in one room, two queen beds, TV and the bathroom in the other which was absolutely perfect for us.  The housekeeping was great, left enough towels for us every day without us having to leave notes to request them.  Breakfast was your usual fare.  My only complaints are that I think the $12 parking fee is ridiculous,  the shuttle to and from Disneyland should be more often than twice within an hour, and when asked about restaurants that were open late at night, the gentleman at the front desk said they were limited and kept pushing for something to be delivered - we found a Coco's 2 minutes away on our own that is open 24 hours.  But I feel the good outweighs the bad with this hotel and would highly
Manager Response: Thank you for sharing your feedback!  We are glad to hear our suite accomodated your family well and that it worked out perfectly.  Thank you for your comments about our housekeeping staff.  We will share your experience with both our Housekeeping and Front Desk staff, so that we may improve our guest experience.  We look forward to having the opportunity to serve you again in the future.

Summary: I have to say that if you are looking into this hotel for a trip to Disneyland and you have young kids this probably would be a very good place to stay. This hotel was overloaded with children everywhere.   If you are looking at this hotel being solo or on a business trip I would recommend the Hilton Garden Inn found in the same parking lot.   This hotel does offer free hot breakfast in the morning. The breakfast buffet isn't as good as some of the other Hampton Inn's I have stayed in in the past. But it wasn't horrible either. They have the standard waffles, toast, muffins, and cereal each morning. I was here for 5 days and for the hot foods on two of the days it was cheese omelets, one day was a breakfast pizza, and another scrambled eggs (that's all I remember), oh and I
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to write a review.  We appreciate your feedback, it gives us insight on how we can improve our guests' experience.  We apologize, it seems we fell a bit short from exceeding your expectations.  I'd like the opportunity to speak to you further, for additional comments or suggestions. If it is not much of an inconvenience, please contact me by emailing me at sandra.zuno@hilton.com.

Summary Heading: Great Service, Very Good Hampon Inn
Summary: The first thing we noticed about this hotel was how friendly everyone was. Every member of the staff treated us well, as if we mattered, which is always welcome - and not always the case.  In terms of other items, the room was also quite nice. It was spacious, quiet and clean, the bed was comfortable, the shower had good pressure and plenty of hot water. TV was good with many channels available. There was a lot of parking (though this is not quite apparent at first - the lot in front was jammed. The lot to the side had a lot of room.  There is a restaurant (Bucca di Beppo) sharing the same parking lot and a couple of fast food restaurants across the street. It's about a mile walk to Disney. The hotel also provides their own cash shuttle to Disney, for about the same price as the
Manager Response: Thank you for your feedback!  We are glad you had a great stay at our hotel.  Our goal here at Hampton, is to exceed all of our guest expectations.  We look forward to the opportunity to serve you again soon!

Summary Heading: Fabulous Stay - Outstanding Staff and Hotel
Summary: We initially booked this hotel while attending the Global Conference on Educational Robotics which was being held at the Hyatt right across the parking lot.  However, we had trouble with our van and ended up staying here from July 8th - July 28!!  I can't say enough about how wonderful the staff was in regards to making us as comfortable as possible while being stranded here.  They were always cheerful and accommodating.  The front desk staff, particularly Oscar and Isabella, were constantly changing our reservations according to the latest news on our car.  Since we were traveling with robots and supplies in a minivan with a luggage carrier on top, I didn't think I could even check out of the hotel to rent a car to drive to Phoenix to see my mother-in-law.  However, the Hampton
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to write a review!  We are delighted to that our staff exceeded your expectations!  Thank you for sharing your experience at our hotel.  It's very nice to hear that despite you car trouble, your experience turned out to be a pleasant one. We hope you visit us again soon!

Summary: This hotel was what I expect a Hiton property. It was clean and comfortable, but more importantly, the customer service was outstanding. The front desk staff was efficinet and made us feel right at home after a long drive. They asked if we had eaten yet and recommended several dining options based on what we had in mind. It is wihin walking distance of the Disney parks, but not stuffy and congested. The breakfast area was always well stocked and well staffed. The breakfast staff also made sure that tables were clean and readily available. A great family atmosphere, ease to get in and get out, and location make this a great place to stay.
Manager Response: We thank you for your feedback!  We are delighted to hear you had a great stay.  We are glad to hear that we made you feel right at home and that our staff helped you with all your needs.  Thank you for joining us for breakfast in the mornings, we are also glad to hear you were very pleased by it.  We look forward to your next visit!

Summary: We came to attend a family wedding in a nearby hotel.  The hotel was clean, neat and comfortable.  Breakfast being included made it quite economical.  We weren't there for Disneyland, but for anyone making the trip, it is close by.  Restaurants on the street are inexpensive and interesting for lunch or dinner.  A nice place worth considering.
Manager Response: Thank you for staying at our hotel!  We know you have many choices and we are glad to hear you decided to stay with us!  We are happy to hear you enjoyed your stay!  We hope to see you on your next visit to the Disneyland area.

Summary: We Stayed 5 nights here in July 2011 and enjoyed all five nights breakfast was good the staff were wonderful and friendly the check in staff did an awesome job answered all of our questions.. couldnt ask for better service.. I would stay there again without a doubt.. Hotel was further to Disneyland then expected but the shuttle service got us to disneyland and the staff with them were good too...+++  Enjoyed our stay +++
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to give your feedback!  We love hearing that our staff did a wonderful job providing service!  We hope you visit again soon.  We look forward to having the opportunity to serve you again in the future.

Summary Heading: Great place to stay near Disneyland and reasonably priced
Summary: Hotel was clean and modern.  Rooms were adequately sized for couples or teenagers and the staff was outstanding.  The Breakfast area got crowded during the breakfast rush but then this is summer and families descend on Disneyland like crazy.  Would definitely stay at this place again next time we're in the area.  Place is real convenient tio restaurants and withinwalking distance to Disney.  Shuttle service was very convenient and is a lifesaver during the hot days.
Manager Response: Thank you for your feedback!  We are glad to hear our hotel was just what you were looking for.  We look forward to your next visit at our hotel!  "We love having you here at Hampton!".

Summary: Absolutely impressed with the staff of all levels. Cheerful all the time and went out of their way to supply us with everything from google maps to booking drivers for us. Always greeting us whenever we saw them, we just loved it there.
Manager Response: Thank you for your generous feedback!  We are delighted to hear that our staff was able to assist you with all your needs.  We look forward to serving you again in the future.  At Hampton, "we love having you here!".

Summary: I have to admit that I was a little worried when I booked this hotel, because the price was reasonable.  However, it turned out to be one of the best hotels that I have ever stayed in.  First, the staff is very friendly and helpful.  The breakfast was very good (each day you get some egg item and another hot item, waffle maker, fruit, muffins, cereals, etc.) The room was extremely clean and well maintained (I have high standards in this area).  The hotel is over a mile from Disneyland, however, the hotel offers their own shuttle which is cheaper than the ART.   The shuttle comes to the hotel :10 and :40, and the drivers were also very friendly.
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to share your thoughts.  We are thrilled to hear you fully enjoyed your experience at our hotel!  We strive to exceed all of our guest expectations!  "Your satisfaction is our #1 goal".  We look forward to serving you again in the future.

Summary: I stayed at this hotel for my Disney vacation, and was well worth the price. I do suggest booking early since pricing does go considerably the longer you take to book. One negative thing of our visit, we initially booked what we thought was a "family room" with bunk beads, but this turned out to be a room with two sleeping mats. Was not very pleased with this, so had to settle with a two bed room.   One thing i will give this place credit, the staff is very friendly and extremely helpful. They made my stay real pleasant.
Manager Response: We thank you for staying with us during your visit to Disney!   We strive to provide excellent service to all of our guests.  We apologize you received a different type of room than what you expected.  We are in the process of changing the description of this specific room type.  We are delighted to hear the staff assisted you with your needs.  We look forward to having you stay with us again in the future.

Summary: The hotel is in a GREAT location, take advantage of the shuttle to Disney as it is much cheaper than driving and parking at Disney.  The hotel is In walking distance to Red Robin, and Oggies Pizza (an excellent choice for pizza).  The Staff were all very friendly and the hotel accommodated a family of five, with an excellent Military rate. Our only critisism is that it was not possible to sleep on the rollaway bed.  We had to take the mattress off the frame and put it on the floor, as it tipped over, and even after we took it off the frame we could feel the springs in the mattress. I would stay at this hotel again when in the area.
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to share your comments.  We thank you for staying at our hotel during your visit to the Disneyland Resort.  We strive to exceed all of our guests' expectations and we are happy to hear our staff was able to accomodate your family needs.  We look forward to seeing you again on your next visit to this area!

Summary Heading: Loved it, Hampton Inn never disappoint!!!
Summary: I have stayed at Hampton Inn properties before and strongly recommend it to anyone!! Decided to stay at this one even before it's not that near to Disneyland!  But no regrets!  We stayed at Hampton for our first and last leg sof our LA/SD/LV trip.  Hampton Inn's bed and bathroom are so comfortable!  Spacious room, more than enough for the 4 of us!  Breakfast choice was great!  My children enjoyed the idea of makign their own waffles.   Reception staff was great, helpful and very friendly.   Two grouses though.  First, during our second stay, the Wifi didnt work at all.  We had to use the computer in the reception!  Second, we have to pay for the parking which was quite steep at $12 per night.   Otherwise, love Hampton Inn.  Would definitely stay in other properties whenever I am
Manager Response: We thank you for stay with us during your visit to Disneyland!  We thank you for your feedback!  We are delighted to hear you will be staying at Hampton's during your travels.  We look forward to having the opportunity to serve you at our hotel again!

Summary Heading: Great stay for family Disneyland vacation
Summary: Stayed here with wife and two kids for 7 days in one of the suites and it was perfectly great. Clean rooms, friendly and helpful staff, decent breakfast service, good outdoor pool, and onsite laundry. The hotel is a 5-minute shuttle ride to Disneyland and close to all other amenities in the area. Would definitely stay here again.
Manager Response: We thank you for your feedback!  We are glad to hear you enjoyed your 7 day vacation at our hotel!  We look forward to your next visit to the Disneyland Resort and to your future stay at our hotel!

Summary: On arrival we were greeted by very friendly front desk staff. Our room was available immediately even though we arrived prior to the advertised check in time.  We loved sitting on the balcony and enjoyed the great view of the Disneyland fireworks every night. The accommodation is basic however the bed was extremely comfortable and the television had excellent reception, much better than the Hilton Times Square in New York where we had a nightmare stay. All staff were extremely helpful and nothing was too much trouble for them.  It was great to have free internet  and printer in the lobby as we do not have a laptop. Would recommend this hotel to anyone wanting affordable accommodation with plenty of room and not too far from Disneyland.  Great having Target within walking
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to share your feedback!  We are glad you were able to enjoy your stay and took advantage of our hotel free amenities and the view of the fireworks from your suite balcony.  We hope to have you visit us again in the future.  "We love having you here!"

Summary: We have stayed here twice. The rooms are really clean.  The pool is great if you have little ones. The beds and linens are just like home. The breakfast I really good, my kids were asking I they could eat there rather then a restauraunt. A crisp clean duvet is heaven after a day at Disneyland.
Manager Response: Thank you for sharing your comments!  We are happy to hear your stay was "just like home".  We are happy to hear that your children enjoyed our breakfast over eating at a restaurant!  We look forward to having the opportunity to serve you again!

Summary: Having booked a trip to the land of the Mouse very last minute, our hotel choices were limited. However, we loved this hotel! We had a seventh (top) floor room on the odd-numbered side, so we had a great view of the fireworks, which was a bonus we were not expecting. The staff was very helpful, friendly and courteous, from housekeeping to the front desk, all staff members we encountered were very accommodating. The free buffet breakfast each morning was great, there was even some variety in the hot food choices. The pool area was lovely and clean-be warned that while the main pool is heated, the kiddie pool is not-brrr! Also, we were expecting to have to rely on ART, since this hotel is about 2 miles from the park entrance, however we were pleasantly surprised to find that the
Manager Response: Thank you for sharing your comments!  We are delighted to hear you were able to enjoy our breakfast and the different ammenities and services we offer at our hotel.  We strive to provide excellent service to all of our guests.  We are glad that our staff was able to assist in creating a great memories during your visit to Disney!  We look forward to having you visit us again!  "We love having you here!".

Summary: We stayed here for 2 nights after having a horrible expericene at another hotel in the area.  I wish we would have stayed here to begin with.  The staff was very helpful and pleasant.  Rooms were quiet and clean.  Breakfast was really good.  I would definitely stay here again.
Manager Response: We are delighted to hear you enjoyed your stay with us!  Our guests' satisfaction is our #1 goal.  We look forward to having the opportunity to serve you on your next visit to the Disney area.

Summary: This was a good hotel. I liked the breakfast every morning. Hot foods, cereal, tea coffee, biscuits could have had a bit more variety on the hot breakfast items though My room was cleaned daily and on time which was a bonus. A little mix up on check in, saying my mom never booked a second room, wasnt impressed.  Shuttle to Disneyland is just across the parking lot Target, Cocos bakery and Red Robin right across the street. Good Location  All in all I would definetly stay here when at Disneyland again
Manager Response: Your feedback is greatly appreciated!  We are glad you were satisfied with the ammenities and cleanliness of our hotel.  We take pride in our hotel as we strive to exceed all of our guests expectations.  We apologize for the inconvenience you had at check-in, thank you for giving us the opportunity to serve you once again.  We look forward to your next visit!  "We love having you here!"

Summary: Hotel was very accommodating.   I called the day before my arrival and wanted to check in a day early. The suite had a full kitchen, sleeper sofa, and 2 queen beds.   Breakfast was very nice and wasn't very crowded. Plenty of seats were available.  The hotel had it's own shuttle to Disney. This was so much better than the city bus that most hotels use. It ran frequently and was always on time. Kids under 7 were free and adults were about $4.00.  We usually stay at Embassy Suites or Marriott Suites, but we will stay here every time we go to Disney from now on. It's not plush by any means, but very nice!
Manager Response: Thank you very much for your comments!  We are glad our staff was able to accomodate your needs.  Our goal is to provide excellent service to all of our guests.  We look forward to having you visit us again!  "We love having you here!"

Summary Heading: Very pleasantly suprised, great deal, wonderful accomodations
Summary: Our family (2 adults, 1 toddler) was looking for a last minute stay for a trip to Disneyland and I was skeptical about booking this hotel, Hampton Inn ANAHEIM which was the furthest from our hotel search, about 8 mi. away on average from Disneyland d/t a convention taking place that weekend. I skimmed thru past reviews, and decided to give this a try. With a AAA discount, we were able to get an $89.00 per night (!) rate and with taxes, etc the bill came out to $100.  We were very happy to see renovated accommodations, decent sized suite with a separate 'living room' - - desk, sofa, flat screen, etc. along with very clean and comfortable beds and linens. They offer complimentary toiletries if you ask, forgotten razor, etc.  It was a quiet room (#415) even if it overlooked the
Manager Response: Thank you for your kind response.  I believe the hotel you stayed at may not have been this location as we are less than a mile away from Disneyland; we still appreciate your comments.  The guest experience is of outmost importance to us so we are glad you enjoyed your stay.  We look forward to your next visit to the area.

Summary: Visited for two nights and did not regret staying at the Hampton Inn and Suites.  The room was clean, spacious and comfortable.  Had very little noise from the outside.  Appreciated the refrigerator in the room.  Both mornings, we enjoyed the breakfast here.  Would say other Hampton Inns have had more food choices than we experienced here, although we had plenty to eat and all the kids had something they wanted.  Staff was friendly and helpful.  Wish it was closer to Disneyland, so we could walk to it.  Wish parking was not an extra charge too.
Manager Response: Thank you for your kind response. It is our ongoing goal to supply our guest with the best product possible.  Your comments and feedback help us with this process.  The guest experience is of outmost importance to us so we are glad you enjoyed your stay.  Our goal is to exceed the expectations of our guests.  Comments and feedback such as yours helps us accomplish this goal and provide an even better product to our guests.  Thank you again for your feedback.  We look forward to your next visit to the area.

Summary: We booked online through expedia to join my sister's family for 6 days at Disneyland.  I am happy to say the hotel staff were pleasant and extremely helpful in suggesting options on a number of issues we hadn't considered.  We appreciated the bus shuttle service to Disneyland at a very reasonable price, the breakfast was hearty with enough variety to suit everyone's  taste. I will make a point of continuing to vacation using the Hilton line of Hotels.
Manager Response: Thank you for sharing your comments!  We are delighted you and your family enjoyed your stay!  Our goal is to exceed our guests' expectations and we are glad our staff was was able to do assist you with all your needs.  We look forward to having you visit us again!

Summary: We stayed to visit Disneyland from 12-29-2010 to 1-2-2011. It is not a waliking distance, so we got ART bus passes for the 2010.the bus stops in front of Embasy suites on the same premise. Then, as of Jan 1, 2011 Hampton and Hilton Garden Inn (they are on the same premise)  got their own bus route with the same price of $4 a day. ART bus comes every 20minutes and extra busses in the morning to go to Disneyland. We have to walk to the bus stop but the hotel bus comes every 30minutes (10minutes and 40minutes after the hour). the park stop is farther from the gate. On the night of  New Year's Day, we got there just after the bus left. Then, one bus came but he had no passengers. He was nice to take all of us to Hampton and HIlton.  The room has a fridge and a microwave.  The hotel
Manager Response: Thank you for sharing your thoughts.  Our guest suggestions assist us in improving our service.  We strive to exceed all of our guests' expectations.  We are glad you enjoyed your stay with us.  We look forward to having the opportunity to serve you again.

Summary: We stayed at this hotel for 2 nights, 3 days. We picked this hotel through a AAA Vacation package for Disneyland. At first we were hesitant with it since it had all mixed reviews. But we decided to go with it, and are very glad with the decision. Getting there was no problem, it was easy to locate. Parking was free because it was included in the package. Front desk greeted us with a smile and no wait times for a room. We didn't ask for help with luggage, but there was a bellman ready to assist. Room was big, king size bed, flat screen tv, microwave, etc. We did not utilize the pool, but we did take advantage of the complimentary hot buffet breakfast. It was better than what I had expected, besides your regular croissant, bagel and cold cereal, they had eggs, bacon, sausages,
Manager Response: Thank you for giving us the opportunity to serve you.  Your feedback is appreciated!  Our goal is to exceed all of our guests expectations.  We look forward to serving you on your next visit.

Summary: We are actually staying at the Hampton Inn as I write this review.  We are so happy with the cleanliness, the size of the suite and the service of this hotel. We had a concern about the comfort of the sofa bed and within minutes they brought up two NEW cots and our teenage boys had a great sleep. I would highly recommend this hotel, its in a lovely area close to grocery stores and good value.
Manager Response: Thank you for your comments!  We are delighted to hear that you and your family had a great stay!  We strive to exceed all of our guests' expectations and your feedback is appreciated.  We look forward to your return visit.  "We love having you here!".

Summary: Clean and accomodating.  Comforters are lumpy and very heavy to sleep under.  Many choices for breakfast with the egg entree different on various days.  Scrambled eggs were dry and mealy and not good, but improved when they were presented on half a bagel with melted cheese on top.  Breakfast staff was very friendly.  Nice to be able to eat outdoors in courtyard.  Phones were old and not in good working condition.  Could enjoy the Disney evening fireworks from our room.  If shuttle service to the convention center is provided by your convention, then this is a good location that is much less expensive than the hotels adjacent to the convention center.  Buca restaurant (Italian) next door is wonderful!
Manager Response: Thank you for feedback regarding your recent stay with us.  We appreciate your comments because it only helps us improve.   We strive to exceed all of our guests' expectations.  We look forward to having the opportunity to have you stay with us again.  Your satisfaction is our #1 goal!

Summary: There is a picture of what someone said was a rat in the pool. The mans wife then said it was an oppossum. Big difference. Ive stayed at the hotel and it was great ever since Mr. Thomas Long became the manager. Did the hotel handle the situation about the pool.
Manager Response: Thank you for you kind words.  We tried to do all we can to take care of our guests‚Äô needs while providing excellence service to our guests.  To answer your question, yes the pool situation was handled immediately.  This was an unfortunate situation where a possum wandered on to the pool area and fell in the pool.  That was the first time in the hotel‚Äôs history that something like that had happen but is was taken care of by the staff immediately.   I thank you for being one of our honored guests and I also thank you for standing up for the hotel.  We look forward to you next visit.

Summary: Had a great stay here.  All the staff were friendly and helpful; we especially appreciated seeing the manager do walk-throughs of the breakfast area to ask if everything were to our satisfaction.  The rooms appear to have been recently renovated:  bed was comfortable, and the bathroom was spacious, with plenty of counter space and storage.  All in all, a perfectly fine night at a great value.
Manager Response: Thank you for your comments regarding your recent stay with us.  We are truly grateful to have hotel team members that enjoy being of service to our hotel guests and make you feel comfortable while staying with us.  We know that you have many choices for hotel accommodations when staying in the Disneyland area and we appreciate you giving us the opportunity to host your accommodations.    We look forward to your return visit with us and and look forward to serving you again.

Summary Heading: Great Price, but noisey and not as nice as other Hampton Inns.
Summary: Great place to stay if you want value, free breakfast, Disneyland, location. It was noisey and not as clean as most Hampton Inns I've stayed at. The pool was full of kids, not really quiet like I prefer. I could walk to many restaurants, with bars, which I did like. The location for me was good to get onto the freeways to get around LA area. It's a good central location for what I wanted. The business center was fine, internet was slow. Front desk people weren't as professional as in other Hampton's I've stayed at, but they cater to families visiting Disneyland, not solo travelers like me. For the price it was a good choice and the room had decent ammenities. I would recommend the hotel, but not if you want quiet relaxation.
Manager Response: Thank you for your comments regarding your recent stay with us.  We take all feedback very seriously.  I know that the noise is an issue that you stated and we are taking measures to reduce the outside noise from the various buses and shuttles.  We continue to update and refine our accommodates so that we can meet and exceed our guest expectations.   We look forward to the next opportunity we have to serve you.

Summary: I just returned home from a trip to Disneyland with my family to celebrate both of our kid's birthdays over the weekend. I thought it would be appropriate to bring to your attention some concerns and feedback regarding my recent stay at one of your properties. I am a loyal Hilton customer and will NEVER stay at this property again (and we stay TWICE a year in Anaheim for our summer and fall vacations).  Upon arrival on Friday, October 8 (after a 6 hour drive from Phoenix), I approached the front desk clerk to check in. I asked the front desk clerk if there were any upgrades available as a Gold VIP. He checked and told me that he could only upgrade me for one night because the hotel was sold out after that. I told him not to worry about it (although it would have been nice).
Manager Response: Valued Guest, Again we apologize for your unpleasant experience.  Due to unexpected circumstances your reserved room was unavailable at the time of check-in.  While we normally do not go into details about the inner workings of the hotel, I believe this was one of the occasions that more details are warranted.   First the room type was unavailable at check-in because maintenance was being performed on the room do to damage that had occurred from a previous guest.  When a room is not guest ready we will not sell it.  When a hotel is in a sold out situation any room that has to be taken out of inventory has a negative effect on our guest.  We at the Hampton Inn are conscious of this and do all we can to make sure that our guests are taken care of.  This was one of the reasons we had maintenance personnel working on the room on the evening of your visit.  Fortunately, our maintenance staff was able to get the room back in service and you were able to check into the room.  As for guest preferences, we also do what we can to meet every preference.  We come as close as we can to meet that preference.  Trying to match the room type and the desired location can be difficult at times especially in a sold out situation.  When several guests are checking in with similar request we try to accommodate everyone.  On occasion, some guest preferences cannot be met because the option is not available on the day of arrival.  Noted was your request of an upgrade.  The team member stated that she could upgrade you for one night but the room type was not available for your entire stay.  This is a case of the hotel trying to meet a request and work within the framework of what we had available.  Since GOLD and DIAMOND members aren‚Äôt entitled to a complimentary upgrade at Hampton Inn or Hilton Garden Inn properties, this was an example of the hotel attempting to meet and exceed your expectation.  We here believe that even though the complimentary upgrade is not a benefit that is currently offered by the brand, it is still an expectation of our high level honors members and we try to provide it whenever we can. Secondly, as you are aware we have a beautiful outdoor pool area with a waiting pool, Jacuzzi and full size pool.  This area is gated and secure.  On the day in question a possum slipped through the fence and fell into the pool.  In the eleven years of this hotels existence this is the first time this has happened.  However, this situation is similar to a fly entering the hotel because a door was left open or a stray dog wandering into your yard.  These are all events that can happen even though every effort are taken to ensure that they don‚Äôt.  As soon as the hotel staff noticed that this had happen the situation was quickly taken care of.  We handled this situation like we handle all of our situations, as quickly and as prompt as possible.  Some mornings guest drop food in our lobby while they are taking their morning breakfast from the breakfast area to their rooms.  If you are standing next to the guest when it happens you will see the food spill on the floor.  However, within minutes of the event occurring, the hotel staff springs into action to clean up the mess helping to insure that additional guest are not impacted by the mess.   Finally, I understand that your guest experience was negatively impacted by the issues that occurred during your stay.  While there could be reasons why things happen the way they did we understand that it did not live up to your expectations.   For this reason we evoked the 100% Hampton Guarantee for you.  We here at the Hampton Inn and Suites believe in our 100% promise.  That is why we as a hotel make this statement to all of our guests. You have been kind enough to choose our home while visiting the area and we are grateful.  We have 3 main goals for your stay:  1.	Extend exceptional and excellence service; 2.	Provide you with outstanding accommodations; 3.	Exceed each and every one of your expectations. 4.	 It is our promise and our goal to live up to these principles or we will make it right for guest. This is our promise and that is being 100% Hampton.

Summary Heading: Pro: Free Internet, Con: Parking Cost
Summary: The room was fine, and I loved the free breakfast (you can't beat free!).  We did have some issues with the hotel.  The first night we were there someone was doing laundry at 12:30 at night, which is fine but they put there lock out so everytime the door would close it would bang.  After the third time my finace got up and told the woman she was being inconsiderate.  He also went down stairs to complain, the attendant at the front desk told him that they couldn't do anything once someone had started laundry.  Second night we came home after a fun filled day and wanted to jump in the hot tub, we got outside and there were bugs in it.  We asked the attendant if he could call someone to skim the hot tub, he said he would call our room once it was completed.  We never heard from
Manager Response: Thank you for having chosen to stay at the Hampton Inn & Suites - Anaheim/Garden Grove, during your recent visit to the Anaheim Resort Area.   I apologize, for it seems that we didn't exceed your expectations during your last visit.   We strive to exceed all of our guests' expectations and your feedback is greatly appreciated.  I look forward to having the opportunity of having you stay with us again.  Your satisfaction is our #1 goal!

Summary: Statyed here with my family and mother in law, so we got two rooms. The room is nothing fancy but clean, and we loved free wifi service. The breakfast is okay, they changed hot meal every day at least. The front staff were friendly and helpful. I'm glad that the Anaheim shuttle comes to the stop in the same property so we didn't have to walk long. If you are spending most of the day at Disneyland, this hotel is just fine, you can beat the value! Bucca (restaurant in front of the hotel) is okay but not worth for long wait, so if you don't mind driving, there are plenty of good restaurants around.
Manager Response: On behalf of the Hampton staff, thank you for staying with us during your last visit to the Anaheim area!  We are pleased to hear that your family and yourself enjoyed your stay at our hotel.  Your satisfaction is our #1 goal!  We look forward to having you stay with us again, next time you visit.  At Hampton, "we love having you here!".

Summary Heading: I love love love the Hampton Inn
Summary: I go to Disneyland multiple times a year, and I've stayed at a lot of the surrounding hotels in the area - The Hampton Inn and Suites is my favorite of all of the surrounding properties.  The hotel is maintained well, clean, and I have the feeling that the staff is really happy I am there when they smile and say hi.  The rooms are not huge, but the best are SO comfortable and the room is clean and updated.  The non-suite rooms come with a microwave and a dorm-room sized fridge, usually large enough to hold drinks, leftovers, and sandwhich fixings with some room to spare.  The breakfast buffett is pretty nice with fresh fruits, yogurt, a waffle station, fruit juice, oatmeal, cereal, hot coffee, and two rotating hot breakfast items.  The buffett opens at 6 a.m. and runs until 10
Manager Response: We thank you for your loyalty to our hotel!  Thank you for choosing to stay with us for the past four years, when you visit Disneyland.  We are delighted to hear that every stay you've had has been a great experience!  We strive to exceed all of our guests' expectations and your feedback is greatly appreciated!  We look forward to having you stay with us again, "We love having you here"!

Summary: This is our second time staying at this hotel.  Very comfortable beds, and large rooms with great ammenities.  ART shuttle in the parking lot to Disneyland.  A couple cons that I feel worth bringing up. The elevators are very slow and are being used by housekeeping so sometimes it will come to you full of employees and carts so you have to wait again. The powdered eggs, ew! Use real eggs or something better because those powedered scramble eggs are gross.
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to complete the survey regarding your recent stay with us. We are truly grateful to have hotel team members that enjoy being of service to our hotel guests and make you feel comfortable while staying with us. We know that you have many choices for hotel accommodations when staying in the Garden Grove area and we appreciate you giving us the opportunity to host your accommodations.

Summary: I stayed at the hotel for business as I was in town for a convention at the Anaheim Convention Center.  The staff at this hotel was very friendly.  Hilton is true to their word when it comes to the staff here.  The hotel lobby area was clean and always had at least one person at the front desk as well as someone in the eating area.  Once night they had free pizza which was nice to offer to the guests.  Every other night they had free popcorn.  The room was clean and roomy, as was the bathroom.  I didn‚Äôt hear much outside noise or traffic, as well as people in the hall or rooms next door.
Manager Response: On behalf of the Hampton Inn & Suites - Anaheim/Garden Grove, I would like to thank you for the opportunity to accommodate your guestroom needs.  Your satisfaction is our #1 Goal, and we trust that you felt ‚ÄúRight at Home‚Äù in our hotel.   We continually strive to provide quality service to our guests.  I hope that we were able to meet and exceed your expectations during your stay with us.  The Hampton Inn & Suites - Anaheim/Garden Grove team and I believe you are an important aspect in helping us meet our future guest‚Äôs expectations.  We look forward to hearing your comments regarding your recent stay with us.      We look forward to having you with us again and trust our hospitality and service have helped make your stay at the Hampton Inn & Suites - Anaheim/Garden Grove a success.

Summary: This was our second stay at the Hampton Inn Anaheim.  We were thinking of staying at the Red Lion on this trip for one reason only...the close walking distance to Disneyland but, after reading the negative reviews, we decided to return to the Hampton.  This hotel is still clean and comfortable and offers a great breakfast buffet.  It is located a bit more than a mile from the park so you best bet would be to take the ART which will pick you up in the hotel parking lot for $3 per day per person round trip.  It is also located a short walking distance to an Outback Steakhouse and a Red Robin.
Manager Response: We are very glad to hear you chose to stay with us once again!  More than anything, we are pleased to hear that your first stay was as great as your second stay!   You are correct, the Anaheim Resort Transit (ART) is the transportation service to Disney.  It runs back and forth throughout the day for a fee of $4.00.  The ART shuttle also offers different routes to local restaurants and shopping centers. We thank you for sharing your feedback and hope you choose to stay with us once again next time!

Summary: Stayed at the Hampton for 3 nights for a Disneyland visit. The stay started off badly when they put my wife and I in a 2 queen bed room, when we had asked for a king bed room (claimed they were out of king bed rooms). The hotel was very busy on a weekday.   Pros - Big and comfortable room. Clean. Free parking (if you book a tour package with Disneyland). Competent staff. Decent breakfast. I also liked the the laptop board which you can have on your lap while watching TV, which was a nice touch.   Cons - The Hampton is not that near to the Disneyland and the main drag. Need to rely on the shuttle bus to get to other places, but the bus runs once in 20 mins.
Manager Response: Thank you for sharing your feedback.  We apologize for not having a king size bed available during your stay with us.  Your comments assist us ensuring we exceed the expectations of all our guests! We hope you choose to stay with us again!  We love having you here at Hampton!

Summary: I liked the Hampton but it wasn't bright and airy...it was a little gloomy. I'm not saying this in a negative way because nothing is wrong with the hotel. The hotel made me sleepy...I like bright, open and airy places and this hotel wasn't like that....  The positives: has a full kitchen, free internet and free breakfast. The breakfast isn't the greatest but it's FREE and you will find something to hold you over until lunch. The make it yourself waffles is always a winner for my girls. So if for nothing more than a waffle and bowl of cereal you have a free breakfast. They served turkey sausage one morning with eggs...  The living space with pull out sofa was nice and spacious and having balcony was a fantastic to watch the disney the fireworks at night.   The bed...OMGosh the
Manager Response: Thank you for sharing your feedback!   We will use your feedback to us ensure we exceed the expectations of all our guests!  We regret that you had to move to another hotel, we hope you choose to stay with us next time.  We'd love to exceed your expectations!. We love having you here at Hampton!

Summary Heading: Very good option, except for the parking fee.
Summary: I am a big Hampton-Inn fan. Always use them when traveling to the U.S.  This is the first time I have been charged for parking in a Hampton Inn. I understand it is mentioned in the web site, I've stayed here three years ago and did not get charged, no I had to pay 12 dollars per night for parking.  I definitively find unacceptable to pay for parking in a hotel.  Additionally, paid 10 dollars per night for an extra bed. This two charges can make a difference in fare against other hotels.
Manager Response: We appreciate your feedback.  Thank you for choosing to stay at Hampton Inn & Suites, Garden Grove, CA while visiting the Disneyland Resort.  We love having you here at Hampton!

Summary Heading: all the positove reviews are true
Summary: Spent four nights here in mid june. It was hard to believe that everyone had nothing but good things to say about this hotel, but it's true. One of the most comfortable and quiet places I've stayed in , considering it caters to families viisiting Disney. From the front desk to the cleaning staff, all are polite , curtious and helpful. The free breakfast is more than adequate to get you started for the day. The rooms are clean and well maintained. The package we bought from West Jet included this hotel .  A wise choice!!
Manager Response: We greatly appreciate your feedbank. Thank you, it helps us ensure we meet the expectations of all of our guests. We love having you here at Hampton!

Summary Heading: The most comfortable hotel for families
Summary: This was our first trip to Disneyland and I am so glad we chose to stay here. The room was very clean and alot bigger than what I expected. For a family of six it was perfect. We had a balcony right off the living area where my husband watched the fireworks from Disneyland. We took the ART bus from the hotel to Disneyland every day, and it really paid off. Breakfast was hot and fresh everyday and one day they served biscuits, gravy and eggs (awesome). My room was stocked with clean towels everyday and extra blankets. I never once had to call to have my room cleaned and we were there for 5 days. On our return trip home I was able to print out directions via there free internet use. I've stayed at places that are so called resorts and they charge ridiculous prices for something as
Manager Response: Thank you for your feedbank. We love hearing from our guests, it helps us ensure we meet the expectations of all of our guests. We love having you here at Hampton!

Summary: We just came back after spending our week long honeymoon in Disneyland, staying at the Hampton Inn and Suites, Garden Grove.  I had checked all the reviews here beforehand and there definitely was a common theme: breakfast was great, clean rooms and friendly staff.  Going in with high expectations is sometimes dangerous but I'd say these expectations were met and exceeded, for sure.  The breakfast was amazing, we gorged ourselves on fresh fruit almost every day (one or two days it was not out, but change is good and other items caught our eye), made waffles a couple of times and overall thoroughly enjoyed the food.  It was almost like being in your own kitchen, so many choices (high quality fresh fruit consisted of orange and grapefruit slices, grapes, melon chunks and pineapple
Manager Response: We thank you for your feedbank.  It helps us ensure we meet the expecations of all of our guests. We love having you here at Hampton!

Summary: I like any hotel that greets you with a package of hot chocolate chip cookies!  But especially when it's $84.00 a night, clean and staffed with the nicest people ever.  Everyone seemed to love their job here and really demonstrated that they were concerned that you were having a great stay. If I were the hotel manager here, I'd pat myself on the back and give my staff a little appreciation party. Better than average Hampton free breakfast, this one included the "make your own waffle" station. There were plenty of staff to keep everything supplied and of course, be friendly in the process. And one more thing, great shower and free USA Today. I'd stay here anytime I came to Disneyland.
Manager Response: Thank you for your feedback. We greatly appreciate all of our guests reviews, they help us ensure we exceed our guests expectations. We hope you visit us again soon!  We love having you here!

Summary Heading: Awesome hotel, unbelievably clean, friendly, good breakfast!!
Summary: Our main destination was Disneyland so this hotel was perfect for us.  All the staff were so friendly and helpful, every day, every encounter with them we had.  The ART shuttle service to Disneyland is really great and only takes minutes, all the drivers we had save one were really nice and friendly.  You get on right in the parking lot of the hotel.  The pool area is nice and it has a shallow pool for kids and a hot tub.  The suite we had was perfect, it was modern style, very clean, comfortable beds and two TVs, one for the living room and one for the bedroom.  Even the hide a bed was pretty comfortable!!  No bothering noise that we noticed from other guests, very quiet.  Our suite was at the back of the hotel, might have been a bit noisier facing the front.  The restaurant
Manager Response: We greatly appreciate your feedbank. Thank you, it helps us ensure we meet the expecations of all of our guest. We love having you here at Hampton!

Summary Heading: Third Disney trip in a row where we stayed here!
Summary: It's a good thing this wasn't our first visit here!  We requested a rollaway when we checked in.  Waited 2 hours and then called front desk, only to be informed that they didn't have any.  Uhhh, maybe you could have called & let us know? They eventually borrowed one from another hotel and we got it about 11 pm.  The room was pretty quiet, we couldn't hear the neighbors on either side.  If people would not let their children yell in the hallway, it would have been perfect!   The shower was nice, good water pressure and curved rod.  We like the free breakfast, they are very good about keeping it stocked and the area clean.
Manager Response: We thank you for being a loyal guest and for continuing to stay at our hotel, when you visit the Disneyland area.  We thank you for your feed back and am sorry we didn't deliver the rollaway bed, within an appropriate time frame.  We greatly appreciate hearing from our guests. We like to ensure we are exceeding the expecations of all of our guest. We love having you here at Hampton!

Summary: Last month we stayed @ the Hampton Inn for 4 days and 3 nights, we took our 3 year old daughter to Disneyland and this hotel was a nice place to stay. Rooms were clean, LCD TV, nice comfy beds. The have free breakfast, do not expect to have a full buffet breakfast they don't offer tons of different food but you will save money on it, Cereal, waffles, bagels, eggs, coffee, juice, not bad!! Shuttle bus to Disneyland stops at the Embassy suits all you got to do is cross the parking lot. So it is a good hotel at a good price!!
Manager Response: We thank you for your feedback.  We greatly appreciate all comments. We like to ensure we continue to exceed all of our guests expectations. We hope you visit us again soon!  We love having you here at Hampton!

Summary: This hotel really had it all: Friendly staff, great breakfast, location, comfortable beds, clean spacious rooms!
Manager Response: Thank you for your feedback.  We greatly appreciate all of our guests reviews, they help us ensure we exceed our guests expectations.  We love having you here!

Summary Heading: Average Hampton. Full of kids, busy for having breakfast
Summary: Normal Hampton, good bed, I just think needs a soft remodeling. But it is clean and safe. I was expecting to pay USD 12 / day for parking but as I stayed there for 5 nights, they offered that complimentary. Point for Hampton Garden Grove. It was after Xmas so of course full of kids and teens because of Disney. Good breakfast but it was crowded and of course you lose motivation when you see the line. Ok for Disney, for a couple of days.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Very Nice Hotel But be careful where you park your vehicle!!
Summary: The Hampton Inn is a great hotel for those of you that are going to Disneyland. The rooms were very clean and always cleaned very well daily. The breakfast was very good and breakfast items were always fully stocked.  Also the shuttle to Disneyland was very easy to take. The only downside to staying at the Hampton Inn is the parking!! The parking lot has very narrow parking stalls. I own a Suburban which I parked away towards the back of the Hotel and sombody hit it trying to squeeze in to the stall next to mine and did about $3,500 dollars worth of damage to it. I do realize this happens, but the person who did this chose the cowardly way out of it and didn't report it. So be careful where you park if you have a larger vehicle. To the Management, please install security
Manager Response: Thank you for your response. We endeavor to exceed the expecations of all our guest. I do apologize for the damage to your car. We have our parking lot walked frequently by Management, hotel staff as well as patroled by the Garden Grove Police. If you contact the hotel we will file an incident report for you.

Summary: The Hampton Inn & Suites is an EXCEPTIONAL hotel in the Anaheim area, especially for those of you Disneyland bound.  Their rooms are super, with a kitchen, living room (with hide-a-bed) and large bedroom. They are so nicely appointed with clean fresh amenities.  I cannot say enough great things about this hotel.  And their service is as exceptional as their accommodations.  We've stayed here twice, and have made it our only hotel whenever visiting Anaheim now.
Manager Response: Thanks for the comment. We greatly appreciate all kinds of feedback. It helps us to ensure  we meet the expecations of all of our guest. We love having you here at Hampton.

Summary Heading: Very nice hotel and comfy beds!!
Summary: This was a very clean hotel and the decor was really beautiful. They had all dark wood with sage green walls and white comforters. The beds were sooo comfortable! I always bring my own pillow, because hotel pillows usually suck, but the pillows they had were actually better than my own! Also, the comforters did not have that itchy lining like most places. We did have a slight mishap when we first got there...the t.v. was very fuzzy, but they immediately switched us to a new room and the maintenance man helped move us. They had pretty good breakfast as well. They had sausage, eggs, oatmeal, yogurt, different cereals, various types of milk, juices, and coffees. It was quite a change from the continental breakfasts I've seen in the past with just coffee and a muffin. They also had
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Close to Disneyland and convention center, priced right
Summary: I had three nights booked at a separate hotel and had to add a 4th night but it was full so I ended up at the Hampton Inn. Probably would have preferred to stay all 4 nights there. I'm a fan of free Wi-Fi and the breakfast. Although the buffet breakfasts at Disneyland can be near riots at times and this one had its crowded time also. Overall though, the room, wi-fi, breakfast was roughly $50 less per night, I was closer to the convention center (10-15 minute walk) and could've walked to Disney also. Italian restaurant next door was good, although they could do with about 1/2 the sauce they put on the pasta, holy cow, smothered. When I bring my family I'll definitely consider this property as one of my options.
Manager Response: none

Summary: I stayed at this hotel for 6 days. It was great, rooms where clean, spacious, nice bathrooms and beds. Close to Disneyland and California Adventure as well as good shopping, cinema and fantastic food!   This hotel is ideal for families, our 2 room suite was large and had 2 tvs as well as there where tons of kids running around. I (22) was the oldest non-parents in the pool everytime I went down there! It was fun though and a had a good experience.  THe only thing that was horrible was the breakfast, nothing healthy (except the big bowl on fruit which was either cantaloupe or cantaloupe), over stirred muffins, bad pastries, over cooked bacon, only had jam for toast and had limited toast. Omeletts may have been good but the line up was long, you could pre order but they where
Manager Response: none

Summary: I was very impressed with how nice the room was and the kindness of the front desk. They were very helpful and the rooms were beautiful. WE had the 1bedroom suites and they were very clean and comfortable and very modern. We were 2 families travelling together with teenagers and children and the hotel fit all our needs. The breakfast was OK. Not too much variety but you have your basic breakfast there and it fills the tummy we did go to IHOP twice in the 5nights that we were there though. The hotel has free wireless and they also have 2 computers that are accessible to all. Nice and affordable restaurants surround the property and for those who dont have a car there is a shuttle for $3 one way to disney which is just a 5min drive away.. if your room faces the parking lot you can
Manager Response: none

Summary: We stayed here with students while attending a choir festival. It was clean and well managed. The students who behaved themselves had a great time.  The girl at the desk wasn't to nice or helpful but all other aspects were excellent except parking. It's pretty impacted but I guess if your across the street from Disneyland you might expect that.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Do Not stay in this Hampton
Summary: 1. breakfast was horrible - the only hot item was oatmeal; not good like other hamptons.  I always stay in hamptons because of the breakfast...this was a disappointment. 2.  Pillows are worn - out. When asked for another one, flatly said, "no".
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Not For Business Travel - STAY AWAY
Summary: I am currently in Anaheim for a convention.  As a business traveler who frequents Hilton brand hotels and enjoys them, I will not stay here again.    The rooms are typical for a Hampton Inn.  Clean, Modern, Big.  The beds are very comfortable.  On the downside, there is no fan in the bathroom so it gets uncomfortable.  The Wi-Fi does not work in the hotel rooms.  The only location it will work is in the lobby, and even then it cuts out frequently.  There is no private business center (there are two computers in the lobby), so you are stuck working amongst screaming children running around and obnoxious Disney go-ers (adults who scream as well).  The only positive is the great breakfast.  Hot, Cold, Varied, and Plentiful.  I also appreciated that it lasted until 10am and they
Manager Response: Thank you for your response. All responses assist in the development of our hotel to ensure we exceed the expectations of all of our guest.  I do apologize for the internet issue you encountered during your stay. Please be advised that the internet has been resolved and we now provide High Speed Wireless internet through a new provider throughout the entire property. We do try to keep the business center limited to 18 and older for all guest. Once again, thank you for your comments.  Regards, General Manager

Summary: We were on our first trip to  DISNEYLAND , ANAHEIM . THE STAFF WERE REALLY CORTEOUS . My daughter celebrated her  7 ' TH BIRTHDAY  and the hotel arranged for an song and gift during the breakfast . We thank the   B'FAST HOSTESS MRS JOSEPHINE AND THE HOTEL MANAGER . THEY TOOK AN PHOTO AND GAVE US AN COPY .  My daughter was very happy . Nice breakfast and good location . it is an value for money hotel .
Manager Response: none

Summary: Concierge was a little dumb but the hotel is great. Nice soft pillows and clean rooms. Book the hotel if its lower than $80. If not, don't bother. Complimentary breakfast was the best (not sparse like other hotels).
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Overall good stay but the hi-speed internet sucked
Summary: You will be very disappointed if you try to use the internet. We just came back from a 3 day stay and at times I needed to work but the internet speed was so SLOW.  I recorded speed at three different times during the stay and I was getting the following:  1) Download speed = 251kbps; Upload speed = 78kbps (Wireless) 2) Download speed = 170kbps; Upload speed = 81kbps (Wireless) 3) Download speed = 377kbps; Upload speed = 248kbps (Wired)  Felt like I was using dialup connection.  Even though it was complementary I think they need to be held accountable for this. I don't think they should be allowed to say "Hi-speed internet" unless you meet certain standards.
Manager Response: Thank you for your response. Please be advised that the Internet is now working at the property. We have updated our system with a new provider in July 2009. the entire property is covered with Wirless High Speed Internet for all guest to enjoy while on vacation or working.  Regards,  General Manager

Summary: Had an overall great stay at Hampton Inn Garden Grove.  Stayed 7 nights Apr 21 thru 28.  Got great price on 2 standard rooms through www.getawaytoday.com.  One of the lowest prices we could find for 2 rooms with FULL breakfast, close to DLR.  Pros: (rated 1-10 with 10 being very pleased) [8] Close to restaurants, fast food, department stores [8] Front desk staff - very helpful and friendly [7] Pool/Jacuzzi area outdoor but nice [8] Beds very comfortable, with assorted comfort pillows [6] Nice TV's - approx 32" or 37" LCD/Plasma tv's [5] Nice lobby - 2 computers available with printers, relaxing atmosphere [7] Wireless internet worked everywhere I tried it, and was decent speed most of the time [9] Full breakfast (daily - fresh fruit, bagels, breads for toast, biscuits, yogurts,
Manager Response: none

Summary: Checked in very late after a long flight, and the lady at  the front desk was very efficient and nice to my tired self.  The keys I was handed were to a room on the top floor, which was very, very quiet except for the nightly fireworks over Disneyland. Free internet, superhelpful desk staff (they are great at recommending local places to eat at that are actually good, local places to get anything one runs out of on the road, and I understand that they will even get rental cars upon request), a good size room, and a comfortable bed made for a great weekend of doing nothing!
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: This Hotel made my business trip a true pleasure!
Summary: This hotel was terrific for the money! Anaheim is really a great part of LA with lots of things to do for family or business travel. Close by and might be in walking distance to Disneyland. Lots of great restaurants nearby for family and business. Nice rooms. The hotel offers a good and free hot continental breakfast and served with all the fixins. The outdoor pool and hot tub were in perfect operation and very clean. Staff very accommodating. Nice Business center available to use internet. The Garden Walk open-air mall is nice and only about a mile away...across from Disney. Anaheim is really a great part of LA with lots for adults and kids alike. This place is very family friendly. I saw the kids really loved it.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Loved Our Stay at the Hampton Inn!
Summary: We got a great deal on this hotel through Costco Travel. I would definitely stay here again for futur trips to Disneyland. We stayed here for three nights while visiting Disneyland and were not disappointed. The breakfast every morning was filling and a great deal. There was always a selection of cereals, yogurt, juices, coffee/tea, and a couple hot items like waffles, eggs, or breakfast meats. My favorite breakfast was a bun with eggs, cheese, and bacon on top.   The room was very spacious and clean. The beds were comfortable and I can't think of one complaint I had of the room. The location of the hotel was probably about a few minutes drive to Disneyland. I definitely would not walk the distance. There is also a Target nearby which made it convenient to pick up snacks and
Manager Response: none

Summary: We booked our Disneyland vacation with Costco, they have the best deal. We had 3 adults and 3 kids so we booked the family suite and we were not disappointed. We had a double room , 2 queens and a pull out, sofa with a full kitchen. We never felt crowded and the kids had more then enough room to run around. The room only had one bathroom that didn't have a fan, so it really heated up. The stay included a deluxe continental breakfast with 2 hot items that changed daily. The breakfast was great and the kids always found something that they liked.  The service was great and the front desk was very helpful with all our towel needs. The hotel wasn't too far from the park but not a walkable distance. The kids did watch fireworks one night from our room. We were very happy with the
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Wow, Great Stay for the Price
Summary: We have stayed in several hotels in the Disneyland area over the years.  Most are nothing special.  I wasn't expecting much this time either, it was just a room.  We were very pleasantly surprised.  The staff were all very friendly, professional and helpful.  They didn't seem annoyed that we had children with us (last time we stayed in Anaheim, the staff seemed put off that there where children, at Disneyland...).  The rooms were spotless and very clean.    They had a very simple but nice breakfast each morning.  I have very picky children when it comes to food, but they all found things each morning to eat.  The hotel had a wonderful hostess that would visit and offer maps, directions and advice every morning, and in the evenings served popcorn, pizza and cookies with a family
Manager Response: none

Summary: This hotel was very clean and quiet with newly updated rooms and friendly staff. We were in a suite which was worth the extra money. The rest of our party were in regular rooms. The pool was very nice and even after a big windstorm very clean the next morning. We booked 4 rooms through West Jet 6 months in advance knowing that we would have run of house rooms. We were disappointed that none of our requests for bed type or location were respected even though I called a week before to confirm. The hotel is a long walk from Disney even for active people (we did walk twice) and the Anaheim Transit (ART) did not run nearly as frequently as advertised. We waited 45 minutes twice for buses that are supposed to run every 20 minutes. There is no posted schedule so you can not plan to be

Summary Heading: Maid Left Our Room Door Open!!!
Summary: THE MAID LEFT THE DOOR TO OUR ROOM OPEN!!!!! We returned from Disneyland at about 1:30 a.m. to find our room door propped open by the deadbold arm!  Anything positive we may have had to say is rendered completely irrelevant next to this inexcusable, unacceptable failure.  However, I feel at leave to add a few additional negative comments.   One: The air conditioner drained it's condensation into the room, which created a virtual swamp in the rug. Every time we walked near the air conditioner, our feet squished in the boggy carpet. I let the front desk know, and they told me to put a towel on the floor, and that maintenance would look at it later. One can only wonder how many guests have heard this before.   Two: One morning at around 10:00 a.m., we were disturbed by a knock at

Summary: What a great surprise the Hampton Inn was! After an 8 hour drive all my daughters and I wanted was to check in and head to Disneyland. Approaching the front desk, we were worried it was too early to check in but in the friendly staff told us there was a room available, if we didn't mind the 1st floor. Heck no, it was convienent and the location was perfect. After walking into our room, we tried to turn on the a/c but it was not working, we called the front desk and were told the would have someone from maintenace come right away to fix it. We left for Disneyland and when we came back we had a nice cool room.   The breakfast was not a sit down restaurant style, but a great variety of either take with you or sit down food. The hot breakfast items were not fancy but we grabbed
Manager Response: none

Summary: Stayed at the Hampton Inn Anaheim on a California vacation stop at Disney/California Adventure.  This is a very clean hotel located around 1.5 miles or about a 20 to 25 minute walk to Disney.  There is also shuttle service available for $3 per day.    The hotel staff was excellent from the front desk to the maid service to the breakfast staff.  The rooms are nicely decorated and comfortable.  They offer a great hot breakfast which includes waffels, eggs, sausage, and more.  For lunch or dinner, you can find a Red Robin and an Outback Steakhouse about a block away.  If visiting Disney, I wouldn't hesitate to stay here again.
Manager Response: none

Summary: I've stayed at other Hampton Inns which were tons better, so I expected more out of this one, but I was a little disappointed and have a few gripes. Good points were the beds were comfortable and room was clean and employees/staff were helpful.  Negative: 1) Bathroom did not have a fan.  When I called the front desk to report it wasn't working they said it was intentional...there are no fans in the bathroom.  I believe circulation in a bathroom is a must!  2) They advertised 'full breakfast' however, all it is is a glorifed continental breakfast.  They sometimes served eggs and sausage, but both were gross to be honest.  The pastries were old and cold.  When they ran out they ran out even though it was 8am and breakfast ended at 10am.  If in that area again I will most likely

Summary Heading: Great Value, Good Service, Comfortable Stay
Summary: We (family of 2 adults, 2 kids) decided to go with a 2* hotel as we were visiting Disneyland and really only needed a place to sleep. The Hampton Inn fitted our requirements and exceeded our expectations.   Checkin was a breeze. Front desk service was polite and welcoming.   Our room was recently renovated and had new furniture. Our beds were most comfortable. The room included a microwave and a small refridgerator. You can easily buy food items from the Target that is close by on Harbor and Chapman St.  The complimentary breakfast had hot items and healthy items (i.e. fresh fruit and yogourt). This included breakfast saved us sooo much time in the morning. We didn't have to look for a place to have breakfast, wait to be seated, wait to pay, etc.   Thurs-Sun offered free
Manager Response: none

Summary: We stayed 5 nights.  Having stayed at other hotels in the Disneyland area, we wanted something a little farther away from all the hubbub.  We stayed on the 7th floor and it was very quiet.  The breakfast was the standard Hampton Inn breakfast--it satisfied our hungry 10 and 12 year old boys.  The breakfast room was large and we never had a problem finding a table.  The hotel is not really within walking distance of Disneyland but the front desk said there was a shuttle available.  We just drove our own car and parked in the Disney garage.  The hotel is easily accessible from I-5 and CA-57 freeways.  The pool was nice and never really crowded.  There is a small kiddie pool (1 foot deep) and a hot tub.  The staff was accommodating and courteous.  One of the employees visited each

Summary: It's located off of Harbor Blvd. in Camarillo right near the Naval Base. We stayed there for the 4th of July. The hotel was recently refurbished and remodeled for the Hampton Inns. We booked the suite, which was great, because we fit two extra cots. The bed was a king. The cots were similar to nice twin beds for the children. It was cozy and warm. The staff was friendly and professional. I used the gym. There were three machines and an excellent tv which I used most of the time. There was hardly anyone there. My family swam in the small pool. Great. The bed was cozy and the shower was nice. The food was fresh and they kept the eating area clean. The decor was very HIP. Everything matched. Summary Heading: Don't forgrt your LYSOL when you stay at this hotel
Summary: My family booked a 7 night stay at this hotel using Disney Travel. First off, I would never book through them again, because if there is a problem, good luck getting your money back. Secondly, we noticed hair ont he bathroom floor and nasty stuff around the faucets (we stayed in a suite) and I mentioned it to the hotel staff. Here it is day 6 of 8 and this issue still hasn't been addressed. It took them two days to get the "included" hairdryer that was supposed to be in our room up there. The lady at the front desk acted as if I was lying about there not being one. And when I finally convinced her that there really was not a hairdryer already in our room, she called up (even though I requested she not do so because it owuld wake my family) and ended up waking them all. The deck
Manager Response: none

Summary: My husband and I, along with our two young sons stayed at the Hampton in May 2007 for the first time while visiting Disneyland.  We had such a great experience that we returned this year.    First of all, the rooms are clean, which is my #1 priority.  We booked a suite with two queen beds and a pull-out sofa bed.  If you are going to Disneyland for more than a couple of days, I definitely recommend getting a suite.  It comes with a cooktop, full size refrigerator, toaster, dishwasher and coffeemaker.  Pans, utensils, mugs, glasses are all included.  We drove to Target down the block to get a few groceries to make lunches for afternoons in the park.  This can really save money and having the kitchen is helpful when you have small children who may need their milk or a snack later
Manager Response: none

Summary: My husband and our 2 young children stayed here while vacationing at Disneyland. We booked a 1 bedroom suite and just loved the place. Very comfortable beds, fluffy towels, clean, nice view from balcony, and very family friendly. Great breakfast with a nice variety of items. Don't let the fact that they are remodeling scare you away. This hotel was the quietest place I've ever stayed and I never heard any hints of construction going on. The free parking is great and the kids pool was a real treat for my 1 1/2 year old. I have no complaints about Hampton Inn. We will always stay here on our future trips to Disneyland.

Summary: Very child friendly hotel with excellent service.  The staff went above and beyond.  Everything was very clean.  The beds were heavenly.  The breakfast was delicious!  Would definately recommend this hotel to anyone:)
Manager Response: none

Summary: We stayed at this Hampton Inn in March during our visit to Disneyland and surrounding area.  It was a wonderful stay.  We had a specific request which they were able to accomodate.  The rooms were comfortable, clean, good size, well insulated (very quiet), helpful staff, generous breakfast, cookies for a snack, and great location.  Nice pool, kiddie pool and hot tub.  Lovely terrace for breakfast or to relax.  While this is not a newly renovated property, the bedding is new, beds comfy and furnishings were just fine.  The shuttle for Disneyland is just next door at the Embassy Suites and tickets can be purchased at the hotel.  They also had a nice gift shop with water and other items that was handy. Summary Heading: Maybe the best Hampton in the chain
Summary: Forgot to write this review. This is one fabulous Hampton. Very clean, accommodating. Great rooms, staff...The "Hilton" complex they are in with the Garden Inn and Embassy is very nice. Several types of rooms are available. This is the PERFECT place for families to stay when going to Disney. There are fun rooms themed for children with bunks and play tables. Prices are great too...

Summary: We stayed here primarily for its proximity to Disneyland.  You could walk there but we didn't as it's a tad too far with two little ones who'd already be walking all day.  It far exceeded our expectations and the hotel staff were super friendly.  My only complaint was that the pool was freezing, but my kids didn't seem to mind!  Breakfast was excellent and had plenty of choices.  The room was extremely clean and included fridge and microwave at no extra charge which was critical for us for drinks and late night snacks.  Our bath was blocked and they came and fixed it within minutes.  We stayed on a higher floor, and there was never any shortage of elevators.  The ac/heat unit worked well.    We'd definitely stay here again - best price was through getawaytoday.com, but their own

Summary: Our family has just returned from a 10 day stay at the Hampton Inn, Our Vacation was wonderful, but the Hotel needs a reality check. We stayed at the Hampton two years ago, and it had been really nice, so we choose to stay again, I really wish we hadnt. The kitchen in the Suite, had torn lino, the bathroom is in need of tile and grout repair, the Suite looked very tired. Summary: We stayed at the Garden Grove Hampton the last night of our southern California vacation. I was a little disapointed because it was my least favorite of the hotels we stayed in and I wanted to save the best for last. It was a clean, nice room and the staff was very friendly. I was a little disappointed in the decor. It seemed a little 80s to me, but it was okay. The breakfast was nice and the room has a fridge/microwave. The King bed was comfortable too.

Summary Heading: Okay - But Not The Best Hampton Inn I've Stayed At
Summary: My occupation has me traveling every week. Therefore, I stay in a different hotel every week; always in a smoking room.   Overall, this is an 'okay' place; not the worst room I've ever had, but certainly not the best either. I was there for 5 nights and had to request a blanket 4 times...finally received one the last night.  Additionally, the TV didn't work the first night (they fixed it for the second night), no ice bucket, and it seems my desk was missing.  Whether true or not, I got the feeling this was the room they took stuff out of when another room needed a replacement item.  I stay nearly exclusively at Hilton properties (Diamond VIP Status) and the cleanliness of this room was lacking; dirty shower curtain, un-vacuumed areas of the room, windows you could barely see out
