Summary Heading: Excellent location and nice and clean!
Summary: We spent 5 nights at this property and had a wonderful stay. The property is very clean and well maintained. The breakfast was typical of the chain but well stocked with a different hot item all 5 mornings. Our room was very clean, comfortable and quiet. We had the king suite with bunkbeds and our kids loved having the real beds instead of the usual sleeper sofa. This hotel is not an easy walk to Disney but we didn't expect to walk anyway as we always had something else to do in the evening so we drove. Parking is plentiful and the property seems safe and secure and was well lighted. The business area was in the open and was often in use by some kids playing internet computer games. We would definately stay here again if we came back to this area.
Manager Response: none

Summary: we booked our trip through aaa.  we had a wonderful experience.  The beds were SUPER COMFY.  after a long day at the park it was just what the dr. ordered.  The hotel was being renovated so the pool was closed.  that was not biggie for us though.. we had a packed schedule with character dinners and breakfasts  and had not really planned on using the pool. So i cannot comment on the pool. (sorry)   As for the staff.  we found them to be friendly and helpful.  the breakfast were great.  Filled our bellies for a long day at the park.   WE were at disney 3 full days and we did the halloween trick or treat.  (that was great) i did a full review in the anaheim room about that.   anyway all in all .. great trip great stay .. we would definately stay at this property again.  i actually

Summary: Just got back from a 4-night stay at the Hampton Inn Garden Grove and once again, my husband and I were more than satisfied with our Hampton experience. We try to stay at a Hampton Inn whenever we travel, because we have found that they provide much better than average service and ammenities for the price. This visit was no exception. We checked in quite late after a long drive, and the young lady at the front desk was very efficient and courteous. Our room requests (upper floor, Disney view) were all fulfilled, despite our late check in, and we were tucked in and dreaming within a half hour of arrival. The front desk lady told us to "go to Disneyland".....not amused I told her that we would wait for 30 minute check in and be back at 3:00, we were tired and needed a place to rest.  We returned at 3:15, the lady did not recognize us, or was pretending that she never saw us before, stating again, our room was not ready. Summary: Myself, my parents and my two children, ages 8 & 6, stayed here and were pleased with the cleanliness, customer service and morning breakfasts.  For the price, close location to Disneyland and hot breakfasts each morning, we felt it was a bargain!  The drawbacks were scratchy bath towels, pool was closed because the outside of the building was being painted (but we got to use the pool next door at Embassy Suites, which was nice), no fan in toilet/shower area, so a bit steamy, and no light blockage from vanity area to where others were still sleeping.  For a short stay, these were things we could easily live with.  We did not use the bus system to get to Disneyland, since my folks had free parking using their Disneyworld Employee Cards. Summary: Thought the Hampton Inn was a very nice hotel.  I stayed in a standard room with two queen beds.  The room was very nicely decorated and modern looking.  The beds were extremely comfortable which made it hard to wake up in the mornings.  The room consisted of a desk, recliner, small fridge and microwave.  One drawback, the bathroom's sink was located on the inside of the bathroom and there was no fan.  This makes it difficult when there is more than one person getting ready in the mornings.  There was ample room in the closet and dresser drawers for your clothes.  The breakfast in the morning was very good and had a variety of different foods to meet your needs and every morning was a different selection. Summary: Hampton Inn takes guest satisfaction very seriously, which is fantastic.  This hotel lives up to Hampton Inn's deserved reputation.  Rooms were clean and efficiently laid out and wireless internet was great.  Beds were pretty comfortable.   Breakfast was fairly generous even by Hampton Inn standards.  There are even a couple computers provided in the lobby for those who wish to access the internet but didn't bring a computer.  My room on the parking lot side was a little noisy;  several other reviewers recommend staying on the Disneyland side of the Hotel to get to see the fireworks;  I'd recommend that request just for quiet. Summary Heading: Hampton - Excellent for Family at Disneyland
Summary: We recently returned from our Southern California vacation which included a stay at the Hampton Inn & Suites from August 15-18th.  It was exactly the hotel for us!  We had a two queen suite for my husband, I, and our two sons ages 10, 11.  The kids shared a bed which was plenty big for them, and the two room suite idea was definitely the way to go.  At night they could go to bed watching a little t.v., while my husband and I sat in the living room or on the balcony and had our own t.v.  Our balcony overlooked the parking lot on the side toward disneyland so not a great view, but we could see many of the fireworks on the nights we didn't make it until the park closed. Summary Heading: GREAT HOTEL, VERY COMFY.   (SACTOWN FAMILY OF 4)

The pillows and comforter were so soft and so white.  Whenever we returned after a day in the Park, the room smelled so fresh.  We stayed at the Sheraton last time.  The one with the Castle theme next to the freeway.  We had to change rooms there, the first room leaked, beds were awful , smelled like smoke in a non-smoking room.  This hotel was great.  Definitely would stay again.    The Hotel staff was so nice.  They even booked our tour to Hollywood on a tour bus.  All we did was give a deposit at the front desk.  Now, how easy was that?  I ask.   The breakfast was very good, with hot items.  We took the ART shuttle to

Summary: We had a great stay at this Hampton Inn.  It was very clean and the beds were comfy.  The desk folks were very helpful.  Close to Disney.  Took the car but even the closest hotels to Disney were not that close and we would have still taken the car.  One icky thing (out of the hotel's control).  The restaurant, Buca di Beppa, was draining their septic the morning we left and the smell was beyond horrific.  Matter of fact, we smelled sewer here and there in Anaheim.  It is definitely more built up than when we were there several years ago.    All in all, the Hampton was a great place to stay and great value.

Summary Heading: Nice place to stay for a Disneyland weekend

Summary: We had a good time while staying at the Hampton Inn & Suites and going to Disneyland.  The rooms was clean and nicely furninshed.  The bed was super comfy.  Wireless internet was strong. The breakfast was nice and there was always coffee and fresh fruit available all day.  The parking lot is a tight squeeze for larger cars, but it's free. Summary Heading: Great place to stay for Disneyland
Summary: We recently stayed at Hampton Inn Anaheim for two nights so we could do one day at Disneyland. We really liked the hotel. We had a room that had one king bed and two bunk beds. It was really a nice room. It even had a small TV for the bunk beds, and each bunk bed had it's own light. There is no real wall to seperate the bunk beds from the king bed, it is more like a half wall, but it is ok.   Brief overview: The free internet work great! The breakfast was average. The hotel staff was very nice and friendly.  The location was perfect.   We would stay here again.

We could come back from Disneyland, make an in room snack, rest or swim in the pool or spa, and go back to the park.  I would stay here again anytime.  In fact, it was far superior to the luxery hotels we stayed in the rest of our time in Southern California.  Bonus... we could see the fireworks from Disney from our room!

Summary: My wife and I were on our honeymoon and stayed at the Hampton Inn.  Overall I would have to say that it was well worth the money, and we had a good time.  I would recommend this Hotel to anyone.

Summary: We stayed here for a week in February of 2007.  My parents were in an adjoining room (King) and my family of 4 (2 kids aged 8 and 6) were in a suite.  Both rooms were very nice but if you can afford the extra money get the suite.  It has a living room/kitchen that is separate from the bedroom so you can put the kids to bed and still visit or watch tv. Everything was very good to excellent. Staff was super friendly and helpful, rooms were very clean, hotel was reasonably quiet, many ammenities, excellent breakfast included, etc. It was great to come back to this room after a long day touring. Summary Heading: Would recommend and stay there again!
Summary: Stayed here December 22 & 23 with 3 adults, one being my 82 year old mother.  The room was on the main side of the building facing the main parking area and restaurant (Bucca di Peppo? spelling).  The room was very clean and the beds were super comfortable.  The staff was friendly and helpful.  Getting to Disney on the Shuttle was a breeze and getting the tickets for the shuttle was simple.  The complimentary breakfast had hot choices (pancakes, egg mcmuffin) and cold choices (fruit, cereal, muffins).  The hotel price was reasonable for a holiday/weekend.  The only concern was our room, being on the same side as the parking lot and hotel pool, was a little noisey at night.  We were on the 7th floor, so it wasn't too bad.  Our expectations were met and we would go back again.

We found the staff very nice and they answered every question we had.   The weather was a little to cool to enjoy the pool area but it appeared clean. Summary: Our family of 5 stayed at the Hampton Inn Garden Grove in late September for 4 nights.  We were very pleased with the accommodations, and have no complaints.  We were able to see the Disney fireworks from our hotel room, and we were only on the second floor. Our family just wanted a quick bite to eat so we could head out early to the theme parks.  There were plenty of good restaurants within walking distance of the hotel, and the hotel actually shares a parking lot with Buca di Beppo.  The hotel is too far to walk to Disneyland.

Summary Heading: Comfortable Beds- Good Breakfast - Gym & Service So-So
Summary: I knew from previous stays in the Garden Grove/Anaheim ares that there are 3 Hilton properties within 1 Block of each other: Hilton Garden Inn (HG), Embassy Suites (ES) and Hampton Inn (HI). In fact, they share the same big parking lot & use the same shuttle service. I've stayed in all 3 so here's a comparison: - Hampton Inn is slightly more expensive ($120) than the Hilton Garden ($99); but about $10-$20 less than the ES ($140). Hampton it's the most "kid friendly" - lots of drawings by young "Artists in residence" in the lobby. It's cleaner than the ES but not as clean as the HG. This is probably because the Hilton Garden is newer; but also there are fewer families with kids staying there.  - HI's breakfast was good: fresh friuit, decent pastries, flavored, regular, "robust"

Summary Heading: Hampton Inn - Garden Grove is awesome!
Summary: We stayed at the Hampton Inn suites Oct 6- Oct 10th. It was great It VERY clean! The breakfast is great. There are quite a few restaurants nearby. I would recommend this hotel to anyone! We had a standard room with 2 queen beds. the other part of our party had a suite (1 bedroom with 2 queen beds, the living room had a pull out bed) and a kitchennette. CLEAn (did I say this yet)   The only thing I may complain about was that the hottubs are not open late (close at 10pm) it would be nice to get in them after the park closed at 12am) but who knows may not have used it anyways.  They have a computer / internet in lobby for use, also wireless internet if you bring your laptop.  We took the ART shuttle to and from disneyland and was very convienient (every 20 min)  They also have
Manager Response: none

Summary: We just returned from a 5 night stay at the Hampton Inn in Garden Grove.  This hotel's biggest positive is the full complimentary breakfast.  This is not only a money saver but it saves time in the morning too.  The breakfast is buffet style but it's a bit of a free-for-all at times.  Lots of bumping into other guests and "oops, sorry" trying to get around people just to get a glass of juice or whatever.  They never run out of food however and it really is quite good.  Room was very clean and spacious.  We had 2 king beds and family of 4.  The maids we had were efficient at cleaning the room but don't speak any english.  Front desk was helpful enough but not the cheeriest bunch.  Location was handy to various restaurants and there is also a Target within easy walking distance
Manager Response: none

Summary: Just spent three nights here and was very satisfied for the most part.  We arrived and were pleased to see the front door even locks at 11:00 pm and you need to use your keycard to get in.  We were impressed with the free breakfast, always well stocked and changes every day.  Always hot food to get you going in the morning. Our room (A one bedroom suite) was spacious and had a nice kitchenette.  The garbage can is the size of a shoe box though.  After eating a snack it is full, don't know how anyone could cook a meal and have garbage.  The best part was staying on the 5th flooor and watching Disney's fire works. Anyone who says they walk to Disney from here is insane.  It's far and at the end of the day kids are too tired to walk back.  Shuttle is $3 person so it worked out
Manager Response: none

Summary: We just got back from a five night stay at the Hampton Inn. Evereything was great , our room was immaculate. The free breakfast was very good and there were quite a few choices every morning . The people at the front desk were great . I asked them for directions 2 times and each time they printed out detailed directions from the computer.I was a little skeptical when I read one of the previous reviews abouth the back door not being locked and their room being broken into, one night we parked near the rear of the hotel and  tried to use the rear door . There was a sign on it saying that the door was locked and when I tried to use my key it did not open. The pool area was great for my little 4 year old nephew who was with us because they have a little 1 foot wading pool for
Manager Response: none

Summary: I too used the back door during my 5 night stay in July and luckily for me the door was always locked. I am very sorry for other's unfortunate experiences but I always felt safe in this location. The breakfasts were some of the best my family has experienced from a complimentary location.  The staff was very helpful both when explaining the shuttle system and when arranging transportation to Knotts. Lastly we were allowed to check in at noon, several hours before check-in.
Manager Response: none

Summary: My family stayed here while visiting Disneyland.  We would use the back door of the hotel that says it is locked at all times and you have to use a room key to access it.  Little did we know, it was completely UNLOCKED allowing ANYONE access to the hotel.  Three days into our stay, our room was broken into and many of our things were stolen.  That is when a police officer informed us that the back security door was unlocked.  Management was made aware of the unlocked door, and two days later it was still unlocked.  We no longer went anywhere near the stairwell, because we also feared for our personal safety.  With so many hotels to choose in the Disneyland/Anaheim area, choose one that appreciates their guests safety.  DON"T stay here!
Manager Response: none

Summary: After reading all of the wonderful reviews of this hotel, I booked a room for five nights for four people (two adults, two teenagers).  The room was small, but clean and the beds were quite comfortable.  I was rather disappointed to find the plastic drinking glasses and styrofoam cups, but I guess it's understandable in such a high traffic location.  I was less than impressed with the service during our stay.  We had to call the front desk to request extra hangers (6 hangers is not enough for four people), coffee, drinking glasses and coffee cups (these were not replaced when our room was made up), and a garbage can for the bathroom (there was only one small can in the room).  It took almost an hour for these items to be delivered.  The staff did not seem to be very
Manager Response: none

Summary: Check in is normally 3pm and we arrived at noon. They made accomodations for us to check into one of our two bedroom suites at 1:30. They were fantastic. The breakfasts are amazing! The rooms were very quiet. We had a two bedroom suite on the 6th floor overlooking Disneyland for the fireworks that we could waych from our room. Very cool! I would highly recommend!
Manager Response: none

Summary: March 23 - April 1, 2005 We loved staying at the Hampton Inn & Suites Anaheim/Garden Grove.  It was super convenient, and the ART shuttle ran every 20 minutes from our hotel.  We were there for 9 nights and the only complaint we have is the speed of the elevator.  They were very friendly, and the breakfast was a huge bonus.  We have stayed at the Hampton Inn & Suites in other cities, and would recommend it to anyone travelling to Disneyland.  The pool was a big hit with the kids, and the fitness room was great for the adults.  We faced north and from our balcony watched the fireworks every night at 9:25.  I loved the suite and the fact that we could shut the door to the bedroom and not disturb the kids while we visited with friends in the livingroom area.  Hats off to the
Manager Response: none

Summary: April 2, 2005 We just returned from a hockey tournament in Anaheim California.  Our entire hockey team booked at the Hampton Inn & Suites Anaheim, Garden Grove and had a wonderful experience.  Everything was great, the service was excellent, and if there were any minor problems they were dealt with immediately.  We stayed in a suite, and it was refreshing to have the living room and kitchen area in a separate room from the sleeping area and bathroom. The only issue worth mentioning is the elevator is the slowest we have ever experienced, so we did a LOT of stair climbing. Summary: Based on the other reviews of this hotel, we were disappointed during our recent stay over spring break.  The beds were not comfortable and the pillows were terrible.  The arm chairs in the room actually were worn through to the stuffing and bottomed out when you sat in them.  There was a lot at breakfast but it wasn't very good with the exception of the biscuits.  Overall, we had the impression of a hotel in real need of a remodel.  We won't stay there again.
Manager Response: none

Summary: We stayed here during the first weekend in December and found the room to be quite roomy.  The morning breakfast was pretty good and they have a nice area to sit and watch tv.  The shuttle comes every half hour to go to Disneyland which is convinent.  The only problem is when the shuttle arrives at Disneyland you are the dropped off at the furthest part in the white section.  This was a little inconvienent for us since we had a handicapped person in our group and it made it difficult for her to walk to the front gate to get her wheel chair.  Other then that I would stay here again.
Manager Response: none

Summary: This was the second time this year that we have stayed at the Hampton and we loved it.  The fist time was in May and we got a room with bunk beds which the kids thought was great!  Our last stay was Nov. 5th -7th and we had more kids so we had a suite with two beds and a pull out couch.  Everything was clean, the staff was great, the room was wonderful, and breakfast was good.  Eggs, sausage, great breads, and fresh pastries.  My 13 year old even commented on the fact that her standard cheese danish was wonderful and didn't taste like preservatives like they usually do.  Disneyland shuttles every 30 minutes until well after the park closes.  This will always be my family's choice in the future.  It's nice not to worry about what you are going to get in a hotel, especially around
Manager Response: none

Summary: Our family just returned from a four night stay, Oct. 2-6.  We had two connecting rooms, a family suite and a regular king room.  At check-in we were told the only king room available was a handicapped room, but that the only difference was things were lower.  As experienced travelors we weren't so sure but took the room.  After checking it out we discovered that yes there are differences and it was not a suitable room for a four night stay.  The front desk personnel were very helpful and had us in another two rooms within minutes without any hassel.  We also had a problem with the air conditioner not working but the maintenance person was very friendly and got it working as soon as possible, as well as a small problem with one of the televisions in the other room. Manager Response: none

Summary: Our family stayed at the Hampton July 7-17/04 and recommend this hotel 100%.  Rooms are spotless, hotel staff friendly and the breakfast is above the normal continental of buns and coffee.  Pancakes, waffles, muffins, yoghurt, fruit and cereals abound.  If an item is empty the staff refills quickly!You are more than welcome to eat in the breakfast area or take it all back to your room.  I recommend taking your meal outside on the patio next to the pool.  The staff will answer all your tourist questions..even supply pre-printed directions to major attractions...they have little cards typed up with detailed routes to wherever you want to go.  The shuttle is always on time.  The Hampton is the first stop in the morning to Disneyland and the first drop off when you want to return.
Manager Response: none

Summary: We stayed at the Hampton Inn in October 2003 for a family vacation to Disneyland. The staff was helpful and accommodating. The continental breakfast had great variety and the shuttle to the park was very convenient. We were travelling with my parents who are notoriously picky about accommodations and they were thrilled. I would recommend the property and will stay again.
Manager Response: none

Summary: Just returned from a 9 night stay at the Hampton. Wonderful! The lady at the front desk let us check in at 10:00 am. I also got the room I had requested. Our room was fairly big with 2 queen beds (so comfy) fridge, microwave, and a nice size bathroom. The place is VERY clean and the staff bends over backwards for you. The continental breakfast is VERY good and is served from 6:00 am- 10:00 am. Breakfast is 5 types of cereals, bagels and cream cheese, toast, toaster waffles, microwaveable pancakes, oatmeal, boiled eggs, muffins, pastries, yogurt, fresh fruit, 3 types of juices, coffee, tea, and cocoa.  Everything was FRESH! The shuttle service to DL runs every 1/2 hour and only shares with the Hilton Garden Inn, so there's no problem getting a seat on the bus. Last bus back from
Manager Response: none

Summary: We stayed at this hotel for 4 nights this month. It was a perfect family hotel: large rooms, big frig, microwave, good breakfast, pool.  To top it off our room (711) had a view of the Disneyland fireworks at night!
Manager Response: none

Summary: This hotel was excellant - the room was very clean and had microwave, refrigerator and coffee maker in the room. Even though a number of school children where staying in the hotel you never heard them.
Manager Response: none

Summary: We stayed there begining of June. Suite offered plenty of room for our family of 5. Everything was clean and staff was very helpful. The toaster didn't work, but was fixed in <15 min. Breakfast was great for continental. Definitely stay there next time.
